My old over-the-ear headphones were great and lasted years. When they died I went on the search for new ones and these came recommended. They sound even better than they look; mids, treble and bass. The bass isn't overwhelming like my previous set, but more blended and realistic. The volume is fantastic, as is noise cancelling. Controls are easily accessible and straightforward to use. The packaging is sublime, with a neat carry case to look after my new folding headset. They are extremely comfortable to wear, as I did this entire past week. I wouldn't wear them at the gym, but they are perfect for my daily travels and leisure listening at home. Battery life is very good too. A very happy purchase.

Pleasantly surprised by the build-quality, comfort, carry-case and connectivity for the money. Battery-life is excellent and the usbC connection, also enabling fast-charging, and Bluetooth 5.0 are both a bonus still not found on some much more expensive models. Sound-quality and noise-cancelling may not be quite up to the standard of the top of the range and pricey offerings from other manufacturers but are nevertheless quite acceptable to my non-audiophile ears, especially at this price, and they make air-travel a much more peaceful and enjoyable experience at reasonable cost. Push-button are a little small and 'clicky' but my main gripe is the fact that I bought these as the advertising and one of the question answers both state that these are "low-latency" headphones but the "LL" connection indicator light on my bluetooth transmitter does not illuminate when these 'phones are connected and a slight delay in the sound is also still noticeable when watching tv so I suspect they do not actually support the Qualcomm aptX LL codec necessary for minimal delay. Otherwise satisfied with my purchase, as long as I remember to turn off the ANC to avoid draining the battery since this does not automatically switch off with the power button!

So we all know that Bose are the leaders in sound quality but they cost alot of money. My Mrs has 3 different pairs of house headphones from ¬£140 to ¬£300 and there's no denying they are great but..... Expensive. So I decided to try these as they offered everything I wanted and were only ¬£59.99. The noise cancelling doesn't work as well as Bose' but they do remove the base levels from background noise and it is noticeable. The sound quality is really good and even the Mrs said for the money she was blown away with how good they were. They are easy to pair, come in a nice hard case for travelling and have a long battery life of approx 40hrs. They control the volume, skipping tracks, answer/decline calls and even activate "OK Google" on your phone. The build is good and feel well made although not as robust as Bose but again you're only paying a fraction so I can't complain and I'm very happy with them.

Cuffie acquistate per un'amica che non ama gli auricolari in-ear con i gommini. Mi ha riferito che stanno bene all'orecchio, non cadono e non danno alcun fastidio anche se utilizzate per lungo tempo. Mi sono piaciute le alternative di comandi che si possono dare utilizzando i due tastini posti sugli auricolari: ‚èÆÔ∏è brano precendente ‚ñ∂ Play ‚è∏ Pausa ‚è≠ Brano successivo ‚èπÔ∏èSpegni ‚úîÔ∏è Rispondere ad una chiamata Altra cosa utile √® che si pu√≤ utilizzare un auricolare per volta, sia destro che sinistro. L'accoppiamento Bluetooth con lo smartphone √® velocissimo. Basta aprire il cofanetto e si √® subito connessi. La durata della batteria in ascolto a tutto volume ha raggiunto le 4 ore abbondanti, a volume normale secondo me superano tranquillamente le 5 ore. La qualit√† del suono √® pazzesca, considerando il prezzo di queste cuffie. Suono potente, bassi corposi, alti ben distinguibili, un buon equilibrio che va bene per la maggior parte degli ascolti. Se non fossero in-ear le comprerei subito anche per me, purtroppo non amo il modello iPhone, perch√© non si adatta al mio orecchio. Quindi, se usate questo tipo di auricolari senza problemi quotidianamente vi consiglio di passare a queste true wireless Bluetooth. Sono davvero comode.

En los √∫ltimos d√≠as he comprado varios auriculares para regalar, y estos me han gustado tanto que se los voy a regalar a la persona que m√°s entiende. Me ha sorprendido lo bien que suenan para su peque√±o tama√±o. Los graves muy profundos y los agudos muy claros. A diferencia de otros auriculares de tama√±o reducido, el sonido es bastante bueno. Los he probado durante un par de horas y todav√≠a les queda un 80% de bater√≠a. El emparejamiento es muy sencillo, aparecen en el tel√©fono y se emparejan de momento. Para apagarlos, simplemente se meten en la caja y se cierra la tapa, y se apagan solos. Se encienden autom√°ticamente al volver a sacarlos de la caja. Los botones que traen hacen diferentes funciones seg√∫n los toques: Si se mantienen pulsados suben o bajan el volumen, si se dan dos toques cambia de canci√≥n, y si se da un solo toque hace la funci√≥n de pausa. En llamada tambi√©n se oyen muy bien, he hablado con ellos por la calle y mi interlocutor dice que se me o√≠a perfectamente. La √∫nica pega que le encuentro es que no traen un im√°n para pegarse a la caja, otros modelos s√≠ que se fijan a la base por im√°n y da sensaci√≥n de quedarse m√°s sujeto. Este se sujeta por la tapa de la caja. Estar√≠a bien que para futuras actualizaciones le pusieran un peque√±o im√°n. En resumen, muy buenos. Recomendable!

Pros: Look much better in black than white, small, easy to set uo Cons: Sound is a bit thin unless pressed into ears Addition of silicon covers to help the fit makes a HUGE difference to the sound, especially the bass. Bought black ones designed to fit Airpods, work a treat!

I always wanted one of these but fear it might fall out of my earhole, but i was so wrong. I wore them in the gym, it didnt fall out once. Easy pairing with good battery life. It has good noise cancelling with good sound quality. I like the case alot looks very slick and does the recharging when its closed.

Era da tempo che cercavo delle cuffie senza i gommini a contatto con le orecchie e senza spendere un patrimonio; ho visto questo prodotto ho letto le recensioni e mi sono convinto. (ps: i gommini si possno mettere se volete) Prima impressione: pacchetto minimal, ma in senso positivo, possiamo dire molto apple-style. Confezione elegante che a mio avviso ne fanno una ottima idea regalo. Nella confezione le cuffie, la sua custodia di ricarica e il cavo usb di ricarica. Le cuffie sono arrivate cariche all'70% e la cosa mi aggrada perch√® sappiamo che se arrivano scatiche o troppo cariche la batteria ne risente. Appena accese lo ho subito associate al mio smartphone andoid (testate anche con iphone e subito riconosciute). Mi piace come premesso il feeling senza gommini, anche perch√® un minimo di rumore esterno lo voglio sentire per non rischiare di finire sotto le auto. Test audio: vanno da dio; si sentono meglio delle cuffie sol filo samsung che avevo; i bassi ci sono ed √® la cosa che spesso alle cuffie manca. I pulsanti a sfioro sulle cuffie sono una goduria e finora non hanno mai sbagliato un colpo. Io tengo il livello batteria compreso tra 10% e 90% al fine di salvaguardala al meglio e per ora le cuffie durano circa 4 ore, per cui sono stra contento.
Really easy to pair with the phone, soon as I turned it on I loved it. The sound quality is good and it lasted a long time! Solid Product, would recommend!

The earbuds are great for the price and seems to be all working fine. The third time I picked them up to use them the back of one just fell off exposing the wires and wouldn't go back on, so not very happy with this at all and I will be asking for a refund
Straight out of the box the sound kept dropping in and out from both ear buds Very disappointing

Auriculares muy c√≥modos y no pesan nada. Se vinculan perfectamente con mi tel√©fono Xiaomi y mi tablet Samsung. Una calidad de sonido muy buena, al menos para m√≠ sin ser un experto. Effettuata la prima associazione con il telefono, molto rapida e semplice, le cuffie si connetteranno automaticamente con il cellulare ogni qual volta se ne toglier√† una dal case, la musica viene riprodotta anche con una cuffietta sola e l‚Äôassociazione tra destra e sinistra √® immediata, purtroppo per√≤ se riposte nel case non si disconnettono. Sulla parte lunga delle cuffiette √® presente un tasto fisico che permette tramite un click di mettere in pausa o riprodurre la musica dal telefono e con un click prolungato attiva l‚Äôassistente vocale. Il suono √® buono leggermente gracchiante e gli alti non sono perfetti, le chiamate sufficienti si sente molto bene l‚Äôinterlocutore, le cuffie isolano bene, ma lui sente i suoni di sottofondo, anche se capisce tutto quello che diciamo. Per concludere in confezione troviamo un cavo micro usb per ricaricarle e tre coppie di gommini per migliorare, se necessario, la compatibilit√† con il padiglione uditivo, devo dire che io mi sono trovato bene con quelle gi√† inserite e anche durante una sessione di palestra non sono mai cadute. En cette p√©riode de canicule, il est inconcevable pour moi d'√©couter de la musique dans les transports avec mon casque habituel. Je ne connaissais pas l'existence des √©couteurs √† conduction osseuse jusqu'au jour o√π un coll√®gue m'en parle et me fait tester 10 secondes son Aftershokz Trek Air. J'ai √©t√© s√©duit par son design, sa l√©g√®ret√© et surtout son c√¥t√© tr√®s ouvert. Je me suis d√©cid√© √† prendre ce type de casque. J'ai finalement opt√© pour l'Aftershokz Aeropex. Apr√®s plusieurs recherches sur le net, il s'av√®re qu'il s'agit du meilleur casque √† conduction osseuse √† ce jour. Le packaging est vraiment top, on voit tout de suite qu'il s'agit d'un produit finit et soign√©. J'ai √©t√© un peu d√©rout√© par la pr√©sence de 2 c√¢bles, de la sacoche √† fermeture magn√©tique mais surtout des bouchons d'oreilles. Le casque est quant √† lui tr√®s l√©ger et la qualit√© de restitution du son (aigu, m√©dium) n'a presque rien √† envier aux casques classiques √† l'exception des basses. Ces derniers manquent cruellement de punch malgr√© les am√©liorations faites par rapport aux Trek Air. La restitution des voix est vraiment top √©galement. Alors, certes, √ßa ne vaudra pas un bon casque. Certains d√©tails sonores disparaissent compl√®tement. Les 5 premi√®res minutes d'√©coutent √©taient assez d√©sagr√©ablement du fait que l'√©couteur exerce une certaine pression sur les tempes et le fait que les transducteurs vibrent √©norm√©ment. M√™me en l'ayant retirer, je ressentais encore cette g√™ne. Mais le lendemain, j'ai pu encha√Æner une √©coute quasi non stop dans les transports et au bureau. Je regrette seulement l'absence de bass bien p√©chu et surtout l'utilisation de connectique propri√©taire (surement d√ª √† la norme IP67/IP68). Bref, la technologie est prometteur. Et si vous cherchez un moyen d'√©couter de la musique en p√©riode de canicule alors foncez.

Apr√®s avoir test√© le mod√®le trekz durant qlq semaines et l avoir renvoy√© pour cause d inconfort, c est ce mod√®le depuis 2mois Et sa seule limite est son autonomie Je suis fan de ce casque Vraiment En voiture, en v√©lo, √† pied ou simplement chez moi, je porte parfois le casque 8hr d affil√©e. Pas de g√™ne caus√©e par les vibrations (raison du renvoi du trekz), oreillette parfaite en voiture, je pense que c est compatible avec la l√©gislation fran√ßaise vu que les 2 oreilles restent libres. J ai ainsi un bon autoradio en voiture et √† pied. En v√©lo c est parfois plus compliqu√© avec le vent mais je pr√©f√®re ne pas entendre parfois la musique 3 minutes qu'√™tre coup√© de l ext√©rieur. La suppression des bruits est correct, mon interlocuteur ignore souvent que je suis en d√©placement. L assistant google a un peu plus de mal mais rien de r√©dhibitoire. Je pensais ne mettre que 4 √©toiles pour l exercice physique car avec casque v√©lo et lunettes, le casque audio bouge parfois mais cela serait vmt m√©priser les qualit√©s du produit. De l argent bien investi, test√© m√™me dans la douche. Le constructeur devrait mieux communiquer sur le contenu du packaging J ai re√ßu une pochette ventrale fort pratique et quasi √©tanche et surtout 2 c√¢bles de recharge. Je ne crains donc pas de me retrouver sans c√¢ble.

Ayant d√©j√† le mod√®le Trekz Air, je souhaitais un mod√®le permettant de l'utiliser dans l'eau. L'Aeropex permet de le faire (utilisation dans la douche). J'essayerai peut-√™tre √† la piscine m√™me si j'ai un peu un doute. Niveau sensation, il a l'air + l√©ger et est un peu + confortable que le Trekz Air qui √©tait lui-m√™me d'une bonne qualit√©. Par contre, j'ai l'impression que le son est l√©g√®rement moins clair que celui du Air avec un √©quilibrage moins bon des basses et des aigus, malgr√© les 2 r√©glages disponibles. Sinon que dire? Le multisource est toujours aussi pratique (je l'appaire avec mon smartphone ET une tablette) et le nouveau cable usb magn√©tique est vraiment pratique m√™me si non standard (contrairement au Air qui √©tait du micro usb). Il y en a 2 de fournis. Une petite sacoche toute fine de jogger est fourni avec permettant d'y placer son smartphone pendant une session d'exercice. Je trouve √ßa sympa d'y avoir pens√©. Apr√®s 1 jour d'utilisation, je suis satisfait. Le prix est cher mais je pense qu'on paye les petits conforts en plus.

Ce qu'il promet, il le fait. C'est un casque pens√© pour le sport/running. Et c'est finalement moi qui n'est pas un usage 'adapte' au produit. Je veux certe un casque de sport/running, mais j'aimerai pouvoir l'utiliser dans le train, dans mon lit.... Pour que la conduction osseuse s'effectue bien, il faut que les √©metteurs soient parfaitement positionn√©s, ce qui veut dire que l'arceau est bien rigide, mais il ne se posera pas sur votre nuque, il sera suspendu derriere votre crane, afin de faire une legere pression. Par contre, soyons clair, le son est bon, de meilleur qualite que bien des casques que j'ai pu avoir entre les mains. * Autonomie: Parfait. 8h sans probleme. recharge rapide * Confort: Pendant l'effort, tres bon. Nullement gene par les legeres vibrations que l'on peut qqfois ressentir a forte puissance.

After hearing a friends AfterShokz Air, I was impressed and decided that I needed to get these to try for myself. I am not their main target customer. I use these in the office primarily with the intended occasional bike ride at the weekends (still yet to try this). I wanted to be able to listen to music but still hear the conversations going on around me in case I need to join in, or simply if someone wants to ask me a question and they can just say my name without doing a wavy dance to try and get my attention. For this they work exactly as intended. I also take several calls throughout the day and the quality is excellent. I can hear people loud and clear and I have been told that I come across very clear with the quality on par with most headsets. Watching films seems to have audio in sync and sounds great. I also have these connected to my laptop at the same time and can seamlessly switch between my phone and laptop. Battery wise I am still amazed. I have not timed it yet myself, but I have no issues getting through a full day of music listening and calls with the odd pauses throughout the day. Comfort is really really good and most of the time I forget that I am actually wearing them. I do have the music at a normal volume (not so loud that I cant hear my surroundings) so the vibrations into my jaw are not too harsh which I think also helps with reducing fatigue. But I pretty much have this on my head for a solid 10 hours to put it into perspective. Sound quality is going to be very subjective. They are not your normal headphones and therefore will not be as good BUT they are far from average. Yes the bass response is not as good but Im not listening to loud heavy dance tracks and for the most part I forget that the bass is lacking. Music still sounds nicely rounded and pleasant to listen to. If I was to find fault it would be with the vibrations on louder volumes. It cant really be helped, but the vibrations are a weird sensation and fatigue does set in much quicker. There is also a confirmation beep for things like volume up which is unnecessarily loud and makes me want to use my phone volume instead of the headset buttons. Other than that I couldn't recommend enough if the use case fits you. ---update---- Tried these on a ride and work exactly as you would expect. The helmet straps aren't an issue and the rear band sits low enough to not interfere with the rear helmet strap (at least on my normal helmet) Still very happy and they have been glued to my head all day everyday at the moment.

Where do I start. I have been using Aftershokz headphones for some time now after running with normal in ear headphones and nearly not hearing a car and nearly ending under it along a country lane so I carried out some research and found this company. I thought the Air model was good and enjoyed them for my running, working out in the gym cardio or weights and now the cycle ride to work. The new Aero model is far far superior then the Air, the sound is much clearer and sounds more meaty. Plus the base has been improved, which is great as when training I always listen to Spotify Run N Base 170-175 BPM and the Aero's make the play list sound great. Like others reviews on here I even forget I still have these on due to there light weight and even walked into the shower with them on, thankfully they are IP67 so after a oh crap moment I then relaxed remembering IP67 üòÉ. I'm waiting for the other colours to come out and I'll be buying my wife a pair now for when she hits the gym. Overall these headphones are Fantastic and they do last the 8 hours, I made sure I didnt charge to find out. Everyone I show these headphones to there reply is mostly WOW Amazing, these are from others who are using all different brands from airpods, bose etc. They are the make and model and are going to look into them so just me showing people how great they are I reckon 10 friends and people in the gym have gone and ordered them and others added to their birthday or christmas wish list! Well done Aftershokz keep up the good work!!

These headphones are absolutely superb! Best thing ever for someone like me. I have hearing loss & have worn hearing aids since childhood. For the past 15 yrs I've tiny worn in-the-ear hearing aids which means whenever I want to use headphones I have to take my hearing aids out. When I use in-the-ear phones/pods, I must remove my hearing aids & even with large on the ear headphones I find the sound quality better without my hearing aids. I have heard of these bone conduction headphones before & generally reviews are poor sound quality & very expensive. Recently I came across these AfterShokz & decided to give them a try. I must say I find them incredible & its an absolute must have for someone like me with hearing aids. The headphones fit from behind over top of the ears with the bone/vibration pads in front of the ears. Setting up & using the headphones is pretty standard like any bluetooth headphones. The sound comes from the vibrating pads & I find the quality just as good as any decent quality headphones. But with my hearing! Perhaps I don't know what 'Quality Audio' sound is? When using them for the very first time, it can be a bit strange, as I can hear music from the headphones & also hear everything around me. The pads vibrate which feels weird but soon get used to it. The vibration becomes stronger when turning up the volume & at maximum it is too loud & strong vibration for me. I keep them around 50% - 60% level. The headphones are completely sealed with IP67 water resistance, however I don't think I will be swimming with them. The charging connector is magnetic (like on MacBooks) & comes with 2 charging cables. For me I am finding these bone conduction headphones a life changing experience. I only wish I got them sooner!

First things first, I hardly EVER write reviews. Way too busy, and I don't typically care enough. Here's a short and sweet summary: if you can fit the extra $160 into this month's budget (maybe no fast food, pizza, or coffee...whatever), don't hesitate - you won't regret it. Next, here's some helpful info from the included manual: Wireless range: 10 meters (honestly, I get better range than that...I've used them from downstairs in the opposite corner of my house from my phone) Continuous play battery life: 8 hours (they must mean streaming to two devices simultaneously and nonstop, or maybe talking on the phone for 8 hours, because I wear and use it all day from 6am until around 9pm and have only charged it at night - it has never died). ...now on to why I love these things. I am a previous owner of the Trekz Titanium. I tried the Trekz Air but didn't buy them. I was waiting for a unit that handled dual Bluetooth devices and was waterproof - Aeropex was what I was waiting for. Cons: You already know this, bone conduction headphones can't replicate the amazing bass of an expensive pair of earbuds or cans. THAT SAID, when you're under water (these are waterproof) or wearing earplugs these things easily sound at least as good as a "decent" pair of headphones (like $20-40 range...more than adequate unless you are an audiophile). WITHOUT earplugs in, with open ears that are alert to your surroundings, I'd say these are the same quality "ish" of stock Apple iPhone earbuds. Maybe a bit less. PROs: 1. These have the best battery life of any wireless headphones I've used. 2. I now have a headset that simultaneously connects to my work laptop for Skype meetings and my iPhone for personal stuff. Amazing. No more multiple headsets. Mic is great. Clarity is better than my Plantronics. 3. Sound quality is great. Better than Trekz Titanium, can't speak for Air. The feeling that there is music playing that everyone else hears BUT THEY DONT is pretty amazing. I get to work or exercise to the music that keeps me going, but I don't have to worry about not being alert. No, these don't have great bass (without earplugs in). But as someone who enjoys dubstep, I can at least say I enjoy my music, still. The benefits far outweigh this minor drawback, trust me. 4. Vibration (the tickle common to bone conduction) is dramatically improved, as is sound leakage. People don't hear these things unless they are cranked. 5. Touching on something mentioned in my one and only "Con" - if you want noise cancelling headphones, it would be tough to find a better pair. Since you can wear the highest grade earplugs with these things - THEREBY *ENHANCING* THE SOUND - they effectively replace any other noise cancelling headphones. AMAZING. 6. I love, love, love the charging port. The magnetic charger just snaps into place and works - I now wish every device had a charger like this. BONUS: they give you two in the box, so you have one for home and one for work. 7. Since this is a relatively "new" technology, it's a great conversation starter, and everybody loves it. When you tell them to plug their ears (and suddenly they hear it BETTER) the facial response is like magic. ...so there you have it. I will likely not review another product for like ten or more years. But you, dear reader, I hope this pushes over the edge, if you're on the fence. These things are great. I have worn them all day, every day, since purchase (manufacturer warranty of two years btw) and they are comfortable and so convenient. Hope this helps!

Habe mir die Titanium und die Aeropex zum Vergleich bestellt. Nach einem Tag Vergleich habe ich letztlich entschieden die Aeropex zur√ºckzusenden. Grunds√§tzlich sind die beiden H√∂hrer sehr √§hnlich und funktionieren gut. Das Bedienkonzept mit den 3 Kn√∂pfen geht leicht von der Hand. Das Bone Conducting Prinzip ist f√ºr Pendler, aber auch sonst top, wenn man nicht ganz abgeschottet sein will. Die Soundqualit√§t leidet zwar ein bisschen aber verkraftbar. F√ºr mich ein gro√üer prinzipbedingter Nachteil beim Radfahren: Bei Geschwindigkeiten ab ca. 20-25kmh werden die Windger√§usche so laut, dass beide H√∂hrer auch bei voller Lautst√§rke zu k√§mpfen hat dagegen anzukommen. Bei Musik ist das halb so wild, H√∂hrb√ºcher kann ich mit dem H√∂hrer beim Radfahren deswegen aber leider nicht h√∂ren. Bei einem Bekannten tritt das Problem erst ab deutlich h√∂heren Geschwindigkeiten auf, es scheint also Ohr/Helm/Kopf-Form abh√§ngig zu sein. Ansonsten ist mir aufgefallen: - Aeropex haben einen geringf√ºgig besseren, klareren Sound. Die Verbesserung beim Bass konnte ich nicht feststellen. Auch die Lautst√§rke f√ºr Mith√∂hrer ist h√∂chstens geringf√ºgig geringer. - Der Gewichtsvorteil der Aeropex ist nett, aber nicht matchentscheidend. Allerdings wurde wahrscheinlich auch deswegen die Anpresskraft reduziert, so dass der Aeropex insgesamt schon bequemer zu tragen ist. - Die 2h mehr Akku-Ausdauer habe ich nicht gepr√ºft, ist aber nat√ºrlich ne super Sache, da die 8h eh schon grenzwertig sind. - Allerdings wurde vom Micro USB auf einen propriet√§ren Anschluss umgestellt, so dass man immer noch ein Kabel mehr mitnehmen muss (vor allem bei Reisen nervig oder wenn man mal unerwartet auf Arbeit laden muss). - Der Vorteil des neuen Anschluss ist, dass die Gummiklappe f√ºr den Wasserschutz wegf√§llt und somit auch nicht mehr undicht werden kann. - Die Freisprecheinrichtung ist bei beiden Modellen sehr gut. - Mein Modell hat beim sehr schnellen Laufen in beiden H√∂hrern bei jedem Schritt ein deutliches Klickger√§usch von sich gegeben (als ob irgendwas loose ist intern). Unklar ist, ob das immer so ist, oder nur bei meinem Modell. Letztendlich habe ich mich gegen die Aeropex entschieden, obwohl sie die besseren H√∂hrer sind. Die abgefragten 170‚Ç¨ sind mir bei den gebotenen Vorteilen aber zu viel, zumal die Titanium auch schon gut sind und mit 80‚Ç¨ eigentlich ebenfalls schon teuer sind.

After reading the overwhelmingly positive reviews, I really wasn't expecting such a poor level of sound quality. For listening to music, an ultra-cheap pair of in-ears sound better. I guess it's a limitation of the technology because these are apparently the best ones available. Having said that, I bought them for listening to podcasts while cycling to work, and for that they are quite good. They are lightweight, comfortable, waterproof and well made. The volume could do with being a little higher because It can be difficult to hear when you're speeding along with the wind blowing in your ears. I'm still undecided on whether or not to keep them. I really wanted waterproofing which is the only reason I paid the ¬£150, but with the volume issues and poor sound quality, they really are not worth anywhere near that.

Irgendwie scheint die blaue Variante ein Sondermodell zu sein und kommt inklusive Bauchtasche, in die ein Smartphone auch mit gr√∂√üerem Display gut hinein passt. Nettes Detail, wobei ich ohnehin nicht verstehe, warum so viele das langweilige Schwarz kaufen. Das dunkle Blau wirkt sehr dezent und ist aus meiner Sicht die spannendste Farbe, dies aber nur nebenbei. Komme ich zum Aeropex, nachdem ich auch schon das Titanium genutzt habe und neben den AirPods kein Drahtlos-Kopfh√∂rer am Markt verf√ºgbar ist, der die Ohren nicht verschlie√üt. Klar geht das zu Lasten bei der Musikwiedergabe, aber daf√ºr gibt es andere Produkte und ein Headset muss etwas mehr k√∂nnen. Zun√§chst zum Titanium, das ich wieder abgegeben habe, weil die Telefonqualit√§t nicht in HD stattfindet. Das Aeropex bietet hier mit Bluetooth 5.0 deutlich mehr, am Motorola One Vision ist die Sprachverst√§ndlichkeit in beide Richtungen hervorragend. Wermutstropfen, weder aptX, noch AAC wird unterst√ºtzt, somit ist keine Musikwiedergabe in HD m√∂glich. Das aberzertifizieren zu lassen ist wegen des Konzepts und der Tatsache, dass die meisten Bluetooth-Kopfh√∂rer ohnehin zu unpr√§zise f√ºr hochwertiges Audio sind, nicht wirklich problematisch. Im Gegenteil, der SBC-Codec klingt zwar schlechter, braucht aber weniger Energie und aufgrund der Bandbreite reicht die Verbindung auch weiter. Im Gegensatz zum Titanium ist das Headset deutlich schlanker und liegt besser an, gut um sich auch mal hinzulegen. Mit dem Titanium unm√∂glich, mit dem Aeropex geht es bei mir zumindest. Kritisiert wird gerne das magnetische Ladekabel. Wer jedoch instabile USB Typ Micro-B-Stecker kennt und wei√ü, dass f√ºr USB-C kein Platz ist und so auch die Wasserdichtigkeit nicht gegeben w√§re, wird den technischen Hintergrund nachvollziehen k√∂nnen und dass zwei Ladekabel beiliegen, ist ein sehr guter Kompromiss. Auch die Tasche wird zuweilen als zu eng beschrieben. Das trifft zu, wenn man √ºbersieht, dass man den Aeropex schon richtig reinschieben muss. Dann passt auch das Ladekabel mit hinein, somit alles gut. Hingegen empfinde ich die Ohrstopfen als √ºberfl√ºssig, denn einen geschlossenen In-Ear-H√∂rer k√∂nnen die Teile nicht ersetzen. Wer fliegen muss, sollte sich daf√ºr dann lieber ein g√ºnstiges Zweit-Headset von TaoTronics kaufen, sofern Bluetooth im Flugzeug √ºberhaupt erlaubt ist. Die Tasten sind klein, haptisch aber gut erreichbar. Bei mir dr√ºckt auch nichts und Vibrationen treten nur bei hoher Lautst√§rke auf. Tipp: Beim Sitz etwas ruckeln und versuchen, dass die Seitenteile gut auf den Knochen aufliegen. Ist die Auflagefl√§che besser, verbessert sich auch der Klang. Den Klang zu beschreiben ist eigentlich ganz einfach: Man stelle sich zwei kleine Bluetooth-Lautpsrecher vor, die man sich vor das Gesicht h√§lt. Dabei meine ich kleine Br√ºllw√ºrfel mit Treibern von zwei Zoll Gr√∂√üe, die wenig Tiefen und eine klare Verst√§ndlichkeit im Pr√§senzbereich bieten. Das w√§re in Etwa der Klangcharakter. Besser als beim Titanium, der hohe Preis k√∂nnte abschrecken, aber der Mehrwert und die deutlich kompaktere Bauform spricht f√ºr den Aeropex. Teuer, ist er das wirklich? Vergleichen wir mal die AirPods, kosten etwa √§hnlich viel und kommen mit drei Akkus. Benutzt man sie ergonomisch, nimmt sie also aus der Box, tut sie wieder rein, nimmt sie wieder raus und macht das so, wie Apple das empfiehlt, l√§dt man sich aktiv die Akkus kaputt. Hintergrund, sie verlieren sp√ºrbar an Leistung, nach gut eineinhalb Jahren nimmt die Laufzeit asymmetrisch ab. Das kann bei den Aeropex nicht passieren, denn sie nutzen ein Akku, den man einfach aufl√§dt. Klar, die AirPods sind klanglich nat√ºrlich direkter und lassen noch gen√ºgend Schall durch, aber w√§hrend ich das Aeropex als gute Investition betrachte, habe ich f√ºr die AirPods Lehrgeld f√ºr einen guten Komfort ausgegeben und das mache ich garantiert kein zweites Mal. Will ich gut Musikh√∂ren, tun es auch Bluetooth-Zweith√∂rer f√ºr unter 50 Euro, die klingen auch nicht viel schlechter als die AirPods, ich hatte genug auf dem Tisch und die Presse schreibt die Teile auch gerne sch√∂n und vor Allem das, was die Leute lesen wollen. Daher eine klare Kaufempfehlung, wenn man wei√ü, was man bekommt.

UPDATE 22/7/19: 2 weeks into the hottest marathon training season I've ever coached, and this headset is still performing flawlessly! My group has been running in temperatures ranging from 31C to 36C (which typically feels like 39C to 42C due to humidity), and despite sweating so much that we all look like we just jumped in a swimming pool, my Aeropex has continued to work perfectly! I'm very surprised it's still not available to purchase within the US, but glad I took the chance and purchased it from Amazon's UK storefront. UPDATE 3/7/19: I've used these on 7 super sweaty summer runs so far and they're holding up great! By this point my Titanium headset would've fried. I've made sure the headset is completely dry each time I've charged it so far, so I've not tested the moisture warning system to know how it works. I honestly don't intend to test this feature though if I can avoid it. ORIGINAL REVIEW: I'll be updating this review over the next month or so as needed, but currently I'll say this is the best headset Aftershokz has made to date. I'm a marathon runner/coach and I tend to sweat a lot during training and races. Aftershokz has replaced my Trekz Air five times now due to sweat damage, so when they announced a fully waterproof headset, I was very intrigued. I've run with my Aeropex once so far and I performed flawlessly. The general design looks much more waterproof than previous models, as the only hole visible in the body is the microphone. The switch to a magnetic charging connection is probably the best improvement, as it eliminates the the easiest way to short out the Air or Titanium headsets. I also give Aftershokz a ton of credit for sending 2 charging cables, since it's a proprietary connection that you can't easily buy outside of contacting their support team. I assume replacement cables will also be available on their storefront eventually, but that is currently not the case. TL/DR: The Aeropex is a full improvement in all aspects over their previous Bluetooth models. I'm looking forward to hopefully updating this review with good performance reports over the next month as a break it in properly during my upcoming training season.

Ante todo debo decir que este es el segundo modelo es el segundo que conozco de AfterShokz. El primero fue el modelo Air, que tiene un precio bastante m√°s reducido. Con car√°cter general, los pros y contras de estos auriculares son los siguientes: A favor: Son muy ligeros, la calidad del sonido es buena, la duraci√≥n de la bater√≠a es excelente y son capaces de conectarse con cualquier dispositivo. El manejo es c√≥modo y f√°cil. La construcci√≥n parece s√≥lida y son c√≥modos de transportar adem√°s de venir con una bolsa perfecta para este prop√≥sito. Su uso para hacer y recibir llamadas telef√≥nicas es perfecto. Su uso para escuchar m√∫sica o cualquier sonido procedente de un dispositivo bluetooth es muy satisfactorio. Y, por √∫ltimo, su forma de transmitir el sonido los hace ideales para no da√±ar o da√±ar menos el o√≠do e insustituibles para las personas que no pueden utilizar los tradicionales por el motivo que sea (m√©dico o de otra naturaleza).. En contra: Por su modo de funcionamiento no puede esperarse de ellos la misma calidad de sonido que unos auriculares tradicionales, si bien esta diferencia solo van a apreciarla los muy mel√≥manos. No es mi caso, los uso para oir m√∫sica, podcasts, para llamadas telef√≥nicas, etc., y en todos los casos es muy bueno el sonido. Otro inconveniente, aunque menor, es que el aro que sobresale en la parte posterior de la cabeza "choca" con el sill√≥n o sof√° en el que estemos sentados (impidiendo apoyar la cabeza) y, por ello, tampoco nos permite usarlos tumbados boca arriba. Finalmente, un inconveniente importante es el precio, demasiado elevado en mi opini√≥n aunque, insisto, la calidad del dispositivo es muy elevada. Para finalizar, cuando me plante√© la primera compra no ten√≠a claro si deb√≠a optar por el modelo Air o el modelo Aeropex. Le√≠ algunas cr√≠ticas de usuarios en el sentido de que el modelo m√°s reciente, Aeropex, pese a ser bastante m√°s caro, no mejoraba los modelos anteriores. Por este motivo compr√©, inicialmente, el modelo Air que, unos meses despu√©s, regal√© a un familiar al que, problemas auditivos, le impiden usar los auriculares tradicionales. Pues bien, mi experiencia hace que discrepe de las cr√≠ticas citadas. El modelo Aeropex es m√°s liviano que el modelo Air, la duraci√≥n de la bater√≠a es mayor, la calidad de sonido es mejor y la conexi√≥n con los dispositivos bluetooth se encuentra muy mejorada. Adem√°s, en el modelo Aeropex se ha reducido el efecto "vibraci√≥n" que aparece cuando el volumen es muy alto, y se ha reducido de manera muy notable. Todo esto hace que, indudablemente, lo considere mucho mejor que el modelo Air.

Ich habe lange nach Kopfh√∂rern gesucht, die beim Laufen stabil sitzen und Umgebungsger√§usche durchlassen. Die AfterShockz sind derma√üen gut in beidem, ich w√ºrde auch 6 Sterne geben. Die Akkulaufzeit ist top, das Ladekabel und die Transporth√ºlle super praktisch und das Ger√§t erstaunlich robust. Man kann sie sogar zusammen mit einer Sonnenbrille tragen ohne das eins von beiden instabil wird. Wer √ºber die Tonqualit√§t n√∂rgelt, hat andere Schwerpunkte als ich. Ich will Kopfh√∂rer, die beim Laufen Funktionieren und trotzdem passabel klingen.

I‚Äôm a long term aftershokz user. I‚Äôve had the wired versions, to the titanium, air and now aeropex. Honestly I was happy with the upgrades from titanium to air. I felt like they added some valuable alternative features that allowed for great sound quality, long battery life, at a comfortable lightweight size. I figured that was it. No updates right? I was shocked to here they had now created the Aeropex with smaller footprint competitive battery life and improved sound. I‚Äôve had various other Bone conduction headsets, and bone conduction sunglasses. I guarantee you, there is no better than this. I‚Äôm still trying to figure out how they managed to decrease the size, but improve the bass and overall volume and sound quality. the only unfortunate trade off this time is the switch from micro-USB for charging to a new proprietary cable type. I think this was likely a concession made so that they could fit more inside the small space, instead of giving up space to a micro usb connector. Honestly, it‚Äôs worth it. I‚Äôll just have to stock up on cables just in case. I highly recommended this. I cant recommend it higher. Maybe you just want to listen to music at work but still hear your surrondings. Maybe you have kids and you want to listen to podcasts while you pay attention to them. Maybe you‚Äôre into sports and you want a lightweight solution that also lets you stay safe and hear your surroundings. It fits all of those. I use these more than my various headphones because I often forget the aftershokz are still on. Walk through life with your own personal soundtrack. It‚Äôs a weird sensation to hear the world and music at the same time, but it‚Äôs a worthwhile experience. My only hopes now are that aftershokz will master the bone conduction sunglass headset game.

Vorteile: + offenes Design, das Ohr bleibt frei und man nimmt alle Umgebungsger√§usche wahr ‚Äì sehr sicher f√ºr L√§ufer und Radfahrer + Sound ‚Äì im Bereich der Boneconduction-Kopfh√∂rer findet sich kein hersteller mit besserem Klang + Bluetooth 5.0 ‚Äì Top √úbertragungsqualit√§t + Akkulaufzeit ‚Äì 8h angegeben, 6h bei ordentlicher Lautst√§rke sind realistisch Neutral: o Akustik ‚Äì dem Klang, den man schlussendlich h√∂rt, fehlt ein st√ºck Dynamik. Je nach Titel, Genre und allgemeinem Frequenzspektrum der Musik, die man h√∂ren m√∂chte, eignen sich die Kopfh√∂rer mal mehr mal weniger gut. Pop-Titel, die auch im einfachen Autoradio gut klingen, h√∂ren sich am besten an. EDM und elektronisches hat oft zu viele H√∂hen und Tiefen gleichzeitig, sodass die Tiefen etwas lasch werden. Klassik bzw. Orchester und Filmmusik h√∂ren sich ziemlich gut an. Hier bekommt man aufgrund der freien Ohren auch ein wenig das Gef√ºhl, einem Konzert zu lauschen. Rap und Fitness-Tracks pumpen recht gut, tiefe Bassschl√§ge sollte man aber nicht erwarten. Sprache (z.B. Podcasts, telefonieren) ist Top verst√§ndlich. Nachteile: - offenes Design ‚Äì typbedingt h√∂rt man nunmal die gesamte Umgebung st√§ndig mit. Im Zug oder auf Arbeit kann man die Umgebung damit also nicht ausblenden - Vibrationen ‚Äì eigentlich kaum der Rede wert und werden von mir bei basslastigen St√ºcken nicht als st√∂rend empfunden - Mith√∂ren ‚Äì Bis zu einer mittleren Lautst√§rke h√∂rt niemand in der Umgebung etwas mit, dar√ºber hinaus kann man aber m√ºhelos Titel und Interpret erkennen- F√ºr leise Umgebungen also nicht empfohlen. - B√ºgel ‚Äì wer gern den Kopf in den Nacken wirft, k√∂nnte sich am B√ºgel st√∂ren. Jedoch verrutscht der Kopfh√∂rer danach nicht. Warum 5 Sterne? Weil mich das Konzept √ºberzeugt hat und man derzeit nicht besser beim Sport mit offenen Ohren Musik h√∂ren kann, als mit diesen Kopfh√∂rern. F√ºr wen empfohlen? Alle, die sicherheitsbewusst Sport damit treiben wollen und kleine Abstriche am Sound machen k√∂nnen, sind damit richtig. Wer allerdings laute Musik braucht, sollte aufpassen, dass er die Leute in seiner Umgebung damit nicht st√∂rt und vielleicht doch lieber zu einer geschlossenen L√∂sung greifen.

I have owned more than a few of these things but they all fail on one thing.. If it rains whilst you are wearing it, they fail. I live in the North of England, where it rains a lot. Over 125 inches per year. That said, any earpiece that survives that, has to be good, doesn't it? Since my purchase, it has survived some of the most horrendous rain in over 30 years and still works. My job requires me to work outdoors and be able to contact the various teams around the site, anytime. I work 10 hour shifts and the only failing is.. It dies after only 8 hours.. This means that it requires a "top up" of charge, part way through the day.. Everyone is now aware that, for 30mins, am offline.. So, in conclusion; if you can find a similar item, for more or less than the same price, let me know, because I've busted a few, over the years and this isn't one of them. ps. Winter is coming.. Wonder if it or my ear will fall off, when it gets cold..

The first one never arrived even though Amazon said its delivered. Probably the delivery driver put it through the wrong door which isn't that uncommon. No caller has complained thus far (3 days and 20+ hours of talking later) and the second wired headphone included is pure genius. Turns a Bluetooth headset into proper headphones for music instantly. What an excellent product for around a tenner !!!!!

Es wird weder von langen Haaren, einem Schal o.√§. verdeckt - selbst eine M√ºtze kann man noch ordentlich dr√ºber ziehen! ***Einrichtung*** Headset an, Hauptknopf dr√ºcken, auf dem Handy nach dem Ger√§t suchen - anklicken - fertig. ***Funktionalit√§t*** Wie schon erw√§hnt nutze ich das Ger√§t in Verbindung mit einem GoogleAssistant auf einem Android Ger√§t. Egal ob man damit den MusicPlayer(oder Youtube) pausieren will, die H√∂he des MountEverest wissen oder einfach nur telefonieren will - es ist alles m√∂glich, was der Sprachassistant kann. Eine Vorraussetzung f√ºr mich war, dass ich mit einer Hand das Headset ans Ohr krieg und komplett bedienen kann - und das funktioniert einwandfrei, insbesondere das Sprachfeedback ist praktisch! Auch zum normalen Musikh√∂ren reicht das Headset! ***FAZIT*** Super Funktionalit√§t und viel (und wirklich auch sinnvolles) Zubeh√∂r zum genialen Preis

I have brought this based on price. After a lot of thinking and looking around. I made a lot of calls to my partner in various conditions ranging from quite to noisy background, indoors and outdoors. I believe the battery is ok if not exceptional. The earphone comes with 3 buds of each type (4 in total). 1 type of normal round buds and the other with an extra extension to offer increased grip and extra headphone for the left ear. I found them very comfortable. I have wore it for extensive period of time and didn't feel tired or ear ache. The product is not heavy so you don't feel it in your ear. The extra left headphone is great idea which is perfect for listening to music and watching movies. Very well built and look very decent when worn. Pairing is pretty easy and fast. The controls are good. Tap to answer and double tap for last dial number. All in all I am very very satisfied with the product and considering the price, I think it's a steal. Go for it!

I was getting sick of wires getting in the way, so I got this BT headphone. Chose Mpow because my niece has a similar model (H12) and it was nice. This one (H19) is newer and cheaper than hers. ANC is not as "stuffy" as the H12 so it's more comfortable. Weight is about the same; light enough that I don't feel bogged down. Sound is clear and sharp. My only complaint is that it's rather small... and I don't even have a big head. I have the phones extended all the way out for my use. And the "clamping" is a bit tight. I leave it on the tissue box when I'm not using it hoping that it'll loosen up over time. Overall, very impressed and happy with the purchase.

The Mpow H19 headphones are probably the most comfortable over-the-ear headphones that I‚Äôve worn to date. While I haven‚Äôt yet had the need to pull 12 straight hours wearing them, I‚Äôm rather confident that they wouldn‚Äôt quickly become uncomfortable like others that I‚Äôve previously worn for extended periods. This comfort comes largely by way of efficiently applied thick and pliable memory-foam cushion around all contact points‚Äînot just around the ears, but also for six inches across where the top band rests against the head. These headphones also have the capacity to crank out a staggering volume level, especially if your audio source has an active EQ that will boost at frequencies above the level mark. They do tend to fall a little on the bright side of the sound spectrum, but as the hardware can handle the bass quite nicely, I found my personal sweet spot started heavy in the lower frequencies and followed a gradual slope down into the higher KHz. Other high marks are due for an auto-shut-off feature that kicks in after about five minutes of the headphones not receiving a signal. Phone call quality is good and basically on par with other wireless devices that utilize Qualcomm‚Äôs cVc 8.0 technology, with those on the other end capable of hearing in an environment with light to moderate background noise without the frustration of constant requests for repetition or clarification. The headphones can be swiveled and folded into a tight little bundle that fits neatly within a minimalistic travel pouch‚Äîincluded‚Äîor a decent generic case if more protection is needed. Buttons are readily accessible‚Äîwhile wearing the phones or otherwise‚Äîand can be easily detected while wearing the unit after the first attempt of orienting one‚Äôs fingers to their location. Overall, these phones are another excellent addition to Mpow‚Äôs lineup for an unequaled price given the active noise cancelling, emphasis on comfort, and advanced features that are competitive with much more expensive headphones for a much more reasonable price. Well done, Mpow!

I really like this BT headset. Ive never had one that does Noise Cancelling - so I was really curious if it worked. My first, impression is that it does work, to a degree. Low pitch droning is blocked out, and some high pitched sounds are unaffected. But this is still a great feature to have. I discovered I rarely turn on noise cancelling, because it's fairly quiet in my home. But going outside it bebof great help. As for sound I've only had a couple of BT audio devices and lots of 3.5mm headphones. The mpow headset id have to say slots 30-40% below my Audio Technica m50's

i really like these Mpow H19 headphones. they seem to have everything that i wanted, including affordability. nice big quality ear cushions, foldable design, great sound, and they're not too clunky. for $35 (because they had a $10 coupon when i bought them), this is a mindblowing value. love that it includes a bag and aux cable also. i'm extremely picky but and i've tried out several pairs now in my hunt for a good affordable pair and these seemed to tick all the boxes for me. (i even think the sound quality is better than a $100 sony ANC pair that i tried). i'm really satisfied with this mpow product and it makes me trust them and try other products.
Excellent sound, easy to pair, very comfortable

These headphones are by far the best noise cancelling headphones I have tried. I'm not heavily into audio, however I can definitely tell that headphones pack a punch. While the highs may not sound the greatest the lows and the mids are extremely nice on these headphones. Overall these headphones just tend to balance all three aspects to provide an amazing sound quality. The noise cancellation is amazing on these headphones. Today many budget headphones come with really bad noise cancellation, however that is not the case with these headphones. Now these headphones cannot blockout any high frequency sound quality, however they can block out low frequency sound quality such as a washing machine or an airplane engine, which makes these headphones a great choice for frequent travelers. The comfort quality of these headphones is really amazing thanks to the soft memory protein earpads, which makes it easier to wear these headphones for long periods of time. Overall, I'm extremely happy that I purchased these headphones, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them to anyone else.

First set powered off randomly both while in use and in standby. Talked with support and followed their remediation steps. 5 min later they powered off during a phone call. I'm returning them for a new pair and really hope the second time's a charm as my M7 plus headphones have been great. Will update my rating and review when the replacement arrives. Update - Same thing with the replacement set. The headphones power off after 5 minutes if not playing audio. OK, I can live with that if it's a power saving feature however there's nothing in the user guide about this. Headset abruptly powers off during WebEx calls which is extremely frustrating in a work situation. One person mentioned that they went with a different brand as they had the same issues with PC based conferencing and that's what I'm doing as well. I'd really hoped that MPow would be my headset "brand" but not the case after this expreience as they simply don't fit my needs. I I orderd the H19s after initially ordering the H20. Windows 10 couldn't configure a driver for the hands-free output which renedered them useless for my needs.
Cheap but very good product for the price, good protein overhear performance, nice sound in high notes, decent bass and noise cancelation. Too easy for pair with my phone. I'm happy.

These are great headphones. Everyone in our family owns a pair of mpow headphones and they are all amazing. Our 15yo neighbor just got a pair of $200 Bose and these mpow headphones sound better and fit better (plus they cost a lot less per pair). Will buy these again!

C'√© poco da dire su queste cuffie, un rapporto qualit√† prezzo davvero eccellente. Ho acquistato queste cuffiette airdots, stupito dalle ottime recensioni online e dal prezzo relativamente basso. Inanzitutto parto con il dire che sono arrivate in poco pi√π di una settimana, decisamente molto in anticipo rispettoalla data indicata che prevedeva quasi un mese prima che arrivassero, quindi gi√† ottima come cosa. Tornando alle airdots Redmi Xiaomi, mi hanno davvero stupito, per la facilit√† di connettivit√† al mio dispositivo huawei mate 20 pro √® stata praticamente automatica, senza alcuna difficolt√† accendendo semplicemente il tasto del bluetooth. Molto comode all'orecchio e non scivolano e non si perdono, questo anche al fatto che sono compresi 3 diversi tipi di gommini (piccoli, medi e grandi), io personalmente ho scelto i gommini piccoli e mi trovo benissimo, non le perdo e non mi scivolano minimamente, anche in caso di movimenti bruschi. La batteria √® decisamente ottima, con una durata di autonomia delle cuffiette di 4\5 ore, dopodich√® una volta inserite nell'apposita scatoletta, con presa magnetica, si attiver√† un led di colore rosso e le caricher√†. La scatoletta √® da ricaricare mediamente ogni settimana in caso di uso intenso mentre per un uso normale o discreto anche ogni 2 settimane o pi√π, collegando il cavo usb compreso in dotazione, e si attiver√† un led di colore rosso nel bordo posteriore della scatoletta, una volta carica ( in genere dopo 3|4 ore) si spegner√† e si capir√† cos√¨ che √® completamente carica. Fate solo attenzione, perch√® sulle cuffiette o anche solo su una √® presente uno scotch piccolissimo da togliere, e sar√† questo il motivo se la vostra cuffietta non attiver√† il led rosso durante la ricarica e perder√† spesso di connettivit√† con la cuffia opposta. In questo caso se le 2 cuffie risultassero con i suoni separate, tenere premuti entrambi i bottoni per diversi secondi fino a quando non sentirete un beep. Il tasto presente sulle airdots xiaomi √® fisico e permette se premuto normalmente di mettere in pausa o riprendere la riproduzione di un brano, mentre se lo si preme per 2 volte consecutive in modo veloce attiva l'assistenze vocale di google, con il quale si possono svolgere diverse operazioni. Infine per il comparto audio √® ottimo, non ovviamente ai livelli di audio HIFI ma √® audio comunque di qualit√†, e spesso per vedere i video il volume non bisogna metterlo nemmeno al massimo. Non ho quasi mai avuto problemi di connettivit√† tra le 2 cuffiette, e si connettono automaticamente sempre tutte e 2 insieme. Ho provato a connetterle con il mio notebook asus e funzionano anche qui molto bene, mentre devo ancora provare a connetterle con la Playstation, ma penso che funzionino anche l√¨. In conclusione queste cuffie sono paragonabili a quelle che costano 5 volte tanto, inferiori a mio modo di vedere solo alle airpods di apple, che hanno molte pi√π funzioni, ma che costano anche 7 o 8 volte tanto, per cui acquisto pi√π che straconsigliato per le Airdots Redmi Xiaomi.

I got these as a replacement for a different pair of wireless headphones I have. These are very compact and decent value for money, and the sound quality is decent! My biggest issue with them is I don't really like how quickly they start beeping and complaining if you pause them, and they go to sleep shortly after. Handy for battery conservation but if I pause often it gets frustrating. The battery life could stand to be a little bit longer but it's still alright at a couple of hours. The case they come in will also charge them so you'll get a good while out of them. If you're looking for cheap and cheerful wireless earbuds, I think they're perfect!

I've bought these earpods for like 1 month, they were working perfectly, but after use i've noticed that the sound on the right earpod is not working as its supposed to be, the sound is weak and the left earpod still working, and thats not agreable to have good sound only in one ear.. I dont know if there's a warranty for this product

Perfect upon arrival, unboxing experience was basic but everything was included. le cuffie e la confezione sono molto piccole e leggere come dicono molte recensioni e questa √® la cosa che mi √® piaciuta di pi√π. diciamo che per 26 euro il rapporto qualit√† prezzo √® buono... ma non ottimo come su altre piattaforme dove si trovano a meno.. e allora il rapporto diventa ottimo... ma √® una scelta personale se andare sul sicuro con la garanzia prime spendendo quei 5 euro in pi√π oppure fregarsene.. le cuffie hanno un buon suono abbastanza ricco tendente verso i bassi.. su samsung s8 ho riscontrato un volume massimo basso.. ho provato a migliorarlo scaricando app come sound assist o utilizzando escamotage dalle opzioni sviluppatore ma nulla.. comunque √® un problema di s8 non delle cuffie che invece collegate a una smar tv pompano veramente forte e non mi fanno affatto rimpiangere l acquisto.. la batteria dura circa 3 ore x 3 ricariche scarse, c √® un piccolo LED rosso sulla confezione che si accende quando questa √® in carica, per poi spegnersi completamente quando sia le cuffie che la confezione raggiungono il 100%..non c √® altro modo per sapere se il case sia completamente carico mentre per le cuffie si vede la percentuale dalle impostazioni bluetooth dello smartphone. in conclusione √® un prodotto che consiglierei? in relazione al prezzo assolutamente si.
Good qualities, build and sound, just a bit too quiet. Got the GT1 after these. Again. Quiet. But louder, maybe I'm just getting old. Bit louder and they'd have 5 stars.

ces √©couteurs sont vraiment impressionnants. La qualit√© de son est tr√®s sup√©rieur √† ce que j'attendais pour ce tarif. My first pair of earbuds and first impressions are pretty good. They come in a nice solid feel case that acts as storage so you don‚Äôt lose one and a charger to keep them topped up with juice. The case can also charge a phone up too, although I have not used this feature. The buds are easy to use, pairing up as soon as you take them out of the case, there are a variety of bud sleeves to make sure you get a good fit, you are also supplied a lanyard and charging cable. Sound wise, not bad, music is clear and without distortion, bass is what you would expect for earbuds and after a while you can almost forget you are wearing them. Water resistant too so can be worn in the rain. Overall excellent, considering how much you can pay for ‚Äòbranded‚Äô buds, these are a steal.

I love the compactness of the case that these come in and the fact it has a 3500 mah case means the case charging capability can keep these earbuds going for a long time indeed. I have also used the case to charge my iPhone so it also works as a bit of a power bank aswell! The earbuds are sleek and comfortable when in-ear and fit my ears very well. Once in the noise-cancelling function gets rid of most of the unwanted outer noise leaving you with a very pleasant music experience in-ear which also includes a smooth delivery of consistent bass. Brilliant to take on your travels given the compactness of the set and they are waterproof, all in all very happy with this set and good value for money.

When these arrived I looked at them and was worried that they might fall out whilst using them as they looked a little big BUT thankfully I was totally wrong. They come well packaged and when you open it up you see a really cool looking case and earbuds. They paired instantly. They connected immediately. The sound is so good with a lot of bass. They are easily controlled via the touch sensitivity of each earbud. They can be used independently of each other as well. The battery life of the case is fabulous. I‚Äôve been using these everyday for at least 5 hours and the case hasn‚Äôt needed charging yet which I really love. The case can also charge your other devices if need be. All in all these are so so good and I‚Äôm so pleased with them.

Auricolari davvero ottimi, piccoli, senza troppe 'lucette', con dimensione e forma giusta per far in modo che non cadano mentre si cammina o si corre. La qualit√† audio √® decisamente tra le migliori, specie per questo prezzo e soprattutto rispetto ad altri prodotti concorrenti (suonano meglio delle Samsung Gear IconX 2018 e danno molto meno fastidio mentre vengono utilizzate). Ci sono alti, medi e bassi, nelle giuste misure, quindi il suono che ne risulta √® ben bilanciato e ascoltare musica ma anche parlato con queste cuffie risulta sempre piacevole. Grazie alla forma degli auricolari, √® possibile ascoltarli per ore senza alcun fastidio (modelli di marche pi√π conosciute sono risultati molto pi√π scomodi e, ad un certo punto, dolorosi!). Rimangono sempre ben saldi e non tendono mai a cadere. Il pairing tra auricolari e telefono √® un'operazione molto veloce, tanto che il manuale l'ho consultato solo dopo qualche ora di utilizzo ma ormai era gi√† inutile nel senso che il funzionamento degli auricolari √® cos√¨ semplice che non occorre nemmeno mettersi a leggere istruzioni. Per iniziare ad utilizzare le cuffie, √® sufficiente rimuoverle dalla custodia di ricarica e IN UN ATTIMO gli auricolari si collegano al telefono via Bluetooth, davvero velocissimi! Anche l'ascolto mono, utilizzando solo un auricolare √® possibile: basta estrarre solo l'auricolare destro (che funge da auricolare main) dalla custodia e la musica/chiamata verr√† trasferita solo a tale auricolare; rimuovendo anche l'altro auricolare, si potr√† ascoltare la musica da entrambi, senza dover fare altre operazioni. Ritornare all'ascolto mono √® altrettanto semplice, basta reinserire l'auricolare sinistro nel contenitore di ricarica e la musica continua senza interruzioni. Appena si inseriscono gli auricolari nella custodia di ricarica, la musica viene interrotta e, se inseriti entrambi, verr√† interrotta la riproduzione in automatico. La basetta di ricarica permette la ricarica anche di un solo auricolare alla volta o di tutti e due insieme. Sugli auricolari √® presente un LED che si colora di rosso mentre la ricarica √® in corso e diventa bianco una volta completata la ricarica. Gli auricolari sono piccoli, non ingombranti e non attirano l'attenzione negativamente, a differenza di altri prodotti della stessa fascia di prezzo. Durante il funzionamento il LED non si accende e non attira inutilmente l'attenzione. La custodia di ricarica permette circa 5 ricariche complete delle cuffie, pari a una ventina di ore di utilizzo degli auricolari, nonostante sia comunque compatta e leggera. Collocare gli auricolari all'interno della custodia di ricarica √® semplicissimo, grazie all'attacco magnetico: √® impossibile sbagliare e risulta sempre veloce reinserire gli auricolari, in ogni situazione; infine, grazie ai magneti, che assicurano una presa solida, gli auricolari non usciranno mai dalla basetta di ricarica. Dal momento che √® sufficiente rimuovere gli auricolari dalla basetta di ricarica per iniziare ad utilizzarli per ascoltare musica o chiamare e basta reinserirli per interromperne l'utilizzo e farli ricaricare, utilizzare questi auricolari risulta davvero semplice e l'operazione √® molto veloce. Anche i controlli sono semplici, quindi gli auricolari risultano intuitivi nell'utilizzo: - premere una volta: play/pausa o rispondere/riaggancio chiamata - premere due volte: canzone successiva (auricolare destro), canzone precedente (auricolare sinistro) - premere per un secondo: assistente vocale (Siri/Bixby/Google Assistant...) ci sono anche controlli pi√π avanzati per le chiamate, ma no voglio addentrarmi troppo nello specifico. Nella confezione sono presenti, inoltre, un cavo di ricarica e i gommini di varie dimensioni per adattare al meglio le cuffie ai padiglioni auricolari. Sicuramente sono degli auricolari eccezionali ma ora che ce ne sono tante della stessa qualit√† mi aspetto un tocco in pi√π, un qualcosa mi faccia dire:wow queste si che si distinguono dalle altre IN OGNI CASO ho trovato gli auricolari che fanno per me, compatti e leggeri ma con un ottimo suono e con una custodia di ricarica ben pensata! Non mi resta che consigliarveli!

Ich bin wirklich √ºberrascht. Die Kopfh√∂rer sitzen sehr bequem und fest im Ohr. Selbst ruckartige Bewegungen oder geh√ºpfe beim Sport lockern die Kopfh√∂rer kein bisschen. Nach mehrst√ºndige Benutzung war der Tragekomfort immer noch gegeben. Die Sound Qualit√§t ist f√ºr 30 Eurokopfh√∂rer echt gut. Im Vergleich habe ich noch meine Anker Kopfh√∂rer die schmieren dagegen vollkommen ab. Die Touchpanel lassen einfach und intuitiv bedienen. Zus√§tzlich unterst√ºtzt eine Stimme aber die Bedienung durch Ansagen. Insgesamt ein echt gutes Produkt! Verdiente 5 Sterne! PS: hab die Kopfh√∂rer jetzt auch f√ºr meine Frau geholt!

Amazingly comfortable in the ear. Took me a few seconds to figure out which way the earbuds sat in the ear. Volume goes really loud. I LOVE that I can turn the volume up and down, switch tracks forward, backwards or repeat a track with just the touch of the side of the earbud. This will save me having to look at my phone on the tube on a packed train. Connects easily via bluetooth. All in all I think these are great.

I have been looking for some wireless earbuds since upgrading to an iPhone 11 which of course has no headphone jack to plug in my trusted SoundMagic E10s. The price variation between what is on the market is absolutely insane, but I saw these on a black Friday week sale and already have a wireless charger by the same brand which has amazing build quality so thought I would take a punt and am glad I did.The build quality of the headphones is very impressive especially given the price. The packaging is very 'Apple' and the charging case feels very nice in hand. The headphones themselves magnetically grip into the charging case, and cleverly sync to each other upon removal. They immediately showed up under bluetooth devices on my iPhone and so far after limited testing the connection seems to be very stable. All the touch controls on each side work very well to skip tracks, activate siri endplay / pause.

So far I have used these for working via video call and I must say I'm impressed. I tried with music first to get used to the controls. Takes a bit of practice but once you get the hang of it and remember how many taps are for what function then it's relatively simple. The distance you can move is great. I love talking to my bestie whilst doing house work. I can now go anywhere in the house and even into the garden without losing connection. If you are not used to earbuds then they can take a bit for your ears to become accustomed and it sounds like your talking under water due to noise cancellation but they are still worth it and you get used to it quick

Perfect wireless headphones for on the go, the design is stylish and comfortable. I really enjoy using these headphones during my workouts because they are really comfortable and don't fall out with excellent sound quality. I have been using them continuously since I purchased them last week and I still haven't had to even charge them once! The battery life is amazing. Definitely a high-quality product for such a reasonable price. I would highly recommend this product.Have been using these earbuds now for around a week and they are brilliant. The sound quality and great and being waterproof im not afraid to take them out in the rain. The digital battery charge case is also really good and being magnetic really helps. Defiantly recommend to anyone who is considering buying.

I bought these earphones as I was looking for a pair that I could wear while running or going to the gym. These are great for that, as well as taking calls. They connect easily via Bluetooth, are comfy to wear and the sound quality is very good considering their price. They come in a nice little case which is great for carrying the earphones when travelling. They last for hours and even when they do need charging, you just put them back in the case which charges them. Overall, I am very pleased with them.

I‚Äôve had numerous earbuds and they have all been very good however, for comfort, none have been as easy to wear as these. They all tend to be noticeable after a few hours but these are still very easy to wear even after constant use of 8 hours and power is still on a quarter left! This sound is crisp and vocals very clear but the bass is massive and more than enough any track. Noise isolation is exceptional and controls very easy to use. For the price of a mid range set, in my opinion, you are getting a high end pair of brilliant sounding earphones!!

First impressions were that they're incredibly lightweight. Connection is always perfect and instant. Controls work perfectly every time. Battery life is phenomenal. Fit in ear - amazing. They stay in and are so lightweight, comfortable and easy to control. Phone charging is FAST! (Often these can be really slow). This is really useful for travelling. General sound is truly excellent. I can tell you that I actually heard sounds and instruments that I never hear before! I'm UNFAIRLY comparing them to my favourite earphones of all time. Soundpeats Q12. Unfairly because those are not True Wireless like these are. But sound is personal and depends on your personal needs. I like bass in music. Whilst the noise cancelling on these is excellent, the bass is not as good as the Soundpeats Q12. Perhaps True Wireless will never have as good bass as 'wireless'. The Q12 of course doesn't have anywhere near the battery capacity of these or phone charging. If bass is not important to you, then I would definitely buy these. This is an excellent, value for money, multi-use product.

They are great for everyday use. These headphones are waterproof and sweat proof. So I really don't have to worry while working out and wearing them. The battery time is just amazing it goes for more than 3 days without charging. Just love them!

Very slick packaging holds great promise, but none of the three sets of supplied earbuds fit particularly well, so contrary to the other reviews of this item, there is no discernible bass at all and the volume is also pathetically weak. In fact I would go as far as to say that the other reviews appear to be a complete work of fiction.

I bought the headphones in a flash sale - would have hesitated to spend more than 80 pounds for them... But for their price, 25 pounds, it was a terrific purchase: they came fully charged, pairing went without the hitch (the only problem was to find the right device - my phone called the headphones "Marathon", something I did not expect), and the sound is incredible for headphones. I am quite picky, when it comes to music, and even something I only use for sport and exercising should have a good sound. It's a full sound, with bass and pitches clear, sung words clearly understandable. Okay, it's not a perfect hi-fi system, but extremely good, considering. The headphones slip on easily and feel very comfortable and light. Loads better than in-ear devices, and much, much lighter than the usual over-ear thingies - it feels as if I had nothing on my ears. The headphones do not budge a bit with the kind of exercises I do (gym, exercise bike). What I particularly like is the buttons on one of the earpieces instead of on a separate box - which usually disturbs the good balance of the wearing. You need to practice a bit to find the right buttons, but it's easy enough. I am so happy - these are ages better than my old bluetooth headphones!
Excellent lightweight Headphones, easy to use, comfortable to wear, good treble and bass, clear voice calls, good price and a nice case for travel.

la verdad me he llevado una grata sorpresa siempre he querido unos auriculares que no se me cayeran corriendo y con movimientos bruscos pues no te preocupes que ni se inmutan al movimiento de lo bien que se ajustan a tus orejas. el sonido es fenomenal tiene unos graves y agudos muy bien ajustados sin distorsionar ni lo mas minimo, conectarlos es coser y cantar enseguida te los reconoce tanto el m√≥vil como la televisi√≥n que es mi caso y puedo escuchar la m√∫sica pr√°cticamente por toda la casa incluso atravesando paredes. la verdad que muy contento espero que me duren, los volveria ha comprar sin dudarlo. y el producto excelente vienen unas alfombrillas de repuesto,cable usb para carga en una cajita que te la puedes llevar ha cualquier lado y el acabado es muy bueno dentro de su calidad precio un tacto muy agradable.tengo unos de diadema energy system mas caros y en cuanto me muevo un poco pierde la se√±al habiendome costado mucho mas dinero ayer comprobe que por toda la casa el telefono colocado encima del sillon recorri toda la casa sin un solo corte incluso en el cuarto de ba√±o y la puerta cerrada.

I've waited a month before adding this review to ensure they didn't fail me. They haven't. I put in a fair amount of research when looking for a set of Bluetooth headphones to use when running and eventually settled on these as they were worth a punt at the low price and I‚Äôm really pleased I did. I‚Äôve been training for a marathon and these headphones have kept me company for many many hours. I can‚Äôt rate these highly enough. The battery life has exceeded 4 hours and the charge doesn‚Äôt take very long at all. They‚Äôre comfortable and the controls to skip tracks and change the volume can still be used even when wearing thin running gloves as the notches on the controls allow you to feel your way. They sometimes work themselves forward on your ears and occasionally flap around when you first put them on, however some minor adjustment, can be seated correctly easily. I would say that I only had to adjust them once or twice during a 3 hour run. Despite buying them for running, I wear them constantly round the house and mowing the lawn, working on the motorbike etc. The main reason is that they also have a microphone, so I can make calls when wearing them and oddly enough, despite the microphone being physically located on my ear, the caller can hear my voice more clearly then when using my Apple headphones with the mic that‚Äôs right in front of my face. It baffles me. However, huge thumbs up. I paid ¬£25 for these and would happily have paid more. 16th June - update 2 months after purchase. I ran my first Ultra Marathon in these last week - 32 miles and they didn't fail me at all. Easy to remove when crossing roads and at low volume, you can still hear other runners who want to pass. I ran 7 miles yesterday and I've just come back from a 6 mile run and I've used them the whole time. Still faultless.

I bought these headphones with some trepidation, as I‚Äôve had some cheaper Bluetooth headphones before and all I got was tinny sound and a battery that lasted two songs. Not so with the Linkwitz Marathon headphones. I wanted a pair of over the ear headphones that I could run in, and these are excellent. They pair easily (I‚Äôm currently using an iPhone 7 but they also worked on my previous phone which was a 6S), the sound quality is impressive, the battery so far has lasted me for a couple of 45 - 60 minute runs without needing to charge, and they‚Äôre really comfortable to wear with minimal slippage. They even sit comfortably over my ears when I‚Äôve got my glasses on. Overall I can highly recommend these headphones. They‚Äôre light, comfortable, good quality and do the job perfectly.

Comprate per usarle in ufficio sia per il macbook pro che per l'iphone. Bisogna abituarsi a metterle e toglierle, la posizione dell'archetto dietro la nuca √® sicuramente comoda per chi fa sport ma poco agevole se le si indossano al "volo" per rispondere ad una chiamata. queste cuffiette sono veramente un ottimo prodotto. il materiale √® di una plastica leggermente gommosa e piacevole al tatto e a contatto con le orecchie una morbida spugnetta, le dimensioni molto ridotte come si pu√≤ vedere dalla foto allegata sono pi√π piccole di una penna e quando sono indossate sono leggerissime e aderiscono con una moderata e non eccessiva pressione rimanendo comunque stabili anche durante la corsa motivo principale di utilizzo Il suono risulta di volume giusto e nel complesso gradevole senza distorsioni e con dei bassi piacevoli . Firstly I had a couple of issues with delivery which I knocked a star off for. I had delivery to a collection point to make it more practical, but ended up going twice because I didn't receive a collection code the first time so twice a 10 mile round trip after a 14 hour shift (not so convenient) the original delivery date was Weds, but then changed to Thurs and then Fri due to the courier error. Now the headphones themselves seem quite good, I have charged them and tested once very briefly as I only got them last night and it was 11pm. I intend to use them for running paired to a small clip on Bluetooth player and they are small and light seemingly well made. I haven't played with controls yet. I cannot confirm battery life as I haven't really used them properly so yet to see this. I also haven't yet paired them to one of my expensive players for a quality review as the little clip on Mp3 player might not give a fair assessment itself and is also new to me I have little to gauge. For the purpose of exercising with wireless set up these seem look a good choice to me and represent good value. I have no expectation for the same sound quality from these as I would from headphones that I have paid 10 times the price of, but it certainly seems loud enough and clear enough for my needs. Again the player might not be helping as that was also a lower cost option. I have not tried these plugged in either and that might improve sound quality further. They aren't bad sounding especially for the price/features, but they will distort heavy bass at high volumes. If you keep expectations in line with value you will be happy. Update - I got some time to listen a bit more and went for a run in these. The sound quality is actually better than I initially thought, the tracks I tested seem to have been the culprit as other newer downloads sounded much clearer even better than I had anticipated. The build quality also deserves a mention as these seem to be a good product and well made. They give just enough external sound for safety when running so seem to be a good compromise on immersion Vs awareness. The band isn't huge .... fairly snug reach, but I am a 16 stone man.

I wanted some wireless headphones for running but these are so good I use them most days. First off, the charge is amazing. Even if I forget to switch them off, it seems using them every other day or so, they can last a month! The sound quality is as good as my apple headphones. However, they are quite loud so other people can easily hear your music. This is fine for running, however if I know I'm going to be on public transport I try and take different headphones. Although, these can also accept phone calls which is handy. And I can control my music whilst I run which is probably the best feature. I like the design. So many wireless headphones were black or red and generally quite masculine but I like the roundness of these. Negatives are that if I go for a particularly long run, say 45 minutes plus, the headphones chafe behind my ears and leave a slight rash. Uncomfortable. Also as someone with long hair, they only seem to fit properly if my hair is up in a ponytail otherwise my hair knocks them off my ears. This is fine as I mainly use them for exercising anyway. I love these headphones and they make running even more enjoyable.

Avevo vari modelli di diverse marche dei auricolari sport BT. Dopo qualche mese d'uso, direi che i diffetti di questo modello (almeno per il mio paio) sono... conessione BT non e' granche (ci sono delle interuzioni gia se muovo troppo il braccio con lo sport watch) e durante l'allenamento non stano fermi nelle orechie (se il filo si mette dietro il collo). Direi che la causa e', che il fillo e' un po tropo lungo e il suo peso muove continuamente i aulicorali durante i allenamenti. In merito alla qualita del suono, direi che sono OK. Ma in generale non sono sodisfato. Recensione aggiuntiva. Subito dopo sono stato contattato dal venditore, il quale mi proponeva un altro loro modello Mpow S10, che mi hanno inviato gratuitamente. Adesso, dopo un po d'uso, posso dire che questo modello e migliore per le mie esigenze (corsa e palestra)... connessione BT ottima - senza interruzioni, durata della batteria ottima, tenuta dentro le orecchie OK, suono meglio delle precedenti. La durata nel tempo si vedr√†', ma presumo in quanto il modello MPow S10 non ha il circuito integrato con il altoparlante del auricolare, questo non viene in contato con il sudore e' quindi avr√† una durata pi√π lunga dei modelli che avevo in precedenza. Del nuovo modello sono soddisfatto e' do un voto 5. In merito al supporto da parte del venditore darei 10.

J'ai choisi ce produit en me basant sur les retours faits sur le Major II. J'ai eu du mal √† trouver des tests Fran√ßais sur la version 3.
