I purchased the Bomaker SiFi's a few days ago after seeing scarbir.com had rated them as the best under $50 earphones of 2019. Apart from price and sound quality, size was a major factor in my decision to purchase these buds and these are very small and low profile - they don't stick out from your ears and draw the attention of every passerby nearly as much as most wireless earbuds do. Operation of the earbuds is very simple: On/Off: 1*1 second press (either) = On 1*4 second press (either = Off For Music: 1 press (either) = pause/play 1 long press (left) = previous track (stop pressing as soon as track changes) 1 long press (right) = next track (stop pressing as soon as track changes) 2 presses (left) = volume down 2 presses (right) = volume up 3 presses (either) = Siri/Google - can control volume/track skip etc For Phone calls: 1 press (either) = answer / hang-up 2 presses (either) = reject call These are the most comprehensive controls of any earbuds I've experienced - some expensive earbuds don't even have volume control - Apple Earpods Pro for instance! Note, I don't use the Off/On function as the buds go into standby mode when put in the case and wake as soon as the case is opened which provides for almost instant connection with your last paired device but if they're not going to be used for a long time it's probably a good idea to switch them off. Initial pairing was, as a Meercat would say, "simples" - just take both buds out of the case, look for 'SiFi' on your device's BT list and click 'Pair'. Puting them back in the case disconnects them from your device and they start charging, the next time you take them out of the case they reconnect to your device automatically. Either earbud can be used independantly (mono mode) but you will need to pair the left earbud to your device by selecting 'SiFi L' - the right earbud is the master and is already paired via the 'SiFi' connection. The earbuds (not the case) are rated IPX7 so using them in the rain or even when taking a shower should be ok. High definition audio is provided for via AAC and AptX audio codecs. Listening time is an advertised 6-8 hours per charge (not fully tested but I still had plenty of battery left after a 4 hour session) with the case capable of recharging the earbuds 4 times before it needs to recharged. Sound quality is excellent throughout the audio range, from a powerful deep bass that you can feel rumbling inside you, to strong mids that are not overwhelmed by the bass to pure, clean highs that don't screech and hurt your ears. Add a wide and deep soundstage into the mix and in my book you have a fantastic sounding pair of earbuds. Over the few days I've used them the sound has, what I can only describe as, matured. Extreme highs seem purer, there's more depth in deep bass notes and the sound stage has opened up a bit - I think this is what is knows as 'breaking in' and it has had a +'ve effect on what was already a very good sound. For the price I doubt whether you'll find a better pair of earbuds - youtube reviews tend to back up this assertion and the fact that a highly respected testing source (https://www.scarbir.com/guide/best-sounding-wireless-earphones-50-dollar) put them at No 1 for best earphone under $50 in 2019 adds weight to this claim. Highly recommended.

DESIGN, COMFORT AND BATTERY LIFE The Bomaker Sifi is one of the most portable pair of truly wireless earbuds on the market. The charging case is about the size of the ultra-compact Haylou GT1 and can easily be carried in jeans pockets. It feels solid, made from scratch-resistant soft matte black plastic. On top of the lid, there are a few lines that give the case grip. On the inside, four teardrop LED-lights indicate the battery status of the case. The earpieces are also delightfully compact. They go deep into your ears, due to the rounded, asymmetrical shape of the insides. The Bomaker comes with six different ear tips, which are all thin and short. They don't give the Sifi the tightest fit in your ears - sporting with these may not be smart, but they remain in your ears when shaking or moving your head rapidly. Despite the small size, the Sifi boasts impressive specs. Apart from the IPX7 waterproof rating, the earpieces offer around 6 hours of playtime on medium listening volume. The lightweight charging case can further recharge them five times fully, before needing a recharge itself. One downside for bedtime use: the blue LED-lights on the earpieces keep blinking even when you're using them. CONNECTIVITY AND CONTROLS With a single press, you play or pause the music or take a call. Press twice on the right side to increase the volume, twice on the left side, to decrease it. Advance to the next song by long-pressing the right bud, and return a song by long-pressing the left piece. Lastly, tapping three times activates the voice assistant on your smartphone. Possibly the best control scheme wireless earbuds can have. The Bomaker Sifi has tactile buttons, but they almost press as easy as touch controls. The buttons don't offer the best feedback to your touches, but they work really well. Even when you're wearing gloves, skipping a song, or changing the volume is possible. Connectivity on the Sifi is excellent. The earpieces pair and connect easily, and it's possible to quickly switch between 1 and 2 earpieces,. The Bluetooth signal keeps stable up to ten meters, even with walls in between. Even when you're walking or cycling with them in areas crowded with wireless signals, connection drops never occurred. CALLING AND WATCHING MOVIES Even though the earpieces show telephones on their side buttons, the call quality of the Bomaker Sifi is horrid. With the earpieces disappearing so far into your ears, the microphone has a hard time to pick up your voice. It only puts your voice through soft or not at all, while surrounding noises come through much louder. Watching videos, happily, fares much better. Audio-video synchronization is perfect on Android devices supporting Bluetooth 5.0 and on iPhone too, including the ever-challenging YouTube-app. Like on almost other wireless earphones, there is a noticeable delay in the sound when you're gaming. SOUND QUALITY OF BOMAKER SIFI Bomaker Sifi TWS review.jpg The Bomaker Sifi is among the most versatile and most complete sounding true wireless earphones you can get under $50. It convinces from the bass to the highs. What separates the Bomaker Sifi from its countless competitors, is the clarity on the top end of the sound. Instruments like guitars, pianos, violins and cymbals, brim with life on the Sifi. Vocals, too, sound very clear. In higher quality recordings, it's entirely possible to hear details as grasps and breaths, just like you can hear the string-pulling of guitars and even clicks and clacks from the space where tracks were recorded. With its convincing soundstage and way above average instrument placement, the sound of the Sifi is surrounded by air. At the same time, the Sifi keeps its upper-mids and highs in tone. They never sound too sharp or too loud. The sound of the Bomaker Sifi isn't just pleasant because of its clarity. It already starts at the bass. The Sifi displays dance and pop music as easy as more acoustic genres, with a sweet mid-bass thump and gentle rumbling sub-bass. This bass can strike heavy if a song requests it. On the other hand, the Sifi doesn't blow the bass area up. Whoever's looking for a more Beats-like bass tuning, with constant pumping bass and elevated lower-mids, is probably better off with the SoundPEATS TrueEngine SE or Anker Soundcore Life P2. On the Sifi, the bass plays together perfect with the mids and highs, instead of beating them around the bush. Happily, lower-mids are lifted enough to give music on the Sifi a warm, even smooth sound. The Bomaker Sifi is a little master. Whichever genre you're throwing at it, the Sifi convinces with clarity, dynamics, and detail. It's an amazing listen at just ¬£40 VERDICT It's amazing what you can get out of wireless earbuds so small. The Bomaker Sifi sounds amazing and tops it off with comfort, great battery life, and terrific audio-video synchronization.

I wanted a pair of "true wireless" earbuds so I did a ton of research before buying. Those have now been returned and I bought these instead. Allow me to share what I learned from that experience with you. What I originally wanted: I mostly listen to podcasts while I work out, drive, etc; so I had several requirements. I needed earbuds that worked in 'single mode' in either ear. I wanted to be able to play/pause, skip forward & change volume using the earbuds. I wanted touch controls. I wanted super long battery life. I needed them to be light weight, comfortable & not fall out. I didn't want them to auto-power off if I paused the audio for half an hour. What I learned after my dud purchase of another product: First of all, touch controls are SUPER annoying. You'd think it'd be better, but every time you adjust the position of the earbuds you accidentally change the track or pause the audio, which becomes maddening after a while. Second, forget the huge battery cases that offer 10 million hours of playback, or torches, or phone charges: these are all gimmicks. A smaller case that offers a couple of recharges is much better and more than enough power for several days of use. Why I'm happy with these 'Bomaker' earbuds: Clicky controls! When you adjust the earbuds you're not forever skipping tracks or activating the Google Assistant. They don't have an annoying 'power saving' feature that shuts them off after a period of inactivity, so I can just leave one on standby in my ear. The material is a soft, matte plastic instead of hard gloss, which makes them grippier in your ear. The range is INCREDIBLE, it works in the cellar while my phone is in the attic. The audio doesn't cut out or skip while my phone is in my pocket. Shortcomings of the 'Bomaker' earbuds: It's not all sunshine and rainbows. The microphones are utter crap. Okay for using the Google voice assistant, but completely unfit for phone calls, you'll be completely inaudible. Also they can sometimes slip out. Also the audio quality isn't exactly 5 star: great for podcasts, okayish for music, but let's be real, you're buying ¬£40 earbuds not ¬£140 earbuds. Also the changeover between left/right single mode sometimes glitches and requires that both be placed back in the case and you try again. Also sometimes the pins in the charging case don't align properly and I find a flat earbud after I thought it was charging, just make sure they are straight in the case. Also in single mode the earphones are actually still stuck in stereo (not mono), so you'll not hear half the audio. But overall, I'm very happy with these and would recommend them to anybody. Edit: they were chewed up by my dog. Bummer.

Was looking for low budget high quality earbuds as my Samsung ones were a bid disappointment as these pop-out of my ears. Gave these a go after reading the reviews and I am really happy with these. For the price you get seamless pairing, very light and perfect for your ears. These are perfectly sweat resistant and are well built (I dropped one on a marble floor but no damage done) Due to lower latency, there is minimal lag in connectivity if any. This has real APTX as the sound quality does not change over the Bluetooth connection which really impressed me, although I was expecting a slight decrease in sound quality. These have a decent bass, at this price I would say that it is incredible. Connected these with both IOS and Android with no issues, it was perfect and smooth connection with no dropouts so far. The charging is really fast and playtime is amazing, I easily went through 6 hours without charging these again. I now use them for calls as well, as you can use one earbud. Charging case is super light and easy to carry. Never knew this would become a necessary accessory in my daily life, Highly Recommend this product. The only downside is that someone who is doing intense training might like the ear buds to have more grip, I have not tried these in that case but if these have a wing hook to stick this to ear it would be a great addition! Will update my review if I hit any snags!

PACKAGING The earbuds come in a small white box with the name and a picture of the earbuds printed on it. The box was actually smaller then expected. Inside of the box are the earbuds, a small box containg the charging cable and two ziplock bags with two different types of silicone eartips. Also added is a manual with instructions printed in different languages and there is a small paper which states you have to register the earbuds on the Bomaker website for an additional 6 months warranty. I couldn't find the registration form on their website, so I've send them an e-mail. They responded the next day, writing the extra registration was nog necessary. THE EARBUDS COMFORT/FITTING The earbuds are quite small compared to most of the other earbuds out there. They are also light. This is a possitive thing for the comfort. Despite the light weight, I had some issues fitting them comfortly. This has nothing to do with the size of the earbuds or how they are put in the ear (the somewhat rest in you earcup, in this way they have a quite secure fit) but has more to do with the eartips. With the supplied eartips I just couldn't get a comfortable fit. Like mentioned earlier, there are two types of eartips. Both made of silicone. One is transparent but a bit flimsy. In my case the L eartip was too flimsy and therefore I couldn't get a profer fit/seal. The other eartips are black, but those were too sturdy for a comfortable fit adn therfore putting too much pressure on the inside of my earcanal. Fortunately I had some other eartip from other earbuds, and the fitted the Sifi. With these eartips the fitting is much more comfortable and I can wear the Sifi for a long time without an issue. THE EARBUDS SOUNDQUALITY This is the main aspect of an earbud if you ask me. I was really pleasantly surprised with the soundquality. On forehand I was a bit afraid these wouldn't have enough bass in them. But oh boy, was I mistaken. The earbuds have a lot of clarity and detail in them. When listening to some tracks I heard some details I had not heard before. You might think this would come at the cost of the low end of the soundquality, but no, there is also plenty going on at the low end. I listen to a lot of EDM (I use these mostly in the gym, and the bass is definately there. It's not a boomy phat bass that resonates in your ears, but more a bass that perfectly fits the rest of the frequencies. It's a bass that really compliments the music. I guess it can be described as a Hifi bass (?). Not too overpowering, not too little, just perfect if you ask me. People who also listen a lot to EDM won't be disappointed. But also other kinds of music sounds really nice. I've listend to some tracks of Enya, and those also sounded so nice! Overall I would say these have a balanced sound with a slight bumb in the low end. THE EARBUDS OTHER ASPECS With the earbus you can also control the volume, skip a track or go back, etc. This can be done by pressing the earbuds. This is not an easy thing. You have to press the buttons quite hard, and with that you push the earbuds further in your earcanal, which makes it not comfortable to control the volume/tracks/etc. For me no really a big issue because I actually always use my phone for these kind of things. But I you are a person who doesn't take this into concideration. I haven't used them yet to make a phonecall, but from what I've read the call quality isn't that great. What is great is the latency when watching videos on youtube for example. There simply isn't any latency. Thumbs up for that! CONCLUSION So there you have it. Great earbuds for a fantastic price. Lot's of detail and clarity in the sound and still with a good amount of sound in the lower spectrum. I would descibe it as balanced earbuds with a slight bumb in the low end, makeing them perfect for almost every kind of music you throw at them. The fitting/comfort is a bit of a mixed bag for me but the solution was found in a different set of eartips I had lyiing around. Ofcourse this can vary from person to person.

i am a self confessed bluetooth earphone addict. or conneseur as people in denial would describe it. i want to start off by saying these earphones are serious business. they easily exceed their price range and i‚Äôll put these on par with my ¬£60 overhead headphones. the bass and the highs are ferocious, so so powerful! the range is seemingly endless and you will hear things you hadn‚Äôt noticed in your music before. pair that with the fact these seal out the outside world and you really will be transported to a world within the music

I tried Enacfire, Anker and Creative but these are the best in this price range. The sound is clear in all spectrum, loud and crisp with a hint of bass and no noise. I personally prefer a bit more of bass but this will do. The battery time is ok but what I absolutely love the most about them is the fit. I have very big ears and it was always hard for me to find a perfect fit but these have 7 different tips of 2 different shapes and they never fall out (I did the head banging test). They're also probably one of the smallest and lightest earphones on the market so they're very comfortble and don't fatigue your ears at all. After 2 minutes you don't even notice they're in your ears. Overall, very good purchase.

Bought these to use at work for music & phone. These have a name, no one has ever heard of, these work very well, connection to my Samsung note 9 phone with no problem. Iam using Amazon prime music HD service for my music streaming. The Quality of sound it very, very good for my ears. I have worn these for 4hrs will no breaks before battery need charging up. The charging box is like a small pill box, very next. Iam no expert on audio, but I know good quality sound. I have 2 sets of AKG Headphones and some bluetooth Sony MDR770 which are very good. I have just bought some 5 star rated Philip's fidelio x2hr which are really good. But for out and about you will not go wrong with these. They are very comfortable to wear and the sound they produce is very good. If they had Bose stamped on them you would be paying ¬£150.00. Forget the brand and give them a try.

I wouldn't have bought these earphones, as they don't come from an established maker and they are rather cheap. Previous experiences with no-name, cheap earphones had been rather unfortunate. However a friend bought these on a whim and praised them quite a lot - so I thought I would give them a try. These have been a rather nice surprise, and the sound is incredibly decent, with plenty of detail, good bass and a pleasant tonality overall. They connect very quickly to your device and don't seem too fussy. For the price (often reduced even more on Amazon) these are a steal and I would highly recommend them - even to people who care about sound.

Pros - Clear and detailed mids and higs - Lightweight and small ear buds - One of the smallest TWS cases (easy to carry) - Good material quality, sleek design - Satisfying battery performance for a small case and lightweight design. - Functional buttons (play, pause, skip, call, volume up-down, voice assistant...) - 6 different ear tips - Bluetooth 5.0, aptx, AAC, ipx7... Cons - Microphone ( it catches your voice however some background noises also interfere) - It is not a perfect and comfortable fit for your ears. It is good for daily use but not fully stable for exercise. - It could disturb your ears after long use (I couldn't find a perfect ear tip for my ears, also tried external foam tips, result was same. One of my friends tried and he likes the position and fitting). - Noise isolation is not perfect, but acceptable. - Highs is a bit harsh in high levels of sound. - Bass is relatively weak, but acceptable. - The ear buds do not cut the bluetooth connection when you put them im on the the case.

There really good, especially the price! I was really happy when I received these! Really good quality and all around satisfied with them. So far so good sound quality is spot on was also expecting lip sync while watching videos etc but none ,expecting for them to keep falling out of ears and with the extra little ear adjusters they never fall out even gone running with them. Overall, an amazing set of earphones.

These headphones are very cool - you can have the sides or the ears light up, or both together. I got the black ones and the light is blue. They connect via Bluetooth just like any other Bluetooth device. They are comfortable and look good. The one thing I would like them to have is a sound limiter to protect children's ears (particularly as my son is normally in competition with a rather loud television round his grandma's!) but apart from that they are purr-fect!

So when these finally arrived (the first time was "misplaced") they're fantastic. Wireless Bluetooth mode: the sound for music is fantastic and they do pretty well as almost noise cancelling when you're listening to your tunes. For voice calls though it turns almost tinny, not the best quality which is kinda weird. Bluetooth microphone: so when calling with my partner, he said it was crackly and kept dipping in and out. Wired music sound: same as bluetooth, no difference except you cant change the volume on the headset. Wired microphone: much better sound quality when listening and is also much clearer according to my partner. Lights: they're cute! Quite bright but not blinding thankfully. I can take a picture in the sunlight and the glow can be seen so not bad! All in all they were a great purchase after they finally arrived 4 days after i ordered them on prime. I feel nervous when putting the headphones on because they feel like they'll snap but that might just be me being nervous. The top cushion is kinda soft and the ear pads themselves are quite comfortable. Plus they're cute
Got for my granddaughter for Christmas, she's very pleased with her headphones.

The product itself is great. But one of the earphones snapped off the headband just after the return period. Not excessive usage, no strange handling at the time (I was there and saw it happen). Can't return now, but quality of product is a question.

TL:DR: I knew they were cheap, but I didn't expect them to be this bad Sound: Sound is passable when wired, about what you'd expect from cheap headphones. On bluetooth the quality is dreadful, sound is muffled and often choppy and broken up, particularly if used for gaming, the microphone sounds like you're calling from the bottom of a well filled with porridge and when there's supposed to be silence there's a constant high pitched squeal of interference Comfort: Actually not that adjustable, mostly just a big spring designed for people with small heads Lights: The multicoloured lights just cycle through all the colours, you can't pick one. When the lights are on, there's a background buzz (not the same as the high pitched squeal you get when using the bluetooth) and if you're using the wired connection to a laptop, the lights come on at random times like when you unplug it or hit play on spotify.

I bought these headphones to take place of some cheaper JBL bluetooth headphones I had, since the cost of these is almost cheaper than replacing a lost rubber earpiece for the JBLs. Intending to use these for running and mowing the lawn, I didn't want to invest a significant amount of money. I'm very glad I did and extremely happy with the product so far (about a month's worth of usage). Compared to the JBLs, several points I like better: * Battery life - I haven't specifically timed it, but for being smaller and lighter than the JBLs, the battery definitely lasts longer. * Comfort - I haven't even tested the other earpieces included with the headphones, but I really have no reason to. They stay put and allow me to wear them for hours on end. Additionally, they block a lot of exterior noise with the fit in ear. * Operation - One thing I hated about the JBLs is the volume up/track advance button used a single click/multiple click operation to distinguish. It was extremely annoying because if you wanted to bump the volume up 2 clicks, you would accidentally advance track. These headphones use a single click/hold operation for the same, so the same issue is non-existent. * Sound quality - While definitely not what you'd get from higher end ear-buds, the sound quality is great especially considering price point. For something I may break or lose within the next year, this is one of the better tech purchases I've made in a while. I would not hesitate to recommend these to anyone!

Most amazing bass I heard on Bluetooth headset so far ! The noise cancelling is 100% effective and the sound quality is Just amazing ! It has an amazing range of 35ft ! Easy to setup. Supports Google assistant and Siri. Making and ending calls is easy and have excellent call quality !

These headphones surpass their price tag! See attached photo for all of the included ear piece sizes, making them completely customizable and comfortable for anyone. The sound quality is very good, and the fact that both ear pieces are magnetic to each other is very convenient for them not tangling. They charge quickly, and have held their charge very well for 5+ hours. No issues with connectivity and very user friendly. I highly recommend these !!!!

Pros: 1) I was quite pleasantly surprised that this headset comes in fantastic packaging with a beautiful case and little accessories, such as a selection of earbud sizes and ear wings! 2) Decent price point. 3) Blocks out external sound quite well. 4) Keep in mind that this isn't for audiophiles, however it has good sound quality for something at this price point and super battery life. I didn't time it, but the battery seemed to last 8-10 hours, which is amazing! 5) Good as an inexpensive wireless bluetooth headset option. 6) The shorter wire helps prevent it from dangling and getting caught on things. Cons: 1) The wire itself is a bit short, so it might feel claustrophobic for people with thicker necks. It can still fit around bigger necks. 2) I'm not sure if it's a setting. It doesn't seem to turn on and connect automatically when I pull the magnets apart, like my other headset of a different brand does. 3) It would be nice if the charging connector was USB C, since most newer phones use that and it's easier to just have to tote around one charging cable and block.

Pros: It has Bluetooth 5.0, IPX7 and a whooping 9 hours playtime on a single charge! You can literally use these like 6-8 times without charging to the gym. it has a noise reduction mic for clearer phone calls and its bass is quite good! It has a hands free calling and dual connection so you can just pair it with your phone and not take time to disconnect and reconnect with other devices. I would definitely recommend it!

Auricolari bluetooth ottimi. Abbinati con Huawei p9, impiegano 3 secondi precisi a collegarsi al telefono. Provate in situazione di ascolto musica a casa e si sono comportate egregiamente, vedremo quando le user√≤ per attivit√† sportiva. Mi sento di consigliarle, se trovate in offerta meglio ancora. Anche la durata della batteria √® buona, circa 8 ore secondo una mia stima. (Ancora da provare accuratamente)

I have both the mpow thor, and mpow flame headphones and I lost the flame ones so I bought these as a replacement. I then found the flame and thought I'd compare the two before returning the S1s here. Turns out I'm going to keep the S1 as I love them too and for the price it's not a big deal to keep them both. I did pair both the S1 and the flame at the same time to my note 8 in dual bluetooth mode so I could listen to one of each in left and right ears. The S1 does seem to have a better bass response and sounds better but I feel this is due to them having a better seal on my ears than driver quality. The flame never seemed to sit in my ears too well because the ear wrap over the top seems to keep them from sitting tight I to my ear canal. That being said the ear wrap on the flame has never once let them fall out playing basketball and exercising vigorously. The S1 have a magnet on them which should be great because I put the flames around my neck alot when not in use and they fall left or right easily or if i jump the fly off, so this may be something to consider. The S1 definitely feel lighter on the ear, more like you dont have any headphones in at all compared to the flame. Also the flame wouldn't sit inside my ski helmet this winter due to their size so I'm hoping the S1 will be better in that regard as well but I haven't tested that yet. S1 build quality feels better too, the flame seem a bit cheaper in plastic quality but they have held up in the shower and sweating for a year now so I think the S1 will do just as well. Overall I would take the S1 over the flame in the end, it's worth the small cost increase for sure.
It is a very good product, it sounds great and you can also use Siri at any time.

I'm onto my second pair of these, the first pair are in a field in Staffordshire somewhere having unknowingly dropped them. So impressed I bought the same again They are rated for 2-3 hours playback. I was getting 4h30m although I was listening to chatty podcasts generally with only infrequent bursts of heavy metal. As the batteries aged I imagine this would drop but I only had them 4 weeks and the replacements are new so I'm yet to find out Charge case proved handy for recharging whilst out. Overall charge time is about 80mins Sound quality for the price is very good. A decent amount of bass, top end is clear too with cymbals sounding clear. I work outdoors so get through more headphones than I should so tend to stick to ¬£20 and under. These are the best bluetooth (not wired) buds I've had in that price range and they were only ¬£11. They are pretty close in sound quality to my Skullcandy Ink'd although they aren't as good as old the Smokin' Buds I have The bluetooth pairing is impressive, really quick and the earbuds are independent of one another so you can use one for 4 hours then the other one for another 4 whilst the first one charges again. I did this when I was in the middle of nowhere for a couple of days. They are serious value for money just don't lose them

Pay the extra money and get a decent pair. As of the 12th of January the right earbud has completely stopped working.

I absolutely love these earbuds. Their sound quality is amazing, battery case is amazing and best of all, the 2 earbuds can be used individually which is very good for me as i use one at a time. I deliver for a living and it gets very boring on the job as you're doing the same task the whole day which can last upto 13 hours. So i listen to podcasts, audio books etc which keeps things a bit interesting. This is where these earbuds come in, i use these to listen to that stuff. First i don't want to use both at the same time as it can be distracting for the road and legally not allowed in the state i live in and i prefer to have one ear open to listen to traffic/surroundings. I use one earbud and it lasts around 4 hours on a charge when it is depleted, i use the other one and put the first on charge. This lets me listen to my podcasts and audio books throughout the day without any charge time. The charging time of the case and the earbuds are also very fast and the case can be fully charged in 2 or so hours. The case is very well designed and uses magnets so your earbuds don't rattle around causing damage to themselves and the case. The case has a touch button at the bottom which when touched shows the battery percentage left on the case. It can charge the earbuds for surprisingly large number of times, i was pretty amazed at that. One case charge lasts more than a week for me. The battery capacity is huge and it also acts as a battery bank if you need it in case of emergency. It can probably charge a phone fully one time with its 3500 maH battery. 140 hours claim is a bit of an exaggeration, you can practically get around 100 - 120 hours if you use one earbud at a time on a fully charged case. Very good product, definitely recommended. The sound quality is amazing and the bass is also very good on these, I've used other ones in the past and have to say these are by far the best ones i have used yet. I'd suggest using the largest rubber tips it comes with (unless you have small ears, in that case use the default ones) which makes the noise cancelling a lot better.

Where to start well I needed new gym headphones as I have the plug in type and I keep catching the wire on the equipment and my phone goes flying so for the safety of my phone and ears haha I got bluetooth ones So postage was quick quicker than started arrived a day earlier and I was headed to the gym that evening so straigt away opened it all up and charged them up (which took approx two hours) I used the wall USB this time but hey include an adapter for your phone to charge this way too, which luckily fits my Samsung A50! They came 50% charged already the charging pod and the headphones. The instructions are clear and easy too follow, they connected to my phone very easily labelled s3 pro Sound quality is clear and can go quite loud , you can also make calls and use then independently instructions also provided handy when I go the the gym with the other half so we can chat still, The case feels nice and weighty not cheap plastic. The battery barely moved for the 2 hours I was in the gym Big bonus is the fact they got my small ears and didn't fall out very comfortable and didn't hurt my ears like others have and the fact I have one ear with many piercings!, there is different side ear plugs to adapt to your ear size. It's a nice side pod to carry about fitted in my gym bag would even fit in my gym trousers on the small pocket I have on them , not that I need to take the pod with me as the charge as I said held well. So overall good purchase for a running gym addict like me and cheaper less expensive than the well known brands

I had these headphones for over two weeks, thought I'd test it out properly before leaving a review. I'm a cab driver and need handsfree for work so I went through few different ones over the years and this one by far is my favourite. The price is low compared to some others. Looks: with people walking around with ipods I was looking for an android version, the last ones I bought looked like ipods on picture but was twice the size so didn't even wear it once, gave it to my son. These compete very well, they aren't bulky and don't pop outside of the ear like some I've seen. Fittings: I use the largest coverings, they fit tight without any gaps so blocks outside noise from going in so you can hear sound without any outside interference. Also with the movement of the head they will not come off but have to say I haven't used it while jogging or anything like that. Connection: the earpods connected to the phone straight away. I also like the idea that every time you take it out of the holder, it'll automatically connect to the phone and when you put it back in it automatically disconnects so you don't have to switch off and on every time on the earpods. Sound and voice: I mostly use it in the car and also used it few times outside and can say sound and voice is clear and had no breaks. Apart from other calls speak to the wife couple of times a day and if there was any problems listening to me she would've definitely let me know. Google voice recognition works well as well as listening to videos and all that. Earpod holder: the holder is also a power bank for the earpods and charges when they are in the holder, after daily moderate usage for over two weeks it still has over 90% charge. On the case there's initials 'R' and 'L' to indicate which ear the pods are for. Negatives: I really like the holder but it's not small and light so another gadget to carry especially during warmer weather when you wouldn't be wearing extra clothing with extra pockets. The touchscreen is very sensitive and doesn't always do what you want it to do and the slightest touch often accidentally on the earpods can change modes even when you take it out of the holder and put it on your ear accidental touch often switches it off.

Der Klang ist recht ausgewogen. Wenn die Kn√∂pfe gut im Ohr sitzen, kommt auch ausreichend Bass durch, daf√ºr ist aber ein optimaler Sitz erforderlich. Sie sitzen bequem und fest, lassen sich per Touch bedienen, was nicht immer optimal ist, daf√ºr sollen sie wasserdicht sein, was mit mechanischen Tastern vielleicht nicht funktioniert h√§tte. Was bei diesem Set gut ist, man bekommt die St√∂psel problemlos aus dem Case, das ist nicht immer so. Die Ladebox ist super. Es zeigt den Akkustatus jedes Earbuds separat an, zus√§tzlich den Ladestand des integrierten Akkus in Prozent. Das hatte ich bisher noch bei keinem Set. Die Nutzung als Powertbank ist im Notfall sicherlich auch ganz praktisch. Kann nach ersten Tests nichts Negatives berichten. F√ºr das gebotene finde ich die Preis-Leistung richtig gut.

Die wasserabweisenden, sowie kabellosen In-Ear Kopfh√∂rer von bakibo, √ºberzeugen mich nicht nur durch ihren angenehmen Klang, auch die Qualit√§t, Haptik und Funktionalit√§t der Ladebox ist sehr gut gelungen. Anstatt einer einfachen LED, die √ºblicherweise den Ladezustand der Box anzeigt, verf√ºgt die hochwertig verarbeitete Ladebox, zus√§tzlich √ºber eine LED-Prozentangabe. Die Anzeige finde ich sehr praktisch, und solch eine hatte es bei meinen bisherigen Kopfh√∂rern, bzw. Ladeboxen, nicht gegeben. Aufgeladen wird die Ladebox mit dem beigef√ºgten USB-C Ladekabel. Falls die Ladequelle ebenfalls auf USB-C basiert, wurde der Lieferung daf√ºr ein passender Adapter hinzugef√ºgt Die Ohrh√∂rer passen gut in den H√∂rgang und sind auch nach einer l√§ngeren Zeit noch angenehm zu tragen. Um den besten Klang zu erzielen, sollte man die beigef√ºgten Silikon-Ohrpads nacheinander ausprobieren. Wenn diese n√§mlich nicht optimal in dem H√∂rgang sitzen, kann es zu einem minderwertigen Klangempfinden kommen, bei dem dann meist der volumin√∂se Bass fehlt. Das Pairing der Bluetooth-Ohrh√∂rer erweist sich als einfach. Eine beiliegende Anleitung, auch in deutscher Sprache, erkl√§rt dies detailliert und verst√§ndlich. Ich bin sehr zufrieden mit dem Gesamtpaket, und empfehle diese In-Ear Kopfh√∂rer gerne weiter.

Es ist schon Wahnsinn, was es inzwischen f√ºr wirklich kleines Geld an guten Earbuds gibt. Die Ladestation ist stabil und zeigt den Ladestand der Station sowie jedes einzelnen Earbuds digital an. Ein tolles Feature in dieser Preisklasse. Die Steuerung erfolgt √ºber Touch-Funktion - daran muss man sich gew√∂hnen und bei mir klappt es zugegebener Ma√üen nicht immer, aber meistens. Im Notfall √§ndert man Song oder Lautst√§rke dann doch direkt √ºber das Handy. Mit dem auch das Koppeln problemfrei und dauerhaft funktioniert und auch die Annahme von Telefonaten selbsterkl√§rend ist. Der Sound ist gut. Ich vergleiche ihn mit anderen Kopfh√∂rern dieser Preisklasse und hier f√§llt er weder positiv noch negativ hervor. Man muss auf jeden Fall auf den korrekten Sitz der Earbuds achten, ansonsten gibt es deutliche Abz√ºge bei Klang und Bass. Macht man alles richtig, ist es ein klangm√§√üig gutes Produkt. Mich hat das Ladestands-Display √ºberzeugt. Die zus√§tzliche Funktion auch als Powerbank zu funktionieren nehme ich gerne mit. Ich bin wirklich begeistert!

This is a decent choice of earphones for those like me who wouldn't want to spend a fortune on other models. Been using it for last few days and I think this is almost good, but some improvements could make it even better. 1. The set: * The whole set is brilliant * Came with Rechargeable Case, a USB C connector for the case, earpods, spare covers and instructions booklet. * The earpod is small and compact 2. Sound Quality * A few occasions, I felt that the sound lacked bass and was a bit flat. I heard tracks like Skyfall from Apple music, but tracks weren't as great as hearing with normal earphones. I realised that you have to push the earpod deep into your ear to hear some depth. * For the price, i am not going to complain about sound quality (I already did, didn't I) * Calls - Couple of people I spoke to have already complained that they couldn't hear me over this. :( So I need to find the perfect position/angle to wear this in... 3. Fitting * I still haven't figured out what is the best way to wear this. With L/R markings not being available, I feel these would go only one way with the face of the earpod facing the front, so our fingers can operate the touch control. * One thing which frustrates me every time is, every time i pick this to fit, or hold it to adjust the position in my ear, my finger tips invariably touches the touch control, which plays/pauses music or makes a redial. There is so little space to hold it to fit, so accidentally i end up touching the button even if i didn't wanted to. With this problem, if say my finger tips is touching the button for 5 seconds as i try to position it perfectly on my ear - it turns off the earpod. Gurrr. * Overall, bi fiddly to fix it on my ears. 4. Battery * Super impressed. No concerns. The case is a blessing in disguise offering multiple charging opportunities

These are really good quality. They were on special offer for half the normal price so they are a bit of a bargain. I picked them because they were Amazon recommended and I really need wireless ones. They come with a really smart charging box which battery life seems to last a really long time. They are comfortable sitting in the ears and has adequate noise cancellation. I say adequate because I don't really think you can get the same level noise cancellation as you can with over ear headphones but it is good enough and much better than my iphone earphones! I really like these. There are a couple of issues with them though is that it is a little confusing to get them going and the instructions don't provide all that much help. I got there in the end after playing around however, there does seem to be a bit of a design flaw (or I am just not techie enough to figure out to stop it happening) but it seems that every time I touch them, or push them into my ears that the earphones randomly call people. I called my parents (luckily) at 2am whilst I was trying to sleep. Then yesterday I called my boss while he was in an important meeting, for which he came out of to find me thinking there was an emergency - It is a bit embarrassing. They seem so sensitive but I can't figure out how to stop it. If anybody can shed some light on this then please help out this little non techie here hahahahah. Other than this though, I think these are great earphones :)

Es un dos en uno genial!!

Bought to replace the wired headphones supplied with my I phone. Had three objectives in buying these: 1) for a better fit as I find that the I phone headset doesn‚Äôt fit well & can come out whilst active. 2) on part, because of (1) the wired headphones don't cut out all the piped music in the gym, leading me to need a higher volume. 3) for the gym, I find that the cable isn‚Äôt quite long enough. Have tried them over an extended time period now; both at the gym before lockdown and during home workouts. Used all three sizes of silicone ear pieces to try to get a good fit but non provide a sure enough grip to hold in for any length of time; particularly as you get further into a routine & skin surface of the ear becomes moist. Found myself regularly having to stop to pick one up/dig out from under a piece of kit at the gym & re-fit. In doing so, usually triggered one of the controls for volume/Siri/track advance or calling the last number since all these "controls" seem to be equipped with a hare trigger. If you want something to enable you to loose a cable connection whilst sitting listening to music/streaming a film, they'd probably be ok but if you want something to use in anything activity-based, avoid like the plague. A shame really as the sound quality is pretty good and whilst going to the gym 2-3 times a week (around 2 hrs per session), I didn't have to charge the case again after my initial charge up to the point of lock-down.

Egal ob In Ears, OnEars, OverEars mit und ohne ANC. Ein Kopfh√∂rer muss mich auf Wunsch klanglich mitrei√üen k√∂nnen und wenn er das noch bequem und zuverl√§ssig leistet, w√§re mein pers√∂nliches Anforderungsprofil bereits mehr als erf√ºllt! Meine feste √úberzeugung ist das Klang immer rein subjektiver Natur ist und auch die ganze "vermeintliche" Fachpresse und selbsternannten Klangprofis im Netz und auch hier, einen Faktor komplett ausgeblendet haben, denn ihre/meine Meinung ist immer nur ein Mosaiksteinchen und wer das 1000% ige H√∂rerlebnis sucht, befindet sich auf der Suche nach dem Heiligen Gral und wird vermutlich niemals zum Ziel kommen. Zu viele Faktoren beeinflussen, manipulieren oder sind einfach selbst gesetzte Z√§une, die kein noch so guter Kopfh√∂rer je zu √ºberwinden in der Lage w√§re. Was ich damit sagen will, wer hier Nachtritt ist selber Schuld...! Mein Fazit vielleicht als Spoiler voran gestellt: Der Jabra Elite H85 ist sicherlich nicht perfekt (siehe o. g. Gr√ºnde), ist aber auch Meilenweit davon entfernt ein rein Mittelm√§√üiger Klangwiedergabepartner zu sein. Wer sich in unserer Schnelllebigen Zeit etwas Zeit nimmt wird auch f√ºr den "vermeintlich" gehobenen Anspruch hier voll auf seine Kosten kommen und dies sowohl "mit" als auch "ohne" Noise Cancelling. Was bekomme ich f√ºr mein Geld geliefert: Peripherien: Im mittlerweile (fast) schon standardisierten Frustfreien Pappkarton bekommt man neben dem Kopfh√∂rer ein ansehnliches Transportcase, einen Flugzeugadapter, ein Audiokabel sowie ein USB-C Kabel (beides eher mittelm√§√üiger G√ºte). Der "√ºbliche Papierkram" in Form einer Garantieerkl√§rung und einem Beiblatt mit Warnhinweisen ist ebenfalls an Bord. Wer eine Bedienungsanleitung o. √§. sucht muss sich entweder die M√ºhe machen, diese online zu ergattern oder √ºber die "zwingend" erforderliche Jabra Sound + App. (Hierzu sp√§ter aber noch mehr). Technik: Wer schon Jabra oder vergleichbare Kopfh√∂rer in Nutzung hat, wird sich hier sicher langweilen und kann diesen Absatz gerne √ºberspringen... 1. Die von Jabra implementierte intelligente Aktive Ger√§uschunterdr√ºckung (ANC) um Umgebungsger√§usche (Stimmen, Motorenl√§rm, Bahngleise/asphaltierte Stra√üen, maulenden Partner/Kollegen oder schnarchende Sitznachbarn usw. herauszufiltern 2. Die SmartSound-Funktion, welche Ihre Umgebung analysiert und die den eigenen Vorstellungen entsprechenden Audioregulierungen vornimmt (diese m√ºssen nat√ºrlich zuvor in der App bzgl. ANC und HearThrough festgelegt werden) 3. Ein sehr potenter verbauter Lithium-Ionen Akku sorgt bei aktiviertem ANC f√ºr bis zu 36 Stunden Akkulaufzeit 4. Jabra wirbt mit spezieller Nanotechnologie an den verbauten Materialien, f√ºr diejenigen unter uns, die den Kopfh√∂rer regelm√§√üig bei Events wie der Rallye Paris-Dakar oder Extremsportarten im Sand/Regen tragen m√∂chten. IP 52 Zertifizierung ist hier Ehrensache, klingt aber gegen√ºber dem Werbeslogan "..den Elementen trotzen..." recht lapidar ;-) 5. One-Touch-Verbindung mit Amazon Alexa, Siri oder Google Assistant 6. OnEar Erkennung (Der Kopfh√∂rer merkt wann er auf- bzw. abgesetzt wird und reagiert entsprechend indem er sich An- oder abschaltet bzw. pausiert) In "nackten" Fakten das wichtigste niedergeschrieben: Bauform: Over-Ear-Kopfh√∂rer (geschlossen ANC) Konnektivit√§t: Bluetooth 5.0, 3,'5 er Klinke Bandbreite: 10Hz - 20kHz Treiber: 40 mm Gewicht: 296 Ma√üe: 195mm L√§nge x 82mm Breite x 225mm H√∂he Akkuladung: 2,5 Stunden bei kompletter Entleerung und speziellem Ladeadapter (nicht im Lieferumfang enthalten), sonst etwa 3,5 Stunden Zertifizierungen: Bluetooth 5.0, CE, FCC, IC, RoHS, REACH, MFI Herstellergarantie: 2 Jahre Optik und Haptik: Ist nat√ºrlich auch eine ganz eigene Empfindung. Die Verarbeitung des Elite 85h ist f√ºr mich pers√∂nlich sehr gut geraten. Lauscherpassform, Kopfband mit Stoffbezug als auch die mit Proteinleder bezogenen Lauscher machen einen wertigen Gesamteindruck ohne dabei unn√∂tig klobig zu wirken. Die Kopfh√∂rer wurden konzipiert um getragen zu werden (auch viel und lange) und das sp√ºrt man auch beim auspacken der Kopfh√∂rer. Die Lauscher weisen eine weiche Polsterung auf und die Ohren werden hiermit komplett umschlossen. Die Steuerungselemente sind sorgsam implementiert. Am linken Lauscher befindet sich der Regler f√ºr die Navigation der einzelnen Sound Modi (ANC An/Aus, HearTrough). Der rechte Lauscher ist f√ºr die √ºblichen Steuerungen wie Laut- und Leise, das Skipping, Audio-In-Betrieb, Sprachassi on/off sowie die Ladebuchse vorgesehen. Tragegef√ºhl/Passform: Die Lauscher liegen bei mir (ich habe nach Br√ºsseler EU Norm einen exakt durchschnittlichen mitteleurop√§ischen Eierkopf) fest auf, ohne die Ohren hierbei abzudr√ºcken. Nach ca. 5,5 Stunden habe ich den Kopfh√∂re heute das erste mal kurz abgenommen um die Ohren etwas "auszul√ºften". W√§rmeentwicklung ist ok und bei ANC Kopfh√∂rern entsteht gerade bei h√∂heren Au√üentemperaturen auch schon mal ein wenig Schwei√ü an den aufliegenden Stellen. Das Kopfband liegt angenehm auf. Von der Passform her passt der Jabra Kopfh√∂rer auch Brillentr√§gern oder Menschen wie mir, die gerne mal eine Kappe drunter tragen. Bedienung in der Praxis: Die Steuerung des Kopfh√∂rers macht absolut Spa√ü und funktioniert einwandfrei. Kopfh√∂rer aufklappen und die Verbindung (nach Ersteinrichtung) wird binnen weniger Sekunden aufgebaut. Kopfh√∂rer zu klappen und die Verbindung wird unterbrochen und der KH f√§llt in einen Tiefschlaf. Skipping und Lautst√§rketasten lasen sich durch zwei kleine Kontaktpunkte leicht ertasten und zielgenau und ohne langes "herumfuchteln" einsetzen. Wird der Kopfh√∂rer abgesetzt und beispielsweise um den Hals gelegt schaltet er mit etwa 2 Sekunden Zeitunterschied in den Pausemodus. Setzt man ihn wieder auf den Kopf geht es musikalisch genau dort weiter wo man vorher unterbrochen hat oder unterbrochen wurde. Der gew√§hlte Bluetoothstandard 5.0 b√ºrgt f√ºr zuverl√§ssige und auch f√ºr mehrere Ger√§te gleichzeitig sichere Verbindungsmomente. Dieser d√ºrfte enben dem Akku auch f√ºr die extrem langen Laufzeiten des KH mitverantwortlich sein. Die Verbindung bleibt hier stabil bestehen bis auf eine Entfernung von +/- 10 Metern. Das ANC des Jabra: Nicht nur hier bei diesem Kopfh√∂rer scheiden sich regelm√§√üig die Geister und ist wie so vieles im Leben relativ zu sehen. Der Kopfh√∂rer hat tats√§chlich ein Grundrauschen mit im Gep√§ck, dies ist ein Fakt. Ob es nun den einen st√∂rt oder dem anderen egal ist, sofern die Reduktion der Au√üenger√§usche gut funktioniert sei dahingestellt. Mir pers√∂nlich tut dies keinen Abbruch, da ich pers√∂nlich die Kopfh√∂rer trage um ungest√∂rt Musik zu h√∂ren. Wer den Kopfh√∂rer aufsetzt um "Totale Stille" erleben zu wollen muss sich entweder nach einer Alternative umsehen oder neben den knapp 300 Euro f√ºr den KH noch f√ºr 1,20 Euro ein paar Silikonst√∂psel besorgen, welche im √ºbrigen den gleichen Job machen w√ºrden ohne hierf√ºr extra einen Kopfh√∂rer kaufen zu m√ºssen. Das Grundrauschen ist wahrnehmbar aber f√ºr meine Begriffe und Anspr√ºche absolut nicht st√∂rend. Der Klang: Hier wieder der Hinweis, dass egal ob nun jemand dar√ºber sinniert, dass der Elite 85H genauso "gut" klingt wie der Bose QC35II o. √§. ein f√ºr meine Begriffe absolut rundes und volles Klangspektrum anbietet. Die Betonung des Kopfh√∂rers ist, wenn man die App an seine Seite wei√ü eigentlich frei w√§hlbar und l√§sst sich nach eigenem Gusto frei variieren, was ich pers√∂nlich sehr gelungen finde. Die B√§sse satt, die Mitten gerade heraus und sehr seidige H√∂hen. (Falls man mit dieser Umschreibung etwas anzufangen wei√ü..!?) Ein ABER, gibt es hier allerdings auch zu vermerken. Der Bass "knackt" unter Volllastbetrieb. (Auch nach Softwareupdate in der Deutschen Version) und zwingt dazu, den Kopfh√∂rer auf ein Maximum von ca. 90 % zu drosseln. Dies ist sicherlich in der Preisklasse ein Handicape, aber aufgrund der ansonsten sehr guten klanglichen Ausstreuung des Kopfh√∂rer f√ºr mich pers√∂nlich kein K.O. Kriterium. Ob es hierzu ein noch ein passendes Update geben wird, bleibt abzuwarten. Ich h√∂re sehr viel Rock, Hardrock, Metall, aber auch Pop, HipHop und Ska mit dem Kopfh√∂rer und finde s√§mtliche Genres sehr gut wiedergegeben. Auch Filme anschauen macht hier√ºber Spa√ü und sollte auf jeden Fall einmal ausprobiert werden. Die Sound + App: Wichtig! Ohne die Sound + App aus dem Playstore sollte man vom Kauf des Kopfh√∂rers absehen! S√§mtliche Funktionalit√§ten und Features lassen sich nur hiermit nutzen. Von der Konfiguration und Auswahl des Sprachassistenten (Alexa, Siri etc.), des Firmwareupdates, dem Smart Sound, welcher wirklich toll in der Praxis funktioniert, der On-Ear-Erkennung bis hin zur Registrierung (bei den Datensammlern von Jabra) und Last but not Least der Auswahl ob man den letzten Standort mit Kopfh√∂rer angezeigt bekommen m√∂chte ist hier alles drin enthalten. Zudem ersieht man hier, das zum aktuellen Datum 26.04.2019 die aktuelle Deutsche Firmware Version 1.1.6(1031) verwendet wird. Zuvor habe ich bereits innerhalb von 48 Stunden 2 Updates erhalten. Ich hoffe, das vielleicht die eine oder andere Information bei der √úberlegung zum Kauf oder eben dem Nichtkauf des Kopfh√∂rers beitragen konnte?! In jedem falle gilt, Sie allein bestimmen, was f√ºr Sie geht oder eben nicht geht. Was Ihnen klanglich gef√§llt oder nicht. Wie leise ANC sein muss oder eben nicht. Ich pers√∂nlich denke der Jabra Elite 85h l√§sst im Hinblick auf das Grundrauschen und den aktuell noch "knackenden" Bass unter Volllast nat√ºrlich noch Luft nach oben, macht aber andererseits sehr viele Dinge sehr gut und l√§sst hier einige direkte Mitkonkurrenten in der Preisklasse, wie ich meine ein St√ºck weit hinter sich. Machen Sie sich selber ein Bild und lassen Sie nicht andere f√ºr sich entscheiden, was gut oder vermeintlich nicht gut ist! In diesem Sinne Rock on!

I currently use Sennheiser HD4.5 over ear NC headphones, and also Bose QC20i in ear headphones, so I have current experience with noise cancellation. Once upon a time - Bose were the only real masters of this technology, but others have caught up - Jabra included. These headphones exude quality, and the case is very "Bose Quiet Comfort - like" in its appearance. As noise cancellation goes - They perform as well as my Bose QC20 and Sennheiser HD headphones. However, what sets these headphones apart from others is the innovative convenience features. Twisting the cans from stored to open turns on the headphones, and they connect when placed on the ears. Removing them from your ears pauses playback, and returning them continues playback. This feature sounds simple, but the impact is amazing. When at work, if someone comes to your desk, simply removing them and placing on your neck pauses playback without the need to press any other buttons on the phone or headphones, and I find this quite brilliant. The volume buttons on the side are concealed behind the mesh, making for a clean look - The play/pause button too, My only gripe with the look of the headphones is that the band and pads show oils from your skin very readily, and if you wear hair wax it's very visible on the band. There are other finishes that could have reduced this. Sound quality is good, and there's an equaliser on the phone app that can be adjusted to your preference. Treble is bright and not too harsh, bass is punchy and impactful. I'm satisfied with the sound quality for my preferred rock music. I do need to try them out on Classical though. Alexa integration is good for normal functions, but a bit clumsy with playback through Amazon music (asking Alexa to play an album). Hopefully this will be addressed. If you use Alexa to play music, it continues without any way of pausing as it doesn't appear to launch Amazon music on the phone, but streams through the headphones. It doesn't pause when removing the headphones. Very odd. You actually have to tell Alexa to stop. It seems Jabra have been working on features right up until release, as "Smartsound" invoked a software update on the headphones. Currently, "Smartsound" is quite basic, but will no doubt be enhanced through software updates. Currently - The app lets you set up 4 different profiles - My Moment, Commute, In public, In private. Each profile is customisable in terms of equalisation and Noise Cancellation (On / Off / Hearthrough). "Smartsound" is a feature that "Adapts the sound to your surroundings". At the time of writing though, it is quite basic in that it listens to your surroundings, then invokes one of your 4 profiles. Eg In Private if it's quiet, Commute if noise such as a train. Hopefully in future it will adapt in a more detailed manner, rather than just profile switching. There is a button on the left to cycle through NC (On, Off, Hearthrough). What I would like to see though is an option to customise this. My preferred option would be (On / Hearthrough), as you could just press once to hear and talk to someone, and once to return. I feel the features in these headphones are very innovative, and also think that Jabra will improve them through updates in the future. I'll revisit my review when they do! <Additional edit 7th May 2019> I've now been able to also use these for voice calls, and have to say they are excellent. This is the first time I've been able to use over ear headphones for a voicecall without finding it to be an irritating experience - Either because I can't hear my own voice or because sound is not fed back through the headphones in a satisfactory manner. The "Hearthrough" feature though is perfect, and you do not feel like you're having a phone conversation with over ear headphones on. The called party also reported that my voice was extremely clear. Nice work Jabra! <Additional edit 12th June 2019> Used them on a longhaul flight for the first time last week. They outperformed my Bose QC20i headset, so very impressed. Comfortable to wear during the whole flight whilst watching movies, and didn't need to turn the sound up particularly high. The "Hearthrough" feature was excellent for talking to Cabin Crew without taking the headphones off.

*This is an update from my initial review posted below* I managed to get another pair of these headphones at a highly discounted price through my mobile phone network provider, same colour and specifications, however I now have the latest firmware version installed and it has addressed all of the issues that I had originally mentioned in my review. Sound volume is now excellent as is the ambient mode and they have been hugely improved with one firmware update, so in the future there will be more updates and these will just get better and better. I communicated directly with Jabra support via email and explained my original issue that I was experiencing and I should have waited for the reply before returning the headphones as Jabra support was superb, quickly updating me with emails and keeping me informed of the upcoming firmware release. Jabra support has been superb and they clearly care about their customers, they have a very friendly and professional approach with regards to assisting you with advice and support. I had originally had a slight moan about the customer support side provided by Jabra and acknowledge that this was more down to me being impatient and not down to Jabra. So in summary, these get 5 stars and if I could give them 10 I would certainly do so. Excellent build quality accompanied by superior sound quality and backed up by impeccable customer service. _____________ Original review __________ Okay here's an honest review about these headphones. They are very nicely made, premium quality and look really nice, buttons to control ambient sound and other functions have a nice click rather than a touchpad, well it is kind of a touchpad with tactile buttons, so you won't accidentally hit the wrong one by mistake unlike some of the competition. Setup and is nice and simple, they are extremely comfortable, in fact, they are the most comfortable headphones I have ever used, so soft and great padding on the cups and the headband, they come with a USB type C charging port and supplied charging cable and charge very quickly indeed. They come in a really nice case and with a 3.5mm cable for connected use, so all in all a great package and for the build and quality these are competitively priced, actually, they are really exceptional value considering the functions that they offer, long battery life, bleeding edge noise cancellation, adaptive sound environment that configures itself when you move to a different area that may have extra noise, these are very advanced and clever headphones and there is nothing else that provides these amazing features. Unfortunately, I never got a chance to test out the call quality and performance but I am guessing it is probably top notch. Why only four stars? well these have an issue and that is the firmware is buggy and unstable causing the headphones to switch to the different environment when you are just sitting in the same place and have not even moved, there was no additional increase in background noise to trigger this, they just randomly decide to change and with each change there is a spoken notification telling you what mode it has switched over to. You can automatically change environment settings with a simple push of a button and cycle the modes that you desire, but to have them switching constantly whilst you are trying to listen to music or watch a movie is a real pain. Sound quality overall was very impressive, clear and precise soundstage with decent highs and lows as well as midrange, everything is well balanced but the volume is very low and even with my phone or computer set to maximum volume as well as the headphones it was mediocre at best. There is hardly any bass and when the headphones are at maximum volume and there is a little bass it is accompanied by a clicking sound. I decide to contact Jabra support and get some assistance with these issues, it took them a whole week to respond and it was almost an automated email asking me to check for firmware updates for both the headphone and the Jabra application on my phone. I had already updated the firmware as I was prompted to do so when I first connected the headphones via the Jabra application and the application on my phone was up to date, so I emailed support again and received exactly the same email with the same instructions. Summary, these are high-quality, absolutely packed full of innovation and technology and have enormous potential to be the best wireless headphones available, but buggy firmware and poor customer support I do not find acceptable. I own both the Jabra Elite and Evolve 65t's and cannot fault them as they are excellent so I trust and believe in Jabra products, however, I am saddened by my experience with these headphones but I truly believe that future firmware updates will fix the issues I have mentioned. So I have returned these for a refund as I am not a beta tester for Jabra and that is how I felt, so many manufacturers are pushing products out way too quickly without proper testing, but I will most definitely grab another pair of these in maybe 3-4 months once things have been fixed as my initial impression is that these will be fantastic.

This review is based on my experience over the past 5 days. This is my third set of ANC Head/Earphones, I also have the Bose QuietComfort 20 (that I only use for travelling) and a Silvercrest from Lidl (that I use in a daily base at the office). The decision of buying the Jabra Elite 85h was motivated by the reviews on sound quality, battery life and phone call quality. Noise cancelling wasn't my priority since I prefer to travel with Earphones (I do all my flights with carry on luggage... a set of headphones is too much "real estate"). The 85h met 75% of my primary requirements, the problem is that I wasn't expecting all the Cons coming with it, but let's start by the positive points. PROS: 1 - Ear through is amazing (you can listen to your tracks and be aware of everything around you) 2 - Battery life is great 3 - Phone Calls quality very good 4 - Bluetooth range good CONS: 1 - Weight (or scarcity of Headband cushion, see picture) It's impossible to use this set for 2 or 3 h whithout severe disconfort (the extra batteries come with a cost/weight) 2 - Headband spring to tight. If you don't find the right position your ears will become numb in 30 min and he excessive pressure in the earpads will make your sweat (my hat size 55cm) 3 - Audio quality, average 4 - Active and Passive noise cancelling is a joke (although this wasn't my main criteria, it was surprising to realise that my ¬£27 Silvercrest (Lidl) earphones have far better active/passive noise cancelling than this ¬£280 headphones). Bottom line: The Jabra 85 h have several really good features that become irrelevant due to the lack of usability. No one will be able to use them in an 8-hour journey, either at the office or on a long-haul flight (which is the purpose of ANC headphones) ... therefore my 1 star. All of my tech purchases are made on Amazon, this will be the first time I return a product.

Ich habe seit der CES 2019 sehns√ºchtig auf diesen ANC-Kopfh√∂rer gewartet und ihn fr√ºh genug vorbestellt, damit ich ihn unmittelbar nach Marktstart in meinen H√§nden halten kann. Vor etwa einem halben Jahr habe ich mir den Audio Technica ATH xBT50-Kopfh√∂rer geg√∂nnt, wohl wissend, dass dieser Kopfh√∂rer noch keine Active Noise Canceling-Funktion hat. Trotzdem habe habe ich mich mittlerweile an die exzellenten Klangeigenschaften und die sehr lange Akkulaufzeit gew√∂hnt in der Hoffnung, den guten Klang irgendwann einmal mit einer guten ANC-Funktionalit√§t erg√§nzen zu k√∂nnen. Mit dem Kauf des Elite 85h dachte ich, dass ich eine eierlegende Wollmilchsau in Besitz nehmen kann - nicht umsonst tr√§gt der Kopfh√∂rer die Bezeichnung "Elite" in seinem Namen: - Lange Ausdauer - Exzellenter Klang - Exzellentes KI-gest√ºtztes Noise Canceling mit automatischer Anpassung an die Umgebung - Gleichzeitige Verbindung mit 2 Endger√§ten - Gute Bedienung - Exzellente Freisprechfunktion Um mich kurzzufassen: Der Kopfh√∂rer erf√ºllt in meinen Augen nicht das wichtigste Merkmal, n√§mlich einen guten Klang liefern zu k√∂nnen. Was hier an Klang geboten wird, w√ºrde ich bestenfalls als mittelm√§√üig durchgehen lassen. Das hat mich ehrlich gesagt etwas schockiert, da Jabra nach eigenem Bekunden einen Kopfh√∂rer auf die R√§der stellen wollte, der alle guten Eigenschaften der Konkurrenz in sich vereint. Dieses Ziel hat Jabra meinem Eindruck nach verfehlt. Im direkten Vergleich zu den von mir getesteten Referenzkopfh√∂rern von Audio Technica (ohne ANC) und Sony (1000 XM3, mit ANC) ist der Klang schmalbr√ºstig, wirkt deutlich eingeengt und vermisst r√§umliche Weite. Es ist so, als w√ºrde der Klang gefiltert - ob mit oder ohne aktive ANC-Funktion. Die B√§sse sind teilweise recht schwach, dann wiederum zu stark. Teilweise vibrieren die Lautsprecher auch, ein mir bislang unbekanntes Ph√§nomen. Zus√§tzlich ist die maximale Lautst√§rke ein gutes St√ºck leiser als bei den von mir getesteten Konkurrenten. Kurz nach dem Marktstart hat Jabra ein erstes Firmware-Release ver√∂ffentlicht, das am Klangeindruck gef√ºhlt nichts ver√§ndert hat. Die ANC-Funktionalit√§t hat mich ehrlich gesagt auch etwas entt√§uscht. Zwar werden Umgebungsger√§usche ged√§mpft, aber sie sind noch deutlich lauter wahrzunehmen als beim Sony 1000 XM3. Man hat beim Jabra nie das Gef√ºhl, wirklich von der Umwelt abgeschottet, sondern lediglich mit etwas Watte abgeschlossen zu sein, sei es im h√§uslichen Umfeld (wenn in der Familie der Fernseher l√§uft), im B√ºro, in der S- oder der U-Bahn. Besonders gespannt war ich auf die automatische Anpassung an sich √§ndernde Umgebungsger√§usche (SmartSound). Wenn man sich die werblichen Beschreibungen von Jabra so durchliest, k√∂nnte man, so wie ich, auf die Idee kommen, dass der Kopfh√∂rer mit Hilfe von max. 8 Mikrofonen st√§ndig autonom sein Umfeld analysiert und sich selbstst√§ndig darauf einstellt. Hier hat in meinen Augen Jabra nicht die ganze Wahrheit pr√§sentiert. Fakt ist, dass die SmartSound-Funktion nur dann aktiv ist, wenn die App auf dem Smartphone aktiv ist und das SmartSound-Feature dann enabled wird. Ist die App geschlossen, funktioniert auch SmartSound und somit die automatische Anpassung von ANC an die Umgebung nicht mehr. Zudem ben√∂tigt die Analyse der Umgebung jeweils etwa 1 Minute. Die Verarbeitung und die Bedienung sind ohne Fehl und Tadel. Die App ist gut zu bedienen (wenn auch zum Teil etwas un√ºbersichtlich), die Laufzeit √ºberzeugt. Letztlich hat mich der Kopfh√∂rer jedoch im wichtigsten Kapitel, n√§mlich im Klang, entt√§uscht. Das ist auch der Grund, warum ich ihn schweren Herzens trotz der langen Wartezeit und der vielen Vorschuss-Lorbeeren wieder zur√ºckgeschickt habe. H√§tte Jabra seine Hausaufgaben wirklich in allen Belangen vollumf√§nglich erledigt, w√§re der Elite 85h das wohl zur Zeit beste Gesamtangebot auf dem Markt. Dem ist leider (noch) nicht so. Schade.

Ten√≠a ganas de probar los auriculares JABRA Elite 85H, gama alta con cancelaci√≥n de ruido activa (ANC). Hab√≠a le√≠do noticias sobre su lanzamiento, y sobre el papel las caracter√≠sticas eran muy prometedoras. El packaging es bueno, pero inc√≥modo de abrir. Hay que deslizar una caja interior con el riesgo de romper la caja externa. El contenido consiste en caja redonda de transporte (con asa), los auriculares, cable de carga muy corto (USB - USB C), cable jack 3.5mm y adaptador de dos jacks 3.5mm a una salida. (lo ver√©is mejor en la foto). La calidad de los auriculares es muy buena. Se ven muy bien construidos, si bien los materiales est√°n condicionados por su resistencia IP5 al agua y al polvo. No pueden ser de piel natural, y han escogido una piel sint√©tica con buena apariencia y gran comodidad. Disponen de botones f√≠sicos en el auricular derecho (subir y bajar volumen, pasar canci√≥n, pausa, play...), Bot√≥n debajo del auricular derecho para invocar al asistente virtual (Alexa, Siri o Google Assistant...), bot√≥n debajo del auricular izquierdo para cambiar entre los diferentes modos de sonido. A nivel de conexiones tiene jack 3.5mm est√°ndar y bluetooth 5.0 (√∫ltima generaci√≥n). Para cargarlo tiene una toma USB-C que tardar√° sobre 2,5 - 3 horas en cargar completamente, lo cual nos otorgar√° una impresionante autonom√≠a de 32 a 36 horas. Una funci√≥n muy √∫til es la carga r√°pida en 15 minutos, que te otorga 5 horas de escucha (suficiente para casi cualquier viaje). No tienen bot√≥n de encendido, se conectan al girar los auriculares al modo de escucha, y se desconectan al doblarlos para guardar. En la aplicaci√≥n JABRA SOUND+ puedes configurar el tiempo de apagado autom√°tico. Y pasemos a lo m√°s importante, la calidad de sonido. Tengo unas canciones determinadas que utilizo para todas mis pruebas de sonido (Diamonds de Rihanna, Set Fire to the Rain de Adele, Sunrise de Norah Jones, The look of love de Diana Krall, 24K Magic de Bruno Mars, Billie Jean de Michael Jackson, P√°jaros de Barro de Manolo Garc√≠a, Hotel California de Eagles live on MTV, Highway to Hell de ACDC, When you were young de The Killers...) Todas ellas destacan por la gran calidad de grabaci√≥n y sirven para probar aspectos determinados: Calidad vocal, separaci√≥n de instrumentos, bajos, medios, agudos, comportamiento en diferentes estilos: pop, rock, soul, jazz, heavy,... Y el veredicto: pues realmente bueno, suenan muy muy bien. Su punto fuerte son los medios bien detallados y los agudos, nada estridentes. En bajos son correctos, muy controlados. A los que les gusten los auriculares tipo boom boom, deber√°n buscar otros. La separaci√≥n de instrumentos est√° muy lograda, y el hecho de que los graves no cansen, hacen que puedas estar mucho rato escuchando sin fatiga. He comparado la escucha por bluetooth y la escucha por Jack 3.5mm. Sin ser excesiva, hay una peque√±a diferencia a favor del cable (suenan un poco m√°s vivos). Tambi√©n me han sorprendido mucho escuchando diversas pel√≠culas con buenos efectos. Una delicia. La inmersi√≥n es total, los di√°logos muy claros, los efectos muy espectaculares y detallados. Un lujo poder hacer viajes viendo pel√≠culas con estos auriculares. El punto m√°s negativo en cuanto a la escucha es que no soporta ninguno de los codecs de audio en alta resoluci√≥n. Una verdadera l√°stima para unos auriculares de gama alta y reci√©n salidos al mercado. La cancelaci√≥n de ruido activa no me ha apasionado, a√≠slan pero no mucho m√°s que los propios auriculares. En mi opini√≥n falta pulirla un poco. Lo mismo pasa con el modo de escucha a trav√©s de los micr√≥fonos, suena artifical, no me acaba de convencer. Al final opt√© por dejarlo todo desconectado. La aplicaci√≥n JABRA SOUND+ es √∫til para configurar diferentes opciones, los diferentes modos de escucha, para saber la bater√≠a exacta que queda, para ecualizar el sonido, para actualizar el firmware (el momento de la revisi√≥n el √∫ltimo es el 1.2.2 A modo de resumen voy a indicar los puntos fuertes y los d√©biles: PUNTOS FUERTES: * Autonom√≠a impresionante * Calidad de sonido detallada * Bluetooth 5.0 (con muy largo alcance) * Protecci√≥n contra agua y polvo (con garant√≠a incluida) * Funda transporte r√≠gida y de calidad. * De los mejores micr√≥fonos del mercado para realizar llamadas. Te escuchan perfecto. PUNTOS D√âBILES: * No soporta los codecs de Audio en Alta resoluci√≥n. (Desde septiembre 2019 soporta AAC por actualizaci√≥n SW) * En mi caso son inc√≥modos. No me llegan bien los auriculares a las orejas y me presiona la diadema en la parte alta de la cabeza (quiz√°s es problema de mi cabeza-pepino) * Los graves no son todo lo contundentes que algunos usuarios pueden demandar. * Falta pulir la app JABRA SOUND+ * Falta pulir los modos ANC y HEARTHROUGH En resumen, LOS RECOMENDAR√çA sin dudarlo a los que busquen unos auriculares de calidad, con excelente bater√≠a, que realicen llamadas habitualmente y que quieran protecci√≥n contra agua y polvo. NO LOS RECOMENDAR√çA a los que busquen auriculares para reproducir High resolution audio, o con muchos bajos (boom boom), o tengan la cabeza alargada (pueden tener el mismo problema que yo, que te presione la diadema en la parte superior de la cabeza puesto que la extensi√≥n de cada auricular no es muy larga). Son unos auriculares 5 estrellas si bien le resto una por no ser compatibles con los codecs de audio en alta resoluci√≥n, porque a m√≠ no me son c√≥modos, y por los defectillos de firmware que esperemos solucionen los problemas de la App, del ANC.... VALORACI√ìN: COMPRA RECOMENDABLE ACTUALIZACI√ìN: Desde septiembre de 2019 se ha a√±adido compatibilidad con los codecs AAC mediante actualizaci√≥n de Software.

Meet the Jabra Elite 85h. ‚Å£ Where sound and comfort meet premium standards. I've been using these for more than two weeks now, and it is probably the best purchase I ever made for headphones. I used these for public transport travel to the university on a bus journey, visiting the city or studying for tests. I can tell you Jabra's noise cancellation headphones definition have been perfected. Since Jabra announced the Elite 85h in the CES 2019 earlier this year, I have been patently waiting for these. Jabra knew what the competition was with premium ANC headphones from other premium contenders like Sony and Bose. With their own new technology, Jabra managed to surprise the market. ‚Å£ ‚Å£ The headphones offer excellent acoustical clarity, particularly following the latest firmware update to adjust the volume and ANC performances. This is a serious pair of headphones with active noise cancellation, customized equalizer and sound amplification in ambient environments.‚Å£ Advanced call technology uses 6 of the 8 microphones on the headphones to increase the call quality considerably, preventing more wind noise and background distractions. This makes the sound crystal clear, so that even under the most demanding conditions you can make and receive calls with full trust.‚Å£ Together with audEERING, Jabra developed SmartSound to deliver better experiences while creating audio solutions which are used increasingly throughout the day. Thanks to machine intelligence and deep learning techniques that can detect more than 6000 unique sound characteristics, audEERING audio software recognizes acoustic scenes. ‚Å£ I suggest that you look at what Jabra Elite 85h can deliver for serious ANC headphones, for those who want to achieve premium sound, aesthetic design, great comfort, and advanced technology.

I've been waiting for these so as soon as they became available I clicked the button! Initial impressions are excellent.
