Tested it at home and they managed to completely eradicate the spin cycle of my washing machine üòÅ. Chose these over the QC35ii mainly because they offer Type-C connectivity and over the 1000XM3 because they support simultaneous device connection (phone+laptop). I'll update te review as I get more experience with them.

Si os soy sincero, mi pena es no haber probado esta marca antes. La conoc√≠a porque pertenece al grupo GN y mi hermana, que trabaja en una cl√≠nica auditiva, me hab√≠a comentado que los mejores aud√≠fonos que vende, suelen ser los ReSound, y al parecer, Jabra, que es del mismo grupo, usa la nano tecnolog√≠a de aud√≠fonos aplicada a los auriculares. No en vano, son 150 a√±os de experiencia. El caso, es que creo, que a d√≠a de hoy, (y habiendo probado varias marcas premium), ser√°n, posiblemente y a mi juicio, los auriculares con mejor cancelaci√≥n de ruido activa, mejores funciones, un sonido muy conseguido y unos micr√≥fonos inigualables. Solo les he encontrado un punto flaco, que os comento m√°s adelante. Pero vamos por partes. No soy de centrarme mucho en especificaciones ni usabilidad, pero voy a dividir esto en 2 partes. Los auriculares en s√≠, y el tipo de sonido que ofrecen, porque lo creo necesario. Referente a los auriculares en s√≠, al tacto se le aprecian los materiales premium con los que han sido fabricados, tanto de polipiel como el pl√°stico, consiguiendo, quedar por debajo de los 300gr. Dadas las prestaciones que ofrecen y su autonom√≠a, ya me parece a mi, un peso muy ajustado. Si tengo que destacar algo en este aspecto, es la diadema, que tiene una robustez palpable tanto en la elasticidad y torsi√≥n, pues pr√°cticamente la puedes estirar hasta el infinito, retorcer, o hacerle lo que quieras, que volver√° a su estado original. A mi modo de ver, esto garantiza comodidad por su alta flexibilidad, excelente adaptabilidad, y alto grado de resistencia ante impactos, pues entiendo que si caen al suelo, la diadema no partir√°, sino que flexionar√° (obviamente, no los he tirado al suelo, pero auriculares con diademas r√≠gidas, me han dado alguna rotura en estos a√±os justamente por eso). Tanto la diadema como los propios auriculares vienen acompa√±ados de un acolchado muy, pero que muy c√≥modo, que hace que no se claven ninguna de las partes en nuestra cabeza haci√©ndolos muy confortables tanto para escuchar m√∫sica durante horas como para llevarlos transportados en el cuello. (Y luego hablo de esta parte, que me parece espectacular). En tema de conexiones y dem√°s, en la parte derecha, tenemos Jack com√∫n para escuchar la m√∫sica sin utilizar el bluetooth, la conexi√≥n usb tipo C para la carga de la bater√≠a, un led que cambiar√° de color indicando niveles de carga y estado de la conexi√≥n con otros dispositivos y el bot√≥n para activar el asistente al que lo tengamos asignado bien sea Siri, Google Assistant e incluso Alexa (asistente de Amazon). En este mismo auricular pero en la parte lateral vamos a tener dos peque√±os puntos en relieve con los que vamos a poder controlar el volumen tanto de la m√∫sica como de las llamadas (pulsaci√≥n corta) y avanzar o retroceder una canci√≥n de nuestra lista (pulsaci√≥n larga). Tambi√©n encontramos una peque√±a hendidura central que activar√° o cancelar√° la localizaci√≥n por bluetooth para poder sincronizarlo con hasta dos dispositivos al mismo tiempo. El optar por botones ‚Äúf√≠sicos‚Äù y no t√°ctiles, a mi juicio, es asegurar un funcionamiento √≥ptimo. Uso a menudo unos con controles t√°ctiles, y si bien en optimas condiciones, son muy c√≥modos, en otras, donde no tenemos las manos totalmente limpias, o hay algo de sudor en los dedos, ya no son efectivos. En el auricular izquierdo √∫nicamente tendremos un bot√≥n y es el destinado a controlar la cancelaci√≥n de ruido. El fabricante nos promete que con una carga de 2 horas y media vamos a poder tener hasta 41 horas de autonom√≠a con la cancelaci√≥n desactivada y hasta 5 horas con una carga r√°pida de 15 minutos. Yo no lo he comprobado cronometr√°ndolo, creo que ser√≠a de enfermos poner un reloj para esto, pero con la bater√≠a al 100% y la cancelaci√≥n activada, calculo que he podido utilizarlos incluso m√°s de 30 horas y a√∫n ten√≠an bater√≠a, teniendo en cuenta que mi uso, son, unas 2 horas por la ma√±ana, 1 hora en la cocina, y otra hora aprox por la tarde, y me han durado como una semana. Todo esto, con vol√∫menes entre el 40-60% y alternando entre cancelaci√≥n y normal. Sencillamente, brutales. El bluetooth 5.0 que hace que la administraci√≥n de la bater√≠a sea mucho m√°s eficiente, pero donde m√°s se nota, es cuando los conecto al iPad, y me muevo por toda la casa con total soltura sin un m√≠sero microcorte. Incluso saliendo a la terraza, no he tenido cortes. Dicho esto, vamos al sonido: Primero decir que no son auriculares para audi√≥filos. Tampoco lo pretenden. He visitado su web, y se centran en im√°genes del d√≠a a d√≠a, de usuarios cualquiera, control√°ndolos con su smartphone. Ciertamente, tampoco tendr√≠a mucho sentido que unos auriculares que usan software para cancelaci√≥n de ruido sean para puristas del audio. Creo firmemente, como usuario de unos HD650 (entre otros), que si se busca un buen sonido de ‚Äúestudio‚Äù, no estamos ante el producto ideal. Por lo tanto, el que no soporte codecs sin compresi√≥n, no lo veo como un punto negativo, porque al final, meter Hi-Res en un auricular comercial, no tiene mucho sentido. A√∫n as√≠, lo dejo reflejado, quedando abierta la opci√≥n a actualizaci√≥n futura por parte de la marca. Pero como digo, esto es un auricular Urbano, para el d√≠a a d√≠a, para momentos, y para nada, creo que sea para sentarse en un sof√° y escuchar la 9th sinfon√≠a en pleno disfrute. Para eso, hay productos espec√≠ficos, que justamente, lo primero por lo que los vas a distinguir, es por llevar cable y siempre, jack 6.3, no el minijack. Pero en fin, quede dicho. El sonido es impecable y envolvente: tiene unos graves con muy buena presencia y reverberaci√≥n sin nada de distorsi√≥n apreciable hasta el 90% del volumen o m√°s, siempre que la pista, tenga calidad suficiente, sin un efecto rebote o encapsulado demasiado acusado, propio de los auriculares cerrados, y consiguen una buena espacialidad, acompa√±ados con un punch que hace disfrutar de esta frecuencia. Los agudos tienen mucho de brillantes sin ser chirriantes ni excesivos, haciendo que se llegue a las frecuencias m√°s altas del espectro con solvencia. En los medios tenemos unas tonalidades muy definidas y un abanico muy amplio, con much√≠sima definici√≥n, que junto con graves y agudos, hacen que fluya la m√∫sica con mucha naturalidad y un sonido de alt√≠sima calidad. Eso s√≠, a tener en cuenta, que la curva de ecualizaci√≥n de estos auriculares, tira hacia un sonido comercial, nada plano, pero bueno, esta es la tendencia actual. Dir√≠a que la curva, no es tan pronunciada como en otros modelos que he tenido/probado, que tienden a hacer una V, sino que m√°s bien es algo menos agresiva, >-<, pero igualmente, con realce para potenciar. Lo bueno de no abusar del sonido comercial, es que permite bastante margen por arriba y abajo a la hora de equalizar y no hay distorsi√≥n arm√≥nica en cantidad que no permita jugar con estos balances para adaptarlos a nuestro gusto. Se pueden elevar a√∫n m√°s los graves sin que ello termine en predominio absoluto, ya que los medios, siguen estando presentes, y no se diluyen como en otros auriculares que tienen una eq m√°s agresiva. Todo esto, apoyado desde la aplicaci√≥n Jabra Sound +, para ajustar, hacen que tengas una experiencia muy grata del producto. La cancelaci√≥n de ruido es muy buena tanto con la m√∫sica encendida como apagada gracias tanto a los 4 micr√≥fonos que utiliza para la realizaci√≥n como el acolchado de los auriculares que aislan casi a la perfecci√≥n los o√≠dos. Dir√≠a que filtra como un 85-90% del ruido ambiente Si es cierto que se nota un leve sonido blanco cuando activamos la ACN y tenemos la m√∫sica apagada pero no llega a un punto en el que sea molesto. Dir√≠a que incluso es hasta relajante, pero ojo, esto siempre bajo mi punto de vista. En lo referente a la usabilidad del micro en llamadas y audios, estos auriculares son literalmente, inhumanos. De momento, no he visto una calidad igual en ning√∫n otro auricular, ni siquiera los que tienen los micr√≥fonos cerca de la boca. No me explico, como es capaz de ofrecer tan buena recogida del audio teniendo los micr√≥fonos a la altura de las orejas. La funci√≥n manos libres, as√≠ como la ejecuci√≥n de √≥rdenes a trav√©s de Siri (en mi caso), es inmejorable, sobre todo teniendo en cuenta que Siri, es el peor asistente que hay respecto a comprensi√≥n de √≥rdenes de voz (en esto necesita mejorar muy mucho Apple), y justamente por eso, tiene tanto m√©rito lo que consiguen los Jabra. Sin duda, est√° tecnolog√≠a no solo es utilizada para escuchar m√∫sica si no tambi√©n para aislar de ruidos externos en conversaciones, y es, bajo mi punto de vista, DE LARGO, la mejor del mercado a d√≠a de hoy cuando escribo estas l√≠neas. Un punto muy favorable a tener en cuenta es la forma en la que los auriculares se ponen en standby para ahorrar energ√≠a, y es que simplemente tendremos que quitarlos de nuestras orejas y la m√∫sica se pausar√° autom√°ticamente. Muy bien trabajado este sistema, porque para evitar pausas innecesarias no es suficiente con quitar una auricular, si no que hay que quitar los dos. Su funcionamiento es impecable y act√∫a seg√∫n la posici√≥n de los auriculares, que no solo sirve para ese control de la m√∫sica, si no que gir√°ndolos 45¬∫ hacia atr√°s y dej√°ndolos reposando en los hombros, vamos a poder apagarlos y encenderlos de la misma manera, pero con el giro a la inversa y coloc√°ndolos en nuestros o√≠dos. En definitiva, de momento, y a d√≠a de hoy, creo que son de largo, los auriculares m√°s completos y con un mejor equilibrio entre prestaciones que he tenido ocasi√≥n de probar (y han sido muchos). En audio son excepcionalmente buenos, la autonom√≠a es brutal, y los micr√≥fonos para hablar, son, de largo, los mejores. Solo puedo decir, que la marca Jabra, me ha impresionado hasta tal punto, que ahora ser√° una de mis referentes en auriculares de tipo comercial. Para terminar, s√© que ha sido una opini√≥n larga, pero en la que he intentado ser √∫til, tanto si decides optar por estos, como por otro modelo, y que al menos, tengas la m√°xima informaci√≥n antes de comprar. Si tienes alguna duda, escr√≠bela debajo de este comentario. Si la leo, la responder√© encantado. Saludos.

Jabra Elite 85h Wow, this Jabra Elite 85h is amazing. It comes with a neat case. It‚Äôs not just a headset, it connects via Bluetooth which was very easy and as soon as you turn the earpieces, they automatically connect giving a signal to tell you it‚Äôs connected. Tells you how much battery life and if it needs charging. There is also an audio jack port which I connect to an old iPod which has all my CD‚Äôs downloaded. It connects to Amazon Alexa, Siri, Google Assistant and Baidu (although I haven‚Äôt heard of Baidu) and can also be used for phone calls. The sound quality is amazing. There are 8 speakers. There is also a feature for noise cancelling. I have downloaded the Jabra app on my iPad also my Android phone and there is a full instruction manual which is very easy to understand. To turn volume up or down, you just press the right earpiece at the side side and the same for answering a phone call or voice recognition. On the left earpiece there is a menu for Active noise cancellation, Hear through and off. There is also Smartsound which adapts to your surroundings. When you want to turn off, just turn the earpieces flat. There are so many features I have not had chance to try everything out, but you couldn‚Äôt wish for more from a headset - such quality.

I‚Äôve been using these for 4 days now, well - being forced to share them with two other family members, but only charged them once. The sound quality is second to none even against the likes of Bose, and when you couple it up with the app, the user preferences and noise cancelling options are intuitive and work very well! The case was an added bonus and gives you a sturdy but compact way of carrying or storing these well, along with the necessary charging cable and optional aux/headphone jack. The firmware update process was very quick and easy too, with little to no messing about from the user perspective which saved me a headache! They look and feel like a very premium product at a very fair price point for what you get! Everything is where it should be, very effective, ergonomic and efficient yet tactile and good looking. The packaging is nice too, makes for an all round nice experience! I also appreciate the little touches like the little tag inside the case to remind you how best to fold these for storage, etc. Very well thought out all round, good job!!

Comfort: I have a big head. My wife has a little head. The headphones sit comfortably with both of us. On a recent flight on my ‚Äúmagno capite‚Äù I found the headphones to be comfortable. They are not quite as soft as the Bose Quiet Comfort, but after a few minutes I forgot that I was wearing them. Sound Quality: The Jabra app makes a big difference to the sound as you can tweak it to your environment. The noise cancellation is very good, masking aeroplane engine noise, train noise and the office hum. I especially like the pass-thru where the mic is used to amplify the your environment. Great for ear-wigging to conversations when people think you are listening to music. I like rich mid-tones and clear top end as I listen to guitar, classical and a lot of spoken voice. The Jabra certainly delivers here and you can especially hear the difference on re-mastered songs. I don‚Äôt have many banging bass tunes, so I can‚Äôt really compare Build Quality: The headphones are chunky and well made. The case is substantial, in fact it is a bit of squeeze to get it into my laptop bag. Ease of Use: The controls are positioned well. Once paired I had no problem with reconnecting. Overall, I‚Äôm very happy with these headphones.

I needed a pair of headphones or earphones for commuting that would have clear sound quality, noise cancelling (NC) and phone call quality. I compared these, Sony 1000XM3, Bose 700 and some cheaper headphones, Jabra 75H earphones, Amazon echos, Airpods pro etc. These were among the best, but not the very best in all areas. I'd be very happy to end up with these headphones - they were clear, with a nice warm sound, made clear calls, were pretty effective with noise cancelling and had good software. However, the Bose 700 had more effective NC (not a million miles better, but still discernible), and my wife consistently preferred receiving calls from me wearing the Boses (apparently, I sounded more like me and there was far less background noise). In addition, they are quite bulky (but well built). You won't be disappointed with them - and I was actually quite fond of them. But I couldn't ignore the slightly better performance of the Bose. (BTW, in the end I opted for the Airpods Pro because of a similar level of noise cancelling to the Bose but without the bulk.)

I like pretty much everything, but it's the little things that have impressed me the most. How taking them off pauses what you are listening to, using my voice assistant without having to take my phone out of my pocket, how it analyses my environment and then switches to the setting I've previously organised..... Uploaded the latest Firmware when I got these and the app is great, lots of tweaks and personalisation available Huge battery capacity, quoted at 35 hours with ANC on (never managed to get there yet). A must if you are on a long haul flight for both the in flight entertainment, but also if you want to block the rest of the cabin out for a while.

Review written after 4 weeks of use as main headphones. The product is rather light and sits comfortably on head and around ears. I wear it with glasses and it's still comfortable. The material feels like a mid-range plastic, not the highest quality. Fabric is nice but keep in mind that it may get wet and also harder to clean compared to other materials. I bought these headphones mainly for work- including having online meetings and noise cancelling. AC works very nicely, providing a soft yet deep noise cancellation which has been quite effective, but not perfect on its own (without playing any music etc.). Sound quality is very nice, but I didn't buy it for music so can't quite tell. As for the main issues- on the second day of use the device stopped responding. I contacted the customer service- which answered right away and were extremely helpful- and was advised to updated the firmware. In the process of doing that I was told by the customer service rep that these headphones are NOT MEANT TO BE COMPATIBLE WITH LAPTOPS, but only with smartphones. This was quite a shock for me to discover since I purchased the product mainly for pairing with my laptop. It is true- the headphones constantly fail when paired with my laptop over bluetooth, meaning I must connect them by the headphone cable whenever I need to use them with the computer. This is a major drawback in my opinion. However when I do connect them with the wire the sound and all other functions work well, and I haven't received complaints about the sounds quality during meetings. A second issue is the turning on/off mechanism- in order to turn the device on, the parts that goes on the ear have to be turned inwards (as if it's places on the head) and to turn it off they have to be turned outwards. This is a terrible system in my opinion which is meant to fail. It takes time to get used to turning the ear-parts out whenever I take the headphones off, and so the battery gets drained. Also, the device sometimes simply doesn't turn on when I wear it, or goes on, off then on again. This is very uncomfortable. The last thing is that the app that connects the device to the phone occasionally "forgets" the headphones at random. Bottom line- I really wanted to love these headphones, but ended up almost sending them back. Unfortunately I really need them on a daily basis so decided against that. I truly hope that Jabra will make some improvement in the next version of the item.

Un tr√®s beau mod√®le √©l√©gant et simple. Je vais commenc√© par le confort, car moi j'ai des oreilles d√©coll√© et assez grande, du coup certain casque me font mal si je l'ai porte plus de 30minutes. This wireless headphone is one of Mixcder's entry level ones. There's more plastic than their other models that I've owned. And the packaging is tidy but simple. The headphones are foldable but they were quite stiff from new. So maybe folding it too often. In general this feels more like a headphone to use at your desk rather than one that you should be taking around with you everywhere you go. In terms of sound it decent enough for the price. It's probably better for listening to things like podcasts than music. Things sound a bit muffled but after a while you don't really notice it. The headphone does have a decent sound stage. Another reason why this headphone is one for the desk rather than your commute is that there's little noise isolation. Which is a bit odd because the foam is comfortable. Overall, I would have to say although this is on par with what you would expect at this price range I would personally pay a bit more and move up the range a bit. Something around ¬£50 is a much better buy in my opinion.

I Purchased these an an inexpensive alternative to bulky high end noise canceling headphones, mainly for gym workouts and occasional use. I must say they are extremely lightweight which makes them the perfect choice for the gym! They are much less bulky and look pretty good when your wearing them, very comfortable and my ears don't overheat like they do with other over ear earphones. Bluetooth range is great I would say 10m is accurate I can certainly get around the office without the sound breaking up. As they don't have active noise cancellation this helps hugely prolong the battery life, the battery life I'd say is over 8 hours (can vary) Sound quality meets and exceeds my expectations, great frequency response, great bass clarity out of the box with no need for EQ setting changes on your phone. Overall very satisfied with my purchase and very happy with the value for money.

These Headphones are great performing over ear Bluetooth headphones which are excellent value for money. I have been using these while gardening where a physical cable to my device would get in my way. Listening to Audio Books and Music from my Android phone the quality via Bluetooth is excellent. Charging the headphones is straightforward with the enclosed cable and the battery life is very good. The range available through the Bluetooth is excellent with at least 5 metres distance to my device. I am able to leave my phone on charge while listening to the headphones anywhere in my garden. This is the best range I have ever had with Bluetooth. The headphones have a built in microphone so I can still make and receive calls while away from my phone. The headphones come with a cable so can be used with non Bluetooth devices (can be used on an aircraft by plugging the provided cable into the seat's socket and the headphones) The headphones are not noise cancelling but as they are over ear background noise is blocked. The headphones are sturdy with an adjustable head strap. These do not fold into a smaller profile so I believe are less likely to break. There are volume and on/off Bluetooth controls on the headphones. If I were to make an improvement in the package I would include a travelling pouch or case. To summarise, these are great value for money for Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones.

I've bought a couple of pairs of headphones at different price points the last few months, this one was for my wife, we just wanted a cheap pair of headphones for using while gardening - something durable but not expensive enough to worry if they were damaged. I'm blown away by the quality. Hands down for this price point, the quality and the features are amazing. My wife isn't fussy about sound quality, so her estimation is that they 'sound as good as the last pair', but I had a test of them and they sound better than a pair I've had for twice the price recently. Excellent value for the money.

Just started using it, and mystified by the suspiciously loud praise. Sound is quite low, and not the greatest. Didn't connect to my iPad Air 2, or my iPad - still to try it out on my Huawei I'd bought last. Maybe it'll grow on me but so far 3 stars I'm being generous. It may well be going back Addendum: Sending them back. When I started to have problems connecting to the bluetooth that was the last straw. I wasn't happy with the low volume to start with

I was looking for some cheap wireless headphones for my son since he has killed his last two pairs by breaking the cables. These fit the bill, nice and cheap. Good battery life and seem reasonably robust. The sound quality is not amazing if you are used to using more expensive items but for the price it is good.

These arrived and the first time I played music out of them I could only hear out of one ear. I could understand the audio quality not being great for the price but the fact they straight up don't even work was a great surprise. I mean especially from the well know brand Mixder! I wasn't expecting Rolls Royce quality but if they had worked it would have been nice.

These headphones really surprised me for the low cost. Sound quality is not bad and they are very comfortable for long use. Using them at work is great. They have the added bonus of taking an sd card so when my phone is low, music can still be played. Lastly being able to control tracks on my phone using the headphone buttons is a neat addition. Would definetely recommend.

The earphones where working fine except for the fact that occasionally the sound would stop working in one of the ears (a week after purchase) but that didn‚Äôt bother me too much as it didn‚Äôt happen often. However recently the power and volume buttons stop, working but the headphone light indicating that it‚Äôs on still works. Definitely regret this purchase as I‚Äôve only had them for a short while.

First set of wireless headphone and after a lot of research, these exceeded expectation - especially at this price. Definetly a great product and battery life had surprised me. I put it to the test during an 11 hour flight, it done great on noise cancellation and sound quality. worth the money!!
Love these headphones, use them every day since i have brought them, battery life is amazing aswell
Very light so makes it co comfortable. and useful option with the sd card. Sound quality is okaish but value for the money
Great item but it‚Äôs very hard for someone to hear you when using the Bluetooth for a phone call
Had much more expensive headphones and these are good and excellent value for money.

Product was good in terms of sound and build quality for the price. However if the ear pads fall off they are almost impossible to get back onto the headphones and if successful they repeatedly fall off. I have therefore given up on using them and I am looking to find an alternative.

Bought this to replace a wired set of headphones. As someone who works shifts and has weird sleeping patterns I often find it hard to sleep. Listening to a podcast however sends me off within 20mins usually. But with my previous set I'd often wake up because the wire was caught around my neck. So it was somewhat of a revelation to try these last night and be able to comfortably wear these all night and actually have a full night. Sound quality was great. Could turn it up loud and the wife couldn't hear it. It even drowned out her snoring! Very pleased with the purchase.

I love this product. It is great for running. You never need to worry about headphones falling off again as it is basically a large head sweatband that incorporates a headset in it. It sits securely on your forehead and the fabric absorbs and mops up your sweat. I think it may be too hot for the summer months but for UK wintertime, this is perfect. The fabric components can be easily removed for complete washing.

Good quality head band with sealed in ear pieces. Nice and comfy, the ear pieces can move a distance forward or back to make the size perfect. Charges well and doesn't got flat easily. Soft well stitched material. Well made. Sound quality OK, to be expected for style.

Good idea for a product. I planned on using these to sleep as I listen to music, audio or anything else that I feel like before bed, and for the gym too. Overall, this product lasted about a month before it stopped charging, and about a week prior to that, I noticed that the headphones made any video you watched have noticeable delay between video and audio of a couple seconds which isn't noticed as much when sleeping obviously, but is annoying when you're trying to use them casually when awake. They we're unusable and then they broke a week later, like a day after my return period closed which is convenient. And with no accessible email to be found to contact the seller, I'm left with broken earphones and a bad taste in my mouth from the experience. I would recommend the product idea, but it's probably worth spending a little more for higher quality and hopefully customer service which you can actually reach. 3/10

I originally had an issue with the headphones but the seller was quick to help. If you are a runner or simply someone who would prefer not to wear uncomfortable headphones then this is what you need. They are easy to charge and lasted me all week. the controls are simple enough for you to be able to press the buttons while wearing it.

I struggle at times to fall asleep and I need to listen to music. The problem with earbuds and such is that they become uncomfortable after a while when you lie on your ears. I am really pleased with the Navy headphone band. The head band fit snugly and comfortably. I can barely feel them when I lie down. I'll update if I have any issues. Regarding the sound, it's clear and does not leak at low volumes. I don't want to disturb my wife. The connection was easy and I liked the fact that the controls were physical switches. It helps a lot when you look for them in the dark üòÅ‚úîÔ∏è I have a big head and was worried that the band might not stretch. It does the job as intended! The band does not feel as though it's squashing your head. It's very comfortable. The volume goes very low and quite high. I'm not sure I have the looks to wear them in public though ü§£ü§£ü§£. This is yet another pair of headphones on my shelf but these have a unique purpose. Would I recommend them? Without hesitation!

I suffer from insomnia and have tried that many things to help me sleep, even tablets but they have left me feeling groggy the following day, but upto now this little number has done the trick. I have either been listening to calming music or raindrops on YouTube. I have been getting at least 5 hours sleep per night and to anybody who suffers from Insomnia will know that is amazing. As for working out, I can't really go to the gym but have been using it whilst walking the dog to take my mind of the cold and upto the dog is a happy chappy too üòÇü§£

Total rubbish, they went back! I read the reviews on these, and thought they would be reasonably good for not too much money. I sort of wanted to prove the concept before I bought some good ones. However there are a number of problems with them and they are not suitable for the purpose intended. First the headband is very tight for anyone who has even a slightly large head. I‚Äôm not talking hear about ego! I normally have to put headphones on one of the larger settings, but normally all headphones can accommodate me fine. However the headband on these is very small! It feels like your head is in some sort of skull crusher! Bring on the mediaeval torturers! Anyway that‚Äôs not the worst of it. Unfortunately the sound leakage from the headphones is appalling! Even with my phone at low volume, my wife was able to hear every word of a podcast I was listening to. Not ideal if someone is going to be sleeping next to you. If he‚Äôs asleep headphones, no one will be doing much sleeping if you wear them. Don‚Äôt bother! I can‚Äôt attest to the battery life because they were back in the box before that became an issue.

I was skeptical about buying this product but I am pleased to say it is great for sports and during other activities in many ways. It looks like a headband, which is actually great for holding your forehead clear, but it is also a headset and you can listen to music, ted talks or whatever you fancy listening in peace, also accept and reject calls. I also use it when I am cleaning or cooking and I don't want to disturb anyone with my music or radio. It wireless via Bluetooth pairing with your phone, it's great because you don't need to download any app, just Bluetooth. The battery lasts up to 10 hours , so I normally charge every other third day. The earbuds are adjustable so no worries about your head size.

The headset itself is comfortable and the sound is decent (not great) - but if you‚Äôre expecting any level of noise blocking then you‚Äôll be really disappointed. Because the speaker units sit on your ears rather than enclosing them there‚Äôs zero seal, so everything leaks in. I was hoping that along with some white noise playing they‚Äôd help me drown out my snoring partner. If you‚Äôre using it in a silent room then I‚Äôd say you‚Äôll happy enough. It‚Äôs very comfortable no matter what way you lie, so that‚Äôs a very good positive. I won‚Äôt send it back even though it‚Äôs not really good enough for what I want but for lying on the sofa and listening to some podcasts it‚Äôll be fine. Battery seems very good and the BT connection is strong, with no problems.

I am very impressed with the quality of the item! I have wanted to buy one for a long time now and do not regret it one bit! Me and my partner tested the battery life for 14hours straight and we only stopped because we couldn't do it any longer so battery life is definitely as advertised and beyond. The range for the bluetooth is also more than 10m which is obviously better. Sound its perfect and we did try calling which was amazing quality since you dont even see the mic. Comfortable to sleep with and definitely not to tight as some of the reviews state! Will recommend it to all my friends and family, definitely will buy another one for my partner as we are both thrilled with the quality.

Going to sleep has been a problem for me for a long time. I've finally figured out a bit of background music can help me disconnect from thoughts. The problem is music has the opposite for my wife, so I need music just for me. Ear phones worked but would fall out during the night or even worse I would sleep on them and in the morning I would get pressure in my ear and it felt swollen all day. I'm happy to say this was the ultimate solution. I listen to the music myself, doesn't fall out and no ear pressure in the morning. Best of all no getting tangled in wires! This makes me sleep right through, then I leave it charging through the day. I get great sleep now.

Initially I didn't have high hopes for this item and just bought it to test it during my running sessions because the ones that I had before continuously were slipping off my ears. Quite impressed after testing it couple times already. I have long hair so now 2 problems are solved with this brilliant headband. The sound is very nice and clear and I can enjoy my music when running with this value for money device. No negatives so far, so I can only recommend this for any sports guy who needs a headband and loves listening to music. Myself I don't enjoy so much listening to music while sleeping... so I cannot comment on that.

Sehr einfach zu benutzen und verbinden. Erst habe ich die Kopfh√∂rer mal ins Ohr gemacht ‚Äì Besonders gut, sie d√§mpfen Au√üenger√§usche sehr gut, und man h√∂rt so den Klang besser. Der Sitzt ist sehr bequem. Der Klang ist satt und gut. Durch das ber√ºhren Links/Rechts kann man die Lautst√§rke regulieren, das Lied Stoppen oder auch Anrufe entgegen nehmen. Die Kopfh√∂rer halten sehr gut und bieten guten Tragekomfort. Die Batterie der Station selbst ist langanhaltend und wird von mir h√∂chstens zweimal die Woche geladen. Besonders praktisch war die Kleine Box, passt in kleiner Handtasche. Diese werden in den kleinen Kasten gesetzt und halten dank Magnet perfekt. Sofort fangen Sie das laden an. I was quite surprised with the quality of sound this produced - it was much better than I expected. Even without me messing about with my EQ settings (as I always do when testing any set of earphones/headphones), the sound was great from the get go. Very easy to connect - just take the earbuds out of the case and they will instantly appear under Bluetooth devices on your phone. Connection was very strong, I was able to walk around most of the house and didn't have any issues whatsoever. It only started to falter when I was on the other side of the house with thick walls or when I left my phone upstairs and walked into the garden but that was to be expected - again, it did much better than I expected. The earbuds are quite comfortable and feel pretty secure. They haven't fallen out of my ears at all since using them, even when I've been jumping about quite a bit. These earbuds don't have the regular buttons that are on other earbuds - this uses a touch function instead which I find much easier to use. The instructions were very clear on how to control them. One tap is pause/play on either earbud, volume increase/decrease is one long press on the right/left earbuds respectively etc. In terms of battery life, these last for absolutely ages. I've used them for an entire day and they've still had plenty of battery to take me through most of the next. It recharges the earbuds pretty quickly too. The case has a capacity of 3500mAh, charges using a USB-C cable (provided) and also doubles up as a portable charger in those necessary situations where your phone desperately needs a charge! It also clearly displays the remaining battery % so it is easier to know when the case is fully charged. Overall, very pleased with these earphones and they've exceeded my expectations. If this was helpful, please tap that helpful button below - Cheers!

Ich muss zugeben, dass mich die Kopfh√∂rer positiv √ºberrascht haben - mit einer derartigen Produktqualit√§t hatte ich in derartiger Preisklasse nicht gerechnet. Ich besitze die Apple AirPods, wollte aber f√ºr den Sport ein alternatives Paar Kopfh√∂rer und dabei nicht zu viel Geld ausgeben. Die technischen Daten haben mir absolut zugesagt und entsprechend habe ich gar nicht lange √ºberlegt und einfach ‚Äûauf Gl√ºck zu‚Äú bestellt. Und meine Entscheidung bereue ich bisher kein bisschen! Ich habe nun meine ersten Trainingssessions mit den Kopfh√∂rern absolviert und kann eines sagen: Sie halten bombenfest in meinen Ohren. Wahnsinn! Das war f√ºr mich das gr√∂√üte Manko an meinen AirPods, dass diese bei bestimmten, ruckartigeren Bewegungen nicht mehr ordentlich im Ohr hielten. Bei diesen hier ist das gar kein Problem, auch wegen dem geringen Eigengewicht der Kopfh√∂rer. Ich muss sagen, dass meine AirPods Akku-technisch zwar etwas besser aufgestellt sind, die Kopfh√∂rer jedoch meine kompletten Sporteinheiten durchgehalten haben und mir das vollkommen reicht - denn daf√ºr habe ich sie schlie√ülich ja auch nur gekauft. ;-) Der Sitz der Kopfh√∂rer ist also optimal und auch nach einigen Stunden Tragezeit nerven oder dr√ºcken die Kopfh√∂rer nicht im Ohr, was ich sehr begr√º√üe. Optisch sind sie sicher Geschmackssache... Ich finde sie nicht sonderlich sch√∂n, aber auch nicht h√§sslich. Sie erf√ºllen ihren Zweck und das ist f√ºr mich im Grunde genommen das einzige, was z√§hlt. Wie gut sie im Endeffekt im Ohr aussehen, ist f√ºr mich eher Nebensache. Abgesehen davon fallen sie (getragen) nicht sonderlich in‚Äòs Auge, wirken klobig oder dergleichen. Die Verarbeitungsqualit√§t ist sehr gut, nur das Ladecase k√∂nnte etwas kleiner sein. Aber vielleicht bin ich da auch nur vom Ladecase meiner AirPods etwas zu sehr verw√∂hnt, das nun wirklich au√üerordentlich winzig ist. Die Bluetoothverbindung ist wirklich gut und bei mir bisher selten abgebrochen - und wenn, dann auch nur f√ºr wenige Sekunden. Dann war die Verbindung sofort wieder da und ich konnte ohne Probleme weiterh√∂ren. Der Sound ist, meinem Empfinden nach, gut bis sehr gut - gerade im Bereich der Bluetooth-Kopfh√∂rer. Der Bass ist teilweise etwas zu schwach f√ºr meinen Geschmack, ansonsten habe ich am Sound im Gesamten aber nichts auszusetzen. Insgesamt handelt es sich hier wirklich um ein rundum solides Produkt, das in seiner Preisklasse meine Erwartungen absolut √ºbertroffen hat. Daumen hoch daf√ºr und eine klare Weiterempfehlung! :-)

Da ich durch einen hohen Kopfh√∂rer Verschlei√ü habe, hab ich lange √ºberlegt auf die kabellose Variante umzusteigen. Im Endeffekt bin ich sehr froh, dass ich diesen Schritt gewagt habe. These headphones are really good value in my opinion. Compared to about ¬£150 for AirPods, these look really good value, and although they are more than the typical wired headphones I would buy, after a bit of time with them I think they are worth the extra. I was looking in to buying true wireless earphones for a while (as opposed to wireless headphones with a wire running in between the left and right earbuds) and stumbled on these particular examples. What really caught my eye was the fact that the charging case could be used as a powerbank for your phone. They have a 3500mAh capacity as far as I know, and an iPhone 6s, which is what I have, has a battery capacity of 1715mAh. This means that fully charged, the case could charge my iPhone twice over. I believe there are certain energy loss issues, but it is impressive nonetheless. I know that when the case was at about 85% charge, I plugged my phone and it charge my phone from 23% to full, which I really needed. This brings me on to another reason I think these are good. The display on the charging case. There is a display on the charging case which can show up to 3 digits I believe (I have never charged it up to 100% so I wouldn‚Äôt know) but it can definitely show 2 digits. This is very good as instead of the usual two out of three lights lit up you can know exactly how much charge is left in it. It makes it feel like a quality product and personally I just love knowing exactly how much charge is in the charging case at any one time. You turn this display on by pressing a button on the bottom of the charging case, so it is a very simple process. I have not mentioned the actual earbuds yet, but I think that is a testament to how many little perks they have! Anyway, I am very impressed. I don‚Äôt use them for very long periods of time, so I cannot say for certain, but they‚Äôre always at full charge when I take them out of the case and I never seem them go down by more than about 20% by the time I‚Äôve finished using them. This means I‚Äôve stopped even thinking about how much charge the earbuds have got as I‚Äôve never been in a situation where I can‚Äôt use them because they‚Äôve run out of charge. That is good as that was one of the things I was a tad skeptical about when I first started thinking of buying wireless earbuds. The sound quality is the most impressive thing about the little things. When you see how small they are, you would not think that they would be able to generate as much power as they do! The bass is very impressive, even more so after you have found the tips that fit your ear. They are definitely much better sounding than the EarPods that I used beforehand. Others things that I like about them are: They use USB-C to charge, which is a much more modern port than Micro USB. They come with a pair of earbud tips from the factory, and have small, medium and large spares. They have touch sensors rather than buttons to play, pause and do other functions, which in my opinion is a much more elegant solution. So yes, if you are looking for a pair of true wireless earbuds, I would say these are a very good option.

Mein Iphone 8 konnte ich ohne Probleme damit verbinden. Das Etui is praktisch,da es auch die Ladeschale zugleich ist. ich kann damit die Gopro und das Etui kann auch mit einer Powerbank geladen werden.

I am really delighted with these earphones, not only are they very comfortable to wear and a compact size but most importantly they produce a good clear sound quality without background noise. I love the fact that the earphones can be charged directly from the storage case, just plug the lead into a USB point until the digital display reaches 100. We are given extra ear buds so I was able to find one to suit; once placed in the ears they are comfortable but snug so I wouldn't expect them to fall out; so far only used them whilst walking. The charging case is a small, compact size, easy to carry around in pocket or bag. The earphones fit into the case with a magnetic hold so don't move around or fall out. Pairing with my phone was easy, look for the 'X10' device on phone; once paired the earphones automatically connect every time I use them together. I must admit I was a little hesitant about purchasing Bluetooth earphones, wondering if I could get the same sound quality as a wired set; anyway so glad I took the plunge as these wireless earphones are even better sound quality. I have also found that the storage case can be used in an emergency as a power source for my phone, unexpected bonus. Really pleased, exceeded my expectations.

Great product, sound quality is very good and the bass is not lacking. Bluetooth connection is very good. Great size, not too small or too big and they do not fall out when moving around. Very easy to set up and can be controlled with touch control, which works very well. Overall very pleased and would definitely recommend.

The best cheap wireless earbuds that I have tested so far. They‚Äôre more comfortable than most truly wireless headphones. Thanks to their low-profile design that fits securely without putting too much pressure on ears. They come with a great hard charging case that easily fits in even the smallest pockets, and they feel well-built overall. they feel sturdy and able to survive a few accidental drops without any issues. These earbuds sound fairly well-balanced but somewhat bass-heavy. Although these earbuds don't have active noise cancelling, they're still able to provide great noise isolation, particularly in the mid-range, great for blocking out ambient chatter. As for Bluetooth performance, connection consistency is significantly good. It has digital display to track the charge that is left over in the earbuds which is a main highlight. If you need a well-rounded pair of headphones with tons of features while staying within budget, these are worth considering.

My son has a pair like this and the only headphones I have are a big set of cans which look a bit weird going out for my walk at lunchtime so thought I'd get some. These looked the same, but were cheaper and I'm glad I got them. Very impressive. In fact the most impressive part is the bluetooth range. I can be two rooms away and still get an uninterrupted signal. Sound quality is ok. The bass is a little lacking, but what do you expect from small earphones like this. However that said, again for the price I was very pleasantly surprised. There was no mid range bleed that you get on some cheap earphones I've had in the past. So far I've not had to charge the case and the earphones automatically charge when you put them back. Probably listened to a good 10 hours of music since I've had them. The only one thing I think the manufacturer could improve on them is the lid isn't quite as transparent as my sons set. I struggle to see the LED numbers through the lid where as the set my son has you can see them quite clearly. This means its hard to know if the earphones are fully charged. However, this is a minor complaint considering these are nearly half the price of the pair he bought. All in - totally recommend. Very good.

So i bought these to listen to music whilst attempting to not be chunky anymore and start Running. The packing was simple but effective, no issues unboxing and come with a charge cable the case (battery pack) and the headphones. + a couple of different sized earbuds. Pairing them was super easy as most would come to expect from tech these days, and once paired they auto connect once you open the pack to place them in your ears. Sound Quality was not bad to be fair, not the best but this (i feel) is an adequate trade off for a great set of earbud headphones that work easily with no cables and don't break the bank. Running: whilst out running i did occasionally notice a slight movement when ruining down something like steps, but never did they feel like they would fall out and on a flat felt as secure as any others i have used. All in all nothing really to complain about - I haven't used the battery from the first charge yet and i'm on my 3rd run since i did so no complaints there. Sound is good, and they are pretty comfy. Hard not to recommend for the price really.

Was looking for earbuds to use it for my morning running exercises. These fit to the budget and looked promising. Music has clear sound, easy portable and quick charging system included, long battery life, works well with my android so I have positive impression so far. I was worried how it will hold on place in my ear and luckily they do stay in place and are comfortable to use. Was impressed that I can controll volume, calls etc just by using earbuds

I go through earbuds and earphones like nothing on earth. I loose earbuds all the time and earphones wires never last long. As i use them daily for Walking the dog so im out and about a lot. These ones i got a link from a friend who said they were good and as they were similar (and cheaper) than the last pair i bought i thought i would give them a try. Charge box has a waterproof cover for the usb slots. Micro for charging size A to use the unit as a powerbank. it also has a % display which so far is only at 98% after the sevral hours i have used them so far.

These beautifully designed stereo headphones come with a neatly designed storage block, doubling as a recharger for your earbuds. The headphones are unbelievably easy to pair via Bluetooth and give the user a simple plug-and-play experience. I paired mine with my iPhone 8; the stereo sound is wonderfully authentic as are the English language messages, whereas other wireless headphones I have used are sometimes hard to understand. A USB port is provided for ease of recharging. Finally, the value for money is excellent; the whole package is available from Amazon for under ¬£28. I can warmly recommend it.
Great set of ear buds with sound ok and good for the price

PROS: - Superb sound reproduction - Nearly Flat EQ and sense of space - Great build quality for the price - Very comfortable on the ears - Long battery life - Easy connectivity - Low latency so very good for video watching. CONS: - very slight resonance at around ~7kHz so "S" sounds seem ever so slightly louder. - no noise isolation, so people can hear what you're playing and... - you can hear all the noise around you, so it's hard to get 'lost in the music'. - unpadded headband - volume doesn't go very high - no wired (jack) option if power runs out.

On the strength of a 'Which ?' report on wireless headphones, June, 2017, I bought my wife these wireless headphones to use with her laptop which has very poor speakers. Since the laptop did not have a Bluetooth transmitter, I purchased a stereo transmitter/receiver, SK-BTI-029, from Golvery Direct. I had quite a bit of reading up to do, using the two manuals, before I got a very good result. However there are two issues that are important. The Sony help guide's troubleshooting section on hearing distorted sound says "Keep the headset away from a microwave oven, Wi-Fi, etc." As most laptops use Wi-Fi the whole time, this seemed very limiting! After some experimentation and more reading I found that because Bluetooth and Wi-Fi use the same frequency band, the selection of channels within the band to use for Bluetooth was random and sometimes a channel would be chosen which was next to the Wi-Fi channel and so there was distortion of the sound. Since there are 13 channels in the band to choose from, this distortion didn't happen very often, but it was an irritation when it did. Secondly, because of the nature of Bluetooth transmission, sound is transmitted in blocks, which adds a delay, which depends on the length of the block being sent. If music is being listened to on its own then there is no problem, but the delay (about half a second) becomes an irritation when the sound is part of a video, be it listening to a conversation or watching a musical instrument being played. The Sony headphones have such a lag. A recent option in Bluetooth transmission is 'apt-X' which reduces the delay to acceptable levels. The Golvery transmitter, mentioned above, will use this feature to achieve virtual audio-video synchronisation, but the receiver on the headphones has also to cooperate for the delay to be minimised and the Sony product does not do this. Thus they are not well used.

These headphones have grown on me. Initial impressions were not good. They feel pretty cheap, I have Bose and AKG wired headphones and they certainly feel flimsier, the headband is very thin and light and the adjustment doesn't have the same nicely defined action as the other two. They don't feel overly fragile, just not got a premium polish to them. Pairing with my Galaxy S8 could not have been easier, touch the phone to the Headphone with the "NFC" logo on it and that's the headphones paired. For a device without NFC just hold the power button for 7 seconds and then scan for them and pair that way. Paired with multiple devices without compatibility issues. Initial impressions sound wise, they're not the "deepest" sounding headphones, there's not very much low end. However, after a bit of acclimatisation they sound really good across pretty much any sort of audio you can give them, very neutral and pretty vanilla sounding, they're never spectacular but always reproduce your sound source faithfully. Their slightly flimsy feeling has a good side, they're really light and comfortable to wear for a longer period. The battery life is absolutely excellent, I'd estimate you'll easily get 20+ hours from them. In summing up, a really reliable set of headphones with stellar connectivity which never sound exceptional, but solid across all types of listening. Note - I purchased these as an Amazon Warehouse item. I've had a number of items in this way before and always been happy, not this time though I'm afraid. They were described as "Very Good" condition but they were quite noticeably scratched and missing their charging lead. They do still work perfectly.

Decent headphones. Bought these as wanted some Bluetooth headphones to use at work and didn't want to be tethered to a lead. For the price wasn't expecting the sound quality that they actually give out. Don't have to push them as I still need to hear if someone is shouting at me. A comfy fit, they don't feel uncomfortable even after a 4 hour listening session, battery life also seems to be good but haven't pushed it as just charge them at work when not using.

These are great for casual listening with my computer when I need to keep the noise down. They're comfortable to wear, feel durable and the battery lasts a long time. The sound quality is great, however by default out of the box they will be using the SBC codec which is lower quality. The manual tells you how to get the headphones to allow an AAC connection from your source device (iPhone/Windows/Mac OS etc) by starting them up with one of the buttons held down until the power light flashes a certain number of times. After you've done this they will start in this mode from now on unless you change it.

I Brought these for my mum because she is little deaf, and when watching TV at night she has the soundbar really loud, so I got these Bluetooth headphones to solve the problem. They connected really easy to my soundbar with NFC, the sound quality is good, stereo separation is good, and has decent bass, volume is good, but there seems a limit to how loud you can go, this is that EU voice limiter. The headphones are very compact and small, very comfortable on the ears, the range is also good allows me to walk freely around the downstairs, without loss off signal. I would recommend these for the sound quality and compact design.

Sony typically produce good headphones. They are easy to use, they sound good and have good volume. This product is simply none of these things. The build quality is poor and one of the ears has already become loose. They are made out of cheap plastic and not what you would expect at this price. The stitching around the earmuffs is also very poor and not straight. Then there is the sound quality. It is not terrible, but not good. It lacks bass sounds worse than a pair of Sony's I picked up for ¬£15 in Curries PC World (A wired pair). This is made worse by the fact that the volume on these is appalling. They lack volume and the lack of sound proofing means you can hear everything going on around you, even at full volume. They are also infuriatingly difficult to pair. When I pair them to my Mac, sometimes they connect but sound does not transfer to the headphones, note, this is not an issue for the other bluetooth headphones I own which work every time. They are also really annoying to pair to another device as you have to turn them off and back on again. The buttons are also badly placed and makes it difficult to press them while wearing them. They are also unnecessarily thick, meaning they are pretty heavy. The built in microphone is completely useless. They also scratch very easily. I have had mine less than a month and hardly used them and they are already badly scratched. The only benefit of these headphones is the battery life, which lasts days without having to be recharged. That is the only benefit to these though. DO NOT BUY THESE HEADPHONES!!! There are SO many alternatives out there cheaper than these that sound better and have sound proofing. They are a total waste of money and are one of the worst purchases I have ever made on Amazon.

These are the first Bluetooth headphones I have bough. I watched a lot of reviews on youtube on other headphones on different brand. They all were very highly priced. I saw this on amazon and looked at the specifications and it ticked all the boxes, well apart from one. The one thing I would say is the durability of these headphones. They are made out of good plastic and I haven‚Äôt broken them, but compare to other headphones I feel like the hinge feels a bit cheap. Again I haven‚Äôt broken these and I have used them when I‚Äôm travelling to work so if they do break I will update this review on how they broke. The good thing about these headphones are that they do everything on the box. Sound on these are very good not too much on the base like Beat headphones. The ability to answer phone calls on these is a very good function as the person on the other end can hear me clearly even in crowded areas like a train station. It does take a while to get used to using the control on the headphones but after a week of use you will get used to them. I have used these in the gym and I have to say they are good I walked away from the thread mill to get cleaning towel and the Bluetooth connection stayed on. Overall good headphones at a decent price but I would say treat these with a bit of care. I do look after my electronics really carefully.

Mayoritariamente pl√°stico, 45‚Ç¨ son el bluetooth, 2,79 los altavoces,. Muy baja calidad tanto de sonido como de materiales. E l precio original 100‚Ç¨ ni en broma. No puedo decir nada mas sin menospreciar la marca Sony, o hablar de enga√±os por parte de amazon. Este producto suena mas a chino que a Sony.

I've had these for a couple of weeks. The sound is ok. Though, in comparison to my akg k451's or Sony MDR-EX650AP in-ear (which I adore) it is pretty bad, but my new phone has sadly lost the 3.5mm jack so I had to swap to wireless. They have very little fidelity, poor bass response and the volume doesn't seem to go too high. Additionally, the lack of noise cancelling is so evident and even trying to listen on some modes of public transport is a waste of time. The wireless was super easy to set up and I've never had problems with connectivity. Having access to controls on the right can is exceptionally useful and allows play/pause, skip track (forward and back), and volume control without having to get your phone out of your pocket. The battery life is brilliant, easily lasts a couple of days of heavy use and I've never been concerned about them running out mid trip. The design doesn't feel particularly solid, with the headband being quite flimsy looking plastic. The sliders adjust with very little effort, which I don't like. They also sit quite uncomfortably over my ears, making them uncomfortable to wear for an hour at a time without adjusting or having a break. The lack of a padded headband really isn't an issue to me though. Overall, for the money I'm still happy enough with the purchase. The freedom of wireless is wonderful, especially with access to controls on the right can and the setup and ease of connection is spot on. Just lacks comfort and sound quality. I think I will invest in a headset with noise cancelling in the future also.

Im Bassbereich empfand ich diesen Sony Kopfh√∂rer druckvoll ohne zu dr√∂hnen, die H√∂hen waren etwas spitz aber sehr klar. Dadurch sehr ausgewogenes Klangbild. Die Technik hat gut funktioniert. Passform ok. Die Steuerungstasten am Kopfh√∂rer sind intuitiv bedienbar und lassen sich gut erf√ºhlen. 3.5mm Kabelanschlu√ü fehlt, um nach Batterieende weiterzuh√∂ren oder den Kopfh√∂rer mit Ger√§ten ohne Bluetooth zu verbinden. Im Vergleich mit Marshall, JBL und Philips (siehe meine anderen Rezensionen) mein klarer Favorit.
Great value high quality headphones. A best buy in some independent reviews. We paired it with Trond 2-in1 Bluetooth V4 Transmitter to allow 2 headphones to be used at once with our Smart TV.

Ya puedes correr, hacer hiits, agacharte, burpees, nada. Es una maravilla. Buen sonido. Bajo mi punto de vista podr√≠an mejorar en este aspecto, siempre lo llevo al m√°ximo. Pero m√°s que satisfecha. I recently purchased these to make up a Christmas voucher I had been given. No real expectations on sound quality, just thought it would be good to have half decent wireless headphones. These are great quality headphones. The Bluetooth system couldn‚Äôt be more simple to connect (I have an iPhone). The battery life is great. The sound quality is good, not anything spectacular and certainly not noise cancelling which they don‚Äôt claim to be, but they do the job. The one thing I have an issue with, which forced me into writing this review, is other reviewers on here stating about the fragility of these headphones. They almost turned me off buying, but I thought - how fragile could they be? You‚Äôd have to be an idiot with some serious heavy hands if you break these (minus accidents of course). They‚Äôre not overly sturdy but as I said earlier, they do the job. Treat them them well and they will serve you well.

Being so competitively priced, I wasn‚Äôt expecting too much from these. Bluetooth headphones range so much in price and quality and you can pay anything from 20-400 pounds. These are actually very good despite the low price tag. They instantly connected to my phone, battery life is decent, they‚Äôre well made and look stylish. The sound quality is impressive too. It‚Äôs not quite on a par with products from Bose, kygo, bang and olufsen but for everyday use they‚Äôre great. Bass is just right and there is practically no distortion even at high volume Overall a stylish, well made and all round decent pair of headphones from a great brand

Si fuese un audi√≥filo empedernido seguramente me gastase mucho m√°s dinero, pero como no lo soy me basta con unos auriculares de este estilo. En primer lugar, la calidad de construcci√≥n es muy buena. Esto, para m√≠, es algo objetivo. El estuche es como de piel y la calidad de las almohadillas es muy buena. Tienen mucho acolchado. Tambi√©n la diadema tiene bastante, que era una de las cosas que m√°s me molestaban del modelo anterior. A prop√≥sito, son m√°s peque√±os que el modelo anterior (¬°BIEN!). Tanto medios como altos me recuerdan bastante al modelo anterior, no es que vea mucha mejor√≠a ah√≠. La funci√≥n estrella de Cancelaci√≥n de Sonido me deja con un sabor agridulce. Por un lado, para utilizar en casa me funciona muy bien. Los sonidos de la tele o de los vecinos los a√≠sla bien. Pero me da la sensaci√≥n de que no ser√≠a suficiente si saliera a la calle con ellos. Yo los usar√© en casa, pero si alguien los quieres para irse con ellos por ah√≠ estoy seguro de que seguir√≠a escuchando muchos sonidos. M√°s bien oculta sonidos constantes y graves, como la lavadora o as√≠. Yo los uso siempre con esa funci√≥n encendida, ya que aparte de ocultar el ruido pues le da como un extra de potencia. Por ahora pude utilizarlos varios d√≠as durante 1h y no tuve problema de comodidad. Si noto que me hacen demasiada presi√≥n o algo, vendr√© y modificar√© la opini√≥n sin problema. Smaller than the E9 Model, which is good. They look more streamlined. Nice tapered hinges, made of metal, both more stylish and stronger looking than the E9. The E10s can be increased to a loud volume. Noise cancelling works as expected. It cuts out some background noise, but it's an 80 pounds piece of equipment, so don't expect miracles. Supplied with a nice carry case, charging cable etc. The E10s fold down nicely for your convenience. A good upgrade on the E9 model which preceeded the E10.

I was actually pretty disappointed with these headphones overall. I had seen good reviews / experiences with the E9s so decided I'd give these a go. Pros: Build quality is decent Included case and cables are of a good quality Setup is quick, and they connect quickly Cons: Sound quality isn't great Active Noise Cancellation actually makes the sound quality even worse, ANC seems to strip a lot of the treble out and introduces a muddiness to the sound ANC is turned back on every time the headphones are powered on, so if like me you don't use the ANC, this is annoying The earcups need to be bigger, they sit on your ears rather than over them and get uncomfortable after a while I guess for the price, I don't know why I expected any better

Bought these to replace my previous noise cancelling headphones for long flights - the previous pair suffered an irritating lag so when watching downloaded netflix shows on my tablet there was always a few micro seconds of a delay so any characters in the shows when speaking their mouths simply didn't match the sound perfectly - terrible for someone who suffers OCD like me haha! Pleased to say the lag is not present on these headphones. They appear to be well made and comfortable fit - I certainly don't feel like my head has been squeezed after wearing for a few hours. Battery life is good and over the course of a week only charged them once. The noise cancellation certainly drowns out the drone of any aircraft sounds which was the main reason I bought these.

lovely presentation with nicely made box and case. headphones feel sturdy and well made. maybe a bit too tight on head but not uncomfortable. sound with ANC off is good. sound with ANC on is terrible, creaking and crackling , i am currently waiting for reply from mixcder support to see if there is an update or if my headphones are faulty. 1 month of regular use with tv and left earcup has ripped at seam. i am a mxcder fan with 4 previous models of headphones and this is easily the most expensive and faulty and poorly made headphones. Update After conversations with mixcder support it appears I had a faulty set. Just recieved a brand new headset from mixcder and all issues sorted. Great anc great sound. Thanks angel at mixcder for replacement after my return date ran out. Great service

They sound okay but I've heard better for ¬£70. The ANC is almost non-existent. I've tried cheaper ANC headphones that were better but of course still not up to the best. The main issue is how uncomfortable they are to wear. Something I've never experienced in headphones before. They actually caused my pain that I could feel for some time after taking them off. They are listed as "over ear" headphones but the cups are small and they are definitely "on ear" headphones rather than "over ear". I've had Sennheiser BT 4.5 headphones that were correctly listed as "on ear" headphones and they had bigger cups than these. So false advertising there. I wouldn't have bought them if they had been listed correctly. The pain was caused not just on my ears but on the top of my head from the headband too. Horrible comfort. By far the worst I've experienced in headphones.

Great response by both Mixcder.com and Mixcder Direct helped me initially choose the E10 headphones and I wasn't disappointed. The headphones arrived promptly within 2 days, they were packaged in an attractive box and the hard case is sturdy with an elasticated strap to hold them in place. I was surprised how small and neat they were compared to my old wired Sony headphones, note they measure approximately 53 X 36mm across the cushion openings with about 10mm give, therefore I would not recommend these for bigger ears. The metal parts have a bronze finish that gives them a premium appearance. A voice confirmation is heard on powering up and down, I found the push buttons easy to get the hang of whilst operating, ie ANC on off next track ect. The cushions are soft and comfortable and sit comfortably on the ear, the noise from my TV in the room was cut roughly 50% just by passive noise reduction alone. The sound from these headphones is well balanced bass can punch through loud and clear when required. Note I cannot comment on outside use of these headphones, so far they have been used solely in my sitting room. ANC cuts TV noise by about another 20% though whilst listening to music nothing can be heard in the background. Pairing is a breeze I have successfully connected two android tablets a phone and an android TV box plus a windows 10 computer first time. Range seems excellent I have walked from one end of my house to the other placing 2 walls and one double glazed door between my laptop and the headphones without loss of connection. I'm very pleased with my purchase.

These aren't a bad set of headphones at all. For under ¬£100, they're actually a pretty good pair of headphones. The problem is, you can get better for this price if you're not bothered about ANC, and if you are bothered about ANC, I wouldn't recommend buying these. I could barely tell any difference with ANC on or off, they did almost nothing to cancel out any background noise. The cups did a good job of passive noise isolation, but the ANC did next to nothing. For that reason, either buy a better pair without ANC at this price, or be prepared to pay 2-3x this price for effective ANC

I have to say I am blown away! These headphones are awesome. The best Sound that I have ever heard on headphones. They are packaged well. Come with a nice sturdy case. The build quality overall is also very good along with the 30 battery life which I cannot yet vouch for except that I‚Äôve used them for several hours and the batter is down to 70% I am very happy. I feel these are of high end quality without paying the high end price of a known brand

The headphones are made from a combination of plastic and aluminium. It‚Äôs nicely finished and not tacky. The leatherette earpads and headband are very soft and offer ideal cushioning for the head. The product feels extremely premium and most people I‚Äôve shown them to could not believe these were sub ¬£100. With great build quality, decent noise reduction performance, impressive audio, and a battery life that can rival the best of the best, The Mixcder E10 ANC headphones are easy recommendations to anyone who wants a pair of over-the-ear headphones.

I really liked how these sounded, and if I had bought them for that alone I would have kept them, but sadly I have had to return them. For me, I need the very best in noise cancellation, and from reading a bit more about it all, it seems only the top few can offer excellent noise cancelling, I was asking too much of something at ¬£89.99. They sound very good and they have done a good job for the price, you can tell the noise cancelling is on for sure, it does work, just not enough for me personally.

Great sound quality and noise cancellation for the price. The volume was very loud out of the box for me, so I'd recommend pairing and adjusting it before you put them on just to be on the safe side. The Bluetooth range is reasonable but I have experienced some drops when I'm wandering around the flat and have a couple of walls between me and the source device. That said, if I'm at my PC using them or wandering around with my phone the connection's solid and reliable.

Just bought these as i needed a new pair or headphones for the gym, and these came highly recommended! They are some of the best quality headphones I have ever used, they have a really nice feel the quality is spot on. The sound is crisp and clear along with the Noise cancelling it's amazing! I would highly recommend these to anyone.
My grandson loves them. Bought him another pair to take on holiday.
Great build quality, nice balanced sound with excellent battery life. Good codec support and BT 5. No indication of battery level which other manufacturers have which is the only let down.

My son loves listening to music, watching videos and playing games on his iPad but it can be really distracting when we are trying to watch or listen to something else, or when his little sister is in bed so I wanted to get him a set of headphones he could use so he wasn't disturbing anyone else. Found these on amazon and they are perfect - they are a cool blue colour with detachable cute ears (my son loves being a cat at the moment but the fact that you can take them off means he will get loads of use out of them as he grows) and they fold up neatly and fit perfectly in the carry bag that comes with them. The bluetooth connectivity is great - really easy to connect you just turn the headphones on and they enter pairing mode - go into the connectivity settings of the device you are using and then connect - sorted. They also have a detachable audio cable so they can also be used as a wired set of headphones. My son likes them wired as he enjoys setting them up himself (he thinks it makes him look more important!) but I've tested the bluetooth and it works perfectly too. The thing I like the most is the child friendly volume control - it's set to 85db meaning kids cant turn it up louder than this so it protects their hearing - this volume level is plenty loud enough but gives me that piece of mind when he is controlling it himself. Overall a great set of headphones which means my son can enjoy listening to baby shark till his hearts content and I dont have too!

Exactly size for grand daughter and even better no wires which is great . The cups are nice and soft so protects her ears and they don't get uncomfortable after a while. The volume is set so she can't have them blasting but they are still pretty loud. They are really good quality and great value for money. The Bluetooth connection is very good and tried them on various media's. Charging time is good and using time is even better only charged once since they arrived. We both are very happy with these headphones.

My son absolutely loves these headphones. He can now be just like mummy with his own wireless Bluetooth headphones. They have been ideal when we‚Äôve been on the train or even in the car because the noise of his tablet isn‚Äôt blaring in my ear anymore. The only downside was I broke one of the cat ears (that was my fault as I did drop the headphones) but it was easy enough to fix so it‚Äôs not a huge issue. I needed some bluetooth headphones for my daughter and after reading the reviews I opted for these one. I'm really glad I did. The pastel colours are lovely and the cat ears are a really cute addition. They're so soft and my daughter said they're comfy too. Easy to set up, the instructions are easy to follow, they just need to be paired with the different devices and it's done. Don't forget to disconnect them from a device before connect to another one otherwise they don't work. A travel bag is included. They're good value for money and size can be adjusted (they even fit on grownup's head) so my daughter will use them for a while.

I was looking for a set of headphones (over-the ear specifically) for my boys that could limit the max volume for hearing safety without sacrificing sound quality. These are 100% on the mark. Of course when they arrived, I tried them out first and I was instantly very happy with both the sound quality and the level. They aren't "too" quiet which is what I feared. They are really just right and still articulate the highs and lows that are essential to the listening experience. They also fit my boy ages nearly 4 with the size adjustment capability. I am extremely satisfied with these!

In terms of sound quality, I can't really make a judgement as my head is obviously too big for it but my little one seems happy. It's being used when watching videos and since there are no complaints, i can only assume it's adequate. Seems to be good noise cancelling too. It's Bluetooth connected which paired easily but they also provided an aux cable which I prefer as it allows for more options. Good run time on a charge. Pleased with my buy.

Really impressed with these headphones. Bought for my 8 year old daughter. They fit her well and the padded ear bits mean they are comfy for her to wear.
