I'm sad because the headphones initially worked well, but developed an increasing sort of hum of static that quickly rendered the headphones unusable. It's too bad, because initially I was impressed. I thought that maybe I just got a bad set and that customer service might remedy this. Not so. I pitched them out :(

#--# Nuestro inter√©s al comprar el producto #--# Siempre he utilizado auriculares peque√±itos de los que se ponen dentro de la oreja para ir a correr o para escuchar m√∫sica en casa si mi pareja esta haciendo otras cosas y no la puedo poner por los altavoces‚Ä¶ Y tras un tiempo pensando, me he decidido a comprar estos auriculares bluetooth que incluso tienen una ranura para poner tarjeta sd y no necesitar ni tel√©fono para reproducir. #--# Puntos buenos del producto #--# -Plegables de forma muy sencilla. -Una funda donde guardarlos resistente y de calidad. -Ranura SD para reproducir m√∫sica desde los propios cascos. -Posibilidad de convertir los cascos bluetooth a unos cascos normales con el cable que trae el estuche. -Sincronizaci√≥n f√°cil y r√°pida. -Micr√≥fono para poder utilizarlos de manos libres (lo he probado corriendo por la calle y se escucha excesivo ruido de viento, pero luego lo he probado andando tambi√©n por la calle y funciona muy bien) #--# Puntos malos o no tan buenos del producto #--# -No hemos encontrado nada que contaros en este punto. #--# Conclusi√≥n #--# -Si os gustan los cascos de tama√±o mediano y con colores llamativos, estos son muy recomendables.

Let me start by saying that this is a good purchase for the price, and I actually recommend buying these, but there are just a few comments I'd like to make. The sound quality is decent at best, but never would I describe these as having an "amazing" sound quality. For the money, they're a bit better than what you would expect. But if you're thinking that you will strike gold with a $30 pair of headphones that sound like $200 headphones, you're dreaming. Also, I feel like I'm charging these bad boys every couple of days, and I don't think I'm using them excessively. That being said, these are my first pair of Bluetooth headphones, so maybe that's normal? As far as durability, they haven't broken yet, but I also haven't really done anything that would make them break? That's why I rated them 5 stars, they're still working! Again, good headphones and good value. But they're not phenomenal by any means, It's more like getting a $50 pair of headphones for $30.

I read the other reviews before purchasing, and the main issue seemed to be that the headphones were flimsy. This is true - they come folded to fit into the case and I was worried about snapping the band when I opened them to wear them, particularly when there was a snapping noise as I straightened them out. However, all was well, although I may not be brave enough to attempt to fold them back into their case. Having got that out of the way, they work just fine. I found pairing easy and the range is OK - e.g. I can play music from my PC and hear it through the headphones anywhere in the house, and about 30ft into the garden although, at this range, reception starts to get patchy. Sound quality is good enough for me, but I should stress I am not a hi-fi nut - I just wanted convenience. All in all, I am happy with them - good value.

I bought this headphone set for my 17 year old son. He's getting very brand oriented now but trusts my opinion (mostly) and this set of headphones has ticked all of his boxes; They look cool, they're Bluetooth, they sound great and they fold up. He's very happy with them indeed - so I've given them 5* for quality and battery life - I mean 9 - 10 hours at least from not even a full charge is pretty impressive. I've only given 4* on durability because it's too early to tell - but they certainly don't look or feel like they'll fall apart. One thing that he really appreciates - and is a new experience for him is the noise cancelling effect - I do believe him when he says he didn't hear anything being said when he's in the back of the car now - so he doesn't have to pretend anymore. I can't really say more than that - other than I'm thinking of getting a set myself as I do feel pretty jealous comparing them to my old scrathed up bins.

Arrived on a SUNDAY! Literally 1 day after I ordered. The sound is great! The pairing was so fast and I never cracked a book to see how to do it. The added bonus was the quality of the noise reduction. I work on a scroll saw and now I don‚Äôt have to listen to the drone of the motor and blade. Bass is excellent, they do have a really good rounded sound, not metally or tin sounding. And extremely comfortable. My hubby tried them too and said the fit was good. I have a child sized head and he definitely has an average sized head. I would definitely recommend and buy again.

Great product great price would recommend to buy. The sound is good easy to setup and you get free case as well. It also came a day earlier than it said . It came through post office seems quicker than courier

Just wanted a light set of headphones and liked the look of these. Didn't pay too much attention to the description. They looked good, they were headphones, so I ordered them. Did I get a surprise! Integral radio, slot for micro sd, equaliser! Was sp leased I ordered another set for my husband üòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅ

Short term review: A mediocre pair of headphones for the money. The sound isn't amazing; it's a bit 'tinny' and lacking any kind of depth. The build quality is ok, if not a little cheap feeling. Battery life is, again, mediocre; you get a few hours playback from a full charge. However... Longer term review: A little over 6 months in and they now no longer charge. So what was initially a pair of wireless headphones, now to have any kind of functionality need to have an audio cable attached, ergo not wireless. Yes, I know they weren't a huge amount of money, but I'd expect more than 6 months usage out of them. My two pence: avoid them and spend that little bit extra on something better.

Lo siento, pero tras pens√°rmelo durante 4 o 5 dias, al final los he devuelto. El dise√±o es bonito. Y que incorpore un estuche est√° muy bien. Peeeero: - los materiales no me parecen muy durables. Tiene una cierta apariencia de "ay, que se va a romper" - el negro mate es bonito... hasta que empieza a quedar llenos de manchas de los dedos. - la radio (unos de los motivos por los que los escog√≠) no me coge las emisoras que escucho normalmente con cualquier otro receptor. - bater√≠a: no sabr√≠a decir qu√© duraci√≥n tiene, pero no es mucha. - sonido: pasable. Pero por ese precio tampoco esperaba nada impresionante. Lo que no es aceptable es que al escuchar Spotify por bluetooth, en el ordenador, no en el tel√©fono (es decir, que no deber√≠a haber problemas), y sin m√°s programas abiertos ni procesos en segundo t√©rmino que pudieran ralentizar el procesador, el sonido llega entrecortado, con microparadas, y te obliga a utilizar el cable. - lo peor para mi, y motivo definitivo para devolverlos: la incomodidad. Son demasiado peque√±os y aprietan demasiado las orejas. Y no soy nada cabez√≥n, m√°s bien al contrario, pero a√∫n as√≠ parecen de talla infantil. Al cabo de un ratito de uso ya notaba que me apretaba por todas partes. Si vas a usarlos durante mucho rato para estudiar o trabajar, mejor g√°state 20‚Ç¨ m√°s y pasa a un nivel algo superior.

UPDATE: After only using it for 2 days, about 2 hours each day, the battery ran out. It was fully charged. Not a good sign. This is only the second day I have the headphones. Their original audio quality is OK, not great. I installed a bass boost and equaliser app on my phone and it now sounds great. It's well built and sturdy. The hard case is a nice touch. I also bought this for PS4 gaming, which I'll update the review on it later. Happy with it so far. After having it for nearly a year I dropped a star from my review. Bluetooth connection is not great and it drops too easily. Battery life only got worse.

Wonderful headphones. I have tested the Bluetooth pairing with 4 different things and it connects quickly each time. I wondered if it would connect with my ipad (main use) as I often have problems with connecting things with this but paired beautifully. Sound quality is great...a good base which I wanted...I wanted it particularly for watching YouTube tutorials whilst hubby is watching other stuff on tv at times and couldn't be better...he can watch his trash tv whilst I can listen to my own thing. üôÇ I tried them also with music and the sound quality is fabulous. I have a headset already but wanted one without the wires and this does the job...either Bluetooth or if that's not available, just plug to the appliance. It comes with the USB cable for charging. It also comes with a case and this is fabulous...a sturdy, attractive zipped, mounded (not floppy) case to protect the headset. Great value.

Arrived day earlier than estimated. Very comfortable. As described and found them easy to use. So far connected to iPod, kindle and laptop. No worrying about finding batteries as comes with usb charger. Also wired. Let's you know when it needs charging. So can just plug in wire and carry on watching or listening. Brilliant for the money. Have already recommended to my friends

Only just received these headphones but first impressions are very good. Fold up to compact size and carry case is excellent. Very easy to set up paired with Amazon Fire tablet to enable my wife to listen to Audio Books. Reproduction is clear and smooth and set is comfortable to wear. Charging is quick and all instructions are clear if a little sparse on text. Overall so far so good - looks like a good buy.

I bought these because my phone's audio port has been on the fritz lately so I thought using Bluetooth would be better instead. I have only tried these for a total of 2 hours and my experience was pretty poor. I'll admit that the sound quality while listening to music is pretty good and it was very easy to pair. Though my issue is with using these headphones to talk on the phone. I'm sure talking on the phone is a prehistoric idea to some but I used these to talk to my friend on Discord and I was forced to use the built-in microphone (which to be honest I had no idea was there). According to him "IT'S LIKE I'M TALKING TO YOU THROUGH A BLANKET YOU'RE SHOVING INTO YOUR MOUTH". I typically use my phone's microphone and some cheap $10 Sony headphones to talk with him and we've never had issues. Not only could he not hear me, I couldn't hear him. There was a lot of delay, everything was muffled and it cut out quite frequently. I was quite upset because they are beautiful headphones, I love rose gold but I must return them. So, unless you don't plan to do much more than listen to music with these, I can't recommend them.

The quality of the product is good,. It is well built, well packaged and works well (as a speaker). Where i was disappointed was the tech itself. Because it reads Bone Conductive Technology, i was under the impression that is wear the sound goes. It doesn't though, the product is essentially two speakers that sit on your face and vibrate a lot. the volume and quality of the sound doesn't change when resting on your cheek bone so the frame is essentially there to hold the speakers close to your ears. The sound is also far from private, because you are wearing speakers close to your ears as opposed to in/on them with headphones, it means anyone in close proximity can also hear the music.

The appearance on opening the package immediately inspires confidence that one Is getting a quality item. The smart box packaging is stylish and up-market, much along the lines of Apple equipment. But hey, why not have a solid lid to the box to complete the smart presentation and avoid putting another piece of plastic into the world? The headphone itself is also a very cool looking piece of kit with a quality feel about it, with no loose wires to wear out with constant bending, something that earlier Tayogo equipment suffered from. The instruction manual is very small but perfectly adequate, with the English language version running to only 6 pages of clear instructions in good English. When wearing the headphone, it is lightweight and comfortable, with the bone conduction pads sitting easily just in front of the ears. The power and volume controls are very small and slightly fiddly to use but since there are only three buttons, can be identified by touch. The play/pause/call receive control is on the left earpiece and is much larger and really very convenient to touch on and off. Nice design Tayogo! I have previously owned a Tayogo underwater mp3 player that delivers the sound via bone conduction. That relied on the sound conductivity of water to work and I was sceptical that the S2 would perform as well in air, without water to conduct the sound. However, my doubts were groundless as the S2 delivers decent quality sound at very acceptable volume levels. The system also gives voice prompts for ‚ÄòPower On‚Äô and ‚ÄòPower Off‚Äô and also tells you when the Bluetooth is connected and to which device. That is a helpful feature. Now to the applications for the use of the S2. The headphone is very stable on the head so could be used successfully when walking, running, fishing or other fairly solitary outdoor sports. It is claimed to be sweatproof but not waterproof, so water sports are clearly not applicable. It could be used in the gym successfully but, and this is a big ‚Äòbut‚Äô, when playing at even moderate volume levels, there is a lot of sound spill over into the outside world. This is far more noticeable than with in-ear headphones. I think that fellow gym users would get justifiably quite irritated with an S2 user on the next piece of equipment. I am a regular leisure cyclist but have always frowned on bike riders who wear earphones whilst riding. The great safety advantage that a cyclist has over vehicle drivers is that one can hear other traffic approaching from all directions. Wearing earphones effectively denies one of this advantage. However, I thought, with bone conduction, the ears are not blocked, and one should be able to hear traffic as normal, so I took my new S2 for a bike ride. It was not a success as, to compete with the natural wind noise when cycling at say, 15-20mph, one has to set the volume level towards its maximum. Therefore, although one‚Äôs ears are open to receive traffic sounds, the music volume effectively masks traffic noises and loses the safety advantage that a cyclist should enjoy. Moreover, at high volume settings, the bone conduction pads can be felt vibrating against one‚Äôs temples, which I found slightly ticklish and distracting. I won‚Äôt be taking the S2 out on the road again. Those interested in the Tayogo S2 should be aware that this is simply a set of ‚Äòbonephones‚Äô and not an mp3 player. No data is stored in the S2 but it will play from any Bluetooth capable device. In sum, the Tayogo S2 is a smart, well-designed accessory that certainly has its place in several sports environments. The build standard feels good and so I hope it should have a decent operating lifespan. It produces good sound quality and volume levels. It is not, however, suitable for use with other people around who might not appreciate your choice of music.

I was sceptical at first but WOW! Easy to set up, legible & coherent instructions (must be, even I managed to set them up within seconds of opening the box). The great problem I always have is the discomfort from in-ear headphones after a while. Not helped by an inner ear piercing either. These went on. Nestled next to my spectacles and I've only removed them to sleep. My 12yr son loves them as well so that's his birthday sorted. The headphones also come with foam earplugs which help with bass notes but I usually go without depending on what I'm doing. Received and made phone calls through them with no problems at either end. I'm sure there are better headphones on the market but at this price? No way. These do everything I want at a price I like.

I already own a pair of AfterShokz Trekz ¬£100+ headphones so I was interested to see how these much cheaper headphones compared. The short answer they compare very well. Very well indeed. The headphones comes in a nice box, look great and would be lovely as a gift Very easy to set up, done in a matter of minutes and connected well with my smart phone. Easy to use. I especially like that it is very easy to press play and pause as this button is on the side of the left speaker. Very handy when running. Unlike my AfterShokz Trekz headphones it's not possible to order these headphones in sizes. I have quite a small head so when i first put these on i felt they were quite big around the back of my head.However using them they feel like they fit well and dont move on when running. The sound is good. The headphones come fully changed and I have been using several times over the past week and I'm yet to recharge. So good battery life. Overall very happy and pleased. Very good value for money.

Sound quality - 9/10. It would have been 10 but due to the bone conductive element of these earphones, it takes a little getting used to and the sound may be a little different to that of conventional earphones because of this. Battery - 10/10. Worked for 6 hours streaming music. Great battery life for the price. Range and connectivity - 8/10. Easy to connect to my devices. I was unable to continue connection if I left my phone in the house and went into garden but connection is strong within 5/6 metres. Overall - 27/30. Brilliant bluetooth earphones at a reasonable cost. And if you like to listen to your music at a higher volume then these are a great, worry free alternative to conventional earphones that wont take a toll on your eardrums!!

I came across these Bone Conduction Headphones purely by chance. I was very sceptical of the quality & even if they would work properly. The design of these headphones are almost an identical copy to the genuine set I already have. However I decided to try them out, with very low expectations. Well I am absolutely blown away! Ok the packaging is basic, limited instructions & made from a lower quality materials - but overall reasonably well made. Most important point is how well they work. I was completely blow away how brilliant they are. They are superb. The sound quality is perhaps lower than the genuine set, but the difference is very small, and only becomes noticeable at volume level above 75%. The best part is the price & the excellent value for money. At ¬£25.59 means they are just under 8 times cheaper than the branded version. Now only time will tell how well they work & how long they last? What more can I say? Superb & 5-Stars!

Have had both versions of the Tayogo BT Headsets and both are great. The bone conductor works well for working out and cycling. Had a slight issue with the headset due to my usage and the support have been fantastic and speedy in helping out and sorting the problem Highly recommended

Inicialmente la impresi√≥n no fue buena. Lo prob√© en casa y la sensaci√≥n del sonido es muy distinta a la que te ofrecen los auriculares internos lo que inicialmente no me gust√≥. Adem√°s, oy√©ndolos en casa notaba que los que est√°n alrededor o√≠an el sonido. En cuanto a la ergonom√≠a, tienen una posici√≥n √∫nica que me parec√≠a que con el uso continuado no ser√≠an c√≥modos. Sin embargo, yo los quer√≠a para ir en bici sin aislarme del exterior, as√≠ que decid√≠ probarlos en una ruta de monta√±a.. y no pude quedar mas contento. Estuve con ellos m√°s de una hora y media. El sonido es muy bueno, y sin subir mucho el volumen lo oyes perfectamente. La sensaci√≥n ‚Äúrara‚Äù respecto de los internos desapareci√≥ nada m√°s empezar la ruta. Adem√°s oyes igualmente todo lo que ocurre a tu alrededor lo que no suponen un riesgo en la conducci√≥n. La conexi√≥n con el m√≥vil y el sonido de la llamada (me llamaron en plena ruta) es igualmente buena. No he probado todas las funcionalidades (permite conexi√≥n bluetooth a dos dispositivos). No lo he probado para correr y no s√© si se mover√≠a, pero en la bicicleta su posici√≥n es estable y te olvidas de que los llevas. Pero tengo claro que no lo quiero para o√≠r m√∫sica en mi casa donde prefiero un buen altavoz. En definitiva pese a mi escepticismo inicial estoy muy contento.

Mi hanno sorpreso, l'audio √® buono. Naturalmente per sentire al meglio √® consigliabile mettere i tappi per le orecchie che sono in dotazione nella confezione. Difetti evidenti sono che quando si ascoltano canzoni o si usano per guardare video, i rumori forti tendono a far vibrare parecchio i conduttori e quindi danno fastidio. Inoltre questo tipo di cuffie hanno l'asta sul retro che non √® a filo della testa ma sta parecchio in sporgenza, quindi ci le volesse acquistare per usarle a letto coricato le sconsiglio. Risultato finale: Ottime per chi pratica sport e vuole sentire i rumori circostanti (es: macchine, moto). Per quanto riguarda l'ascolto tramite smartphone o TV, le sconsiglio perch√© non si sente un granch√©

I wasn't very impressed with these and returned them. I bought them to listen to podcasts on my walk to and from work. I found that even at full volume they were drowned out by the traffic noise. They work great with ear plugs or fingers in your ears, but that defeats the purpose I bought them for. The other use I had in mind was for making Microsoft Teams calls at work. I'm not the biggest fan of headsets because you're never sure how loud you're being and in an open plan office that's not great. For this use I found that again the office hubub could drown out the sound, but the thing that really put me off was the poor quality mic. Sound quality was acceptable but generally poor and a bit tinny. Other than those 2 main points I found that the band stuck out from the back of my head and was a bit annoying whilst wearing. They were a bit loose and I couldn't find a comfortable position on my ears. After 30 mins of use they were beginning to hurt. They're not for me, but your milage and use case may vary.

I had been looking at a more ‚Äòwell known‚Äô brand, but funds were limited, so decided to give these a go. Given how relatively cheap these are, I was prepared to be disappointed but so far they have exceeded expectations. Sound quality is good and I‚Äôve been blown away by the long battery life. I have a relatively small head and they are a little loose however I have used them for dog walking, car washing etc and they have been fairly comfortable. It‚Äôs also great that you can still hear traffic etc. although they do come with ear plugs.

Owned a wired set of bone conduction phones for a few years now, Aftershox bought by my daughter for my bike rides and all round use, I've been able to wear them at work and they've been ideal for health and safety reasons. So I looked into the Tayogo S2 Bluetooth set, I have not been disappointed with them for sound quality and ease of use (a week in) the buttons may be a bit small for gloved hands but that's a minor gripe compared to the plus points, connected quickly to all my Bluetooth gadgets, mp3, phone and tablet, literally in seconds. The battery life is good easily reaching the six hour claim. They are very light and comfortable and the outer noise is less than my Shox, my wife can barely hear them when on a decent amount of volume, I've seen reviews stating they're not bone conductors, I can state they definitely are and are well worth the money, it's early days yet but I'm very happy with these.....üôÇ

Great because you can still hear but those around you can't hear what you're listening to (have checked with the other half and she can't hear anything when I'm using them in bed). I have mainly used these to listen to audio books for this purpose they excel. I think the bass and general are not as good as (even very cheap) in-ear headphones but the benefits outweigh this fact for me since I only use then when I need to stay alert to external sounds.

I had a wired pair of Aftershocks, but my current phone doesn't have a headphone jack, so I was stuck. These had enough positive reviews to warrant a test, and were cheap enough to take a risk. My principal sport is running, so all comments are based around that activity. Build and battery life are fine so far. The set is comfy to wear, and doesn't move during running. Unit pairs easily, and reconnects with no problem. There are a few reviews on here complaining about the sound. Bone conduction headphones are never going to give beautiful audio clarity - it's inherent in their design. The sound quality on these is around the same as my Aftershokz (which were double the price), but the volume is a little lacking. I seem to reach 'ear tickling' vibration at a much lower volume level than with the aftershokz. However, the point is that these are designed to let outside noise in. They aren't designed for sound quality, but rather to strike a balance between sound, environment safety, and minimising hearing damage. I listen to music when I run purely to keep pace. The quality of the music is secondary to the safety, and the lack of 'wear and tear' on my ears is welcome. I ran the Cardiff half with these today, and they performed just fine. I saw at least 7 other pairs during the event. Tl;Dr Decent set of bone conduction headphones, that match more expensive brands in all but sound volume. Buy these instead of a pair of 'Beats', and spend the saving on decent shoes.

These are so easy to use, immediately linked to my phone, instructions are clear and there is voice indicator to help be sure of the button operation. The phones are light and set in a frame that is neat but leaves room for more hair at the back. They sit over the ear and conduct clear sound at front of the ear so that it is possible to still hear everything around you. This is so useful for cycling or running, or even indoors when you need to hear a visitor, the phone or a delivery etc. The sound is more mid and top, there is some bass which increases if I use the ear plugs or move the sound nearer my ear. I think these are handy when you want a break from pummelling your inner ear but want some musical/audio company all the same. I think the longest time I used them so far was 6hrs The only attribute I would add is being able to adjust the frame smaller at the back when needed. All in all a neat little bluetooth gadget that certainly has its place alongside my other mp3 players.

In den H√∂hen und Mitten sind sie auch gut, f√ºr diese Preisklasse sogar sehr gut. - Sie sind sehr klein und sitzen bequem im Ohr, man merkt das Tragen schon sehr schnell gar nicht mehr. - Das Bluetoothverbinden und -r√ºcksetzen ist sehr einfach, sodass man nicht mal die Anleitung braucht. Negativ ist mir nur eins aufgefallen: - Bei sehr hohen Lautst√§rken verzerren die Kopfh√∂rer ein wenig. Das ist f√ºr diesen Preis aber durchaus verkraftbar, au√üerdem h√∂re ich sowieso sehr selten so laut Musik. Damit ist dies kein Abzug wert. Como calidad de sonido estos auriculares son excelentes. Para hacer deporte son magn√≠ficos, no se mueven en absoluto hagas lo que hagas. Pero para m√≠ tienen fallo garrafal, sobre todo teniendo en cuenta lo que cuestan y la marca. Tienen una latencia en audio/v√≠deo de m√°s de un segundo, por lo que ver un v√≠deo con la boca y los gestos de quien habla por un lado y el sonido por otro es horroroso. Tengo unos auriculares Bluetooth de 24 euros y no tienen ninguna latencia por lo que, el hecho de que unos auriculares de la marca Bose tengan este fallo, me parece un crimen. Y no es que lo diga yo, es que en su propia p√°gina lo reconocen e indican que trabajan en ello para solucionarlo. Dicen que con iPad y iPhone el problema deber√≠a desparecer seg√∫n el protocolo de Bluetooth que utilizan sendos modelos, pero no es cierto. Lo he probado con ambos modelos (previa actualizaci√≥n de los auriculares a la √∫ltima versi√≥n de firmware) y ocurre lo mismo. Si despu√©s de m√°s de un a√±o que llevan en el mercado estos auriculares no han solucionado este problema, dudo much√≠simo que lo vayan a solucionar. Prometo que estuve dudando seriamente entre devolverlos o no porque el sonido es espectacular, pero sinceramente con la cantidad de v√≠deo que veo, me parece un delito tener que llevar unos auriculares de 160 euros s√≥lo para escuchar m√∫sica y otros aparte para ver v√≠deo, por lo que al final me decant√© por devolverlos. Lo que me sorprende es no haber visto estos comentarios por parte de nadie cuando incluso lo admiten en la propia p√°gina de Bose y en concreto para este modelo (l√°stima no haberlo sabido antes). Por cierto, el servicio t√©cnico de Bose Espa√±a, lamentable. Ni siquiera responden a las consultas que les plante√© por si exist√≠a alguna soluci√≥n. Afortunadamente y gracias a ello, di con otros auriculares de otra marca que solamente se dedica a sonido, totalmente inal√°mbricos y sin ese molesto problema, con un sonido incluso mejor, con una app para personalizar much√≠simas opciones de sonido, con un servicio t√©cnico impecable y, para mi gusto, algo m√°s c√≥modos y con mejor dise√±o. Eso s√≠, me costaron algo m√°s caros, pero ahora puedo decir que no me arrepiento en absoluto de haber pagado m√°s que por los Bose (unos 30 Euros m√°s), porque ahora s√≠ tengo la sensaci√≥n de haber pagado por lo que he comprado a diferencia de antes con los de Bose, puesto que me parec√≠a una tomadura de pelo el producto y trato recibido por el importe que pagu√© por los auriculares. Espero que os sirva mi opini√≥n y ojal√° alg√∫n d√≠a solucionen este problema que, desde mi punto de vista, es imperdonable en un producto de dicha marca. Por cierto, gracias Amazon por hacer que la gesti√≥n en la devoluci√≥n de los mismos haya sido tan sencilla y √°gil.

Habe die H√∂rer schweren Herzens nach 3 1/2 Wochen Test und innerlichen Kampf zur√ºck geschickt. Die Gr√ºnde daf√ºr waren unter anderem, das die Verbindung regelm√§ssig abgebrochen ist und sich erst dann wieder herstellen lies, wenn die H√∂rer wieder in die Ladestation gelegt wurden, dies kam manchmal alle 5 Minuten vor, was absolut st√∂rend ist. Die Musikqualit√§t und vor allem der Bass waren zwar sehr √ºberzeugend, aber leider waren die H√∂rer bei Youtube, Netflix und Amazon Prime Video nicht synchron, was ihm dieser Preisklasse nicht zu tolerieren ist! Der ausschlaggebendste Punkt, warum ich sie jedoch zur√ºck gegeben habe war die Tatsache, das die Ladebox voll aufgeladen schon nach 4 Tagen komplett leer war, obwohl ich die H√∂rer in dieser Zeit nicht benutzt habe. Der Sound und die Passform im Ohr waren bei mir perfekt, aber zu diesem Preis sind die negativen Punkte zu zahlreich in meinen Augen.
Sound quality is really awesome. But there is sound lag while playing a video. Didn't expect this from bose.

I have seen a lot of comments about disconnection. I use these with an IPhone X and they work a treat after firmware update. What I can confirm as a fact is this ( confirmed with many other users on the Bose Community Forum. Connections will drop when used in direct sunlight as the headphones heat up a safety feature kicks in. Whatever Bose say this is a fact and is totally repeatable on multiple headsets and confirmed by many customers. As a customer in the UK this is no big issue, but these were useless by the pool in Italy last week in sunny 28 degree is plus temperatures. My original Soundsport phones worked fine. I have confirmed with Bose the temperature cut off but they say these work up to 50 degrees, which may be true in ambient heat, but even in sunshine at 28 degrees they can get too hot to touch and WILL disconnect. I have an open query with Bose on this now, Please consider before parting with your cash. All that said, work great for UK and in the GYM

I've read the reviews and felt compelled to write one myself since I'm a recent owner of the Bose SoundSport Free headset. Many of the reviews have been one side or the other - not conducting a 'full' test or providing a comparison (specifically when pointing out faults), with little insight as to what the 'user' is looking for from an experience standpoint. With that said, here's my high-level review... I'm running Firmware version 1.4.5 Audio: Superb. I own several headsets (Sony, Beats, Sennheiser, Bose, Apple) and these are excellent. Perfect for those that are athletically active with sound that's delivered crisp and clear, pleasing bass fans such as myself. Comfort level is outstanding and controls are relatively easy to use (some effort pushing the buttons and there is a slight delay on the actual volume control adjustment time, though not a big deal). These are not noise cancelling, but if you're someone for example who jogs where cars are, etc., these block out enough sound, but let in enough noise to keep you cognizant of your surroundings. 5 stars here for the use their intended for (they are named "SoundSport"). Video Audio: Yes, there is a delay - but here is where it resides. If you're using your Phone or Tablet to watch video on a site like YouTube, you most likely will notice the delay in voice to mouth (on either an LTE or WiFi network connection). It's aggravating. However, when I run the same video on a laptop or desktop - there's no delay (same WiFi network). If you have a video that is downloaded, you will not notice a delay at all, no matter the device. With that said, if you're an avid YouTube watcher who uses a phone or tablet for those videos - I'd recommend against purchasing these. 4 stars here - and less if you're someone who streams video to one of the device types I mentioned. Case/Quality/Battery/Comfort/Conectivity: Typical Bose quality - very good to excellent. In ear the buds are extremely comfortable and the battery meets the Bose listed duration time. The case is great (though it will never beat the Apple AirPod case - but again nothing will), charges quickly, and easy to pack away and not worry about charging for the day. Connecting to devices is simple, and the Bose app will update the firmware of the buds over bluetooth - convenient for even the non-technical person. I haven't personally experienced any drops, which have been reported by others, but I wouldn't doubt those issues usually due to interference - something that simply can't be avoided (though some may be worse than others). 4.5 stars here because it's not the Apple AirPod case. Overall: I'm giving these a 4 star rating because they're not perfect for all intended use. While it covers most of what I personally intend to use these for, it's disappointing to witness issues right out of the box regarding video audio delay on portable devices. This issue can be remediated via a software update, but I'd recommend that Bose properly test out 'all' device streaming before releasing future updates. If you're someone who plans to just use these specifically for the audio experience of music, then I'd highly recommend them. You won't experience the drag of wires, uncomfortable ear hooks, or the concern that they may fall out. To summarize, great for those athletically active or music-holics looking for a smaller footprint to carry around, and bad for those looking for a great 'streaming' video experience on 'portable devices.'

These are the first true wireless earbuds that I've purchased. I was very excited and optimistic about them. However, they have a major issue that makes them unusable. The left earbud constantly disconnects. I started using them sitting and I could only go a few minutes before the issue popped up. I then got up and started walking around and they became completely unusable. For something that cost $250 plus tax, this is unacceptable. I've never been so disappointed with any tech product I've purchased. I've only used them for a few hours and I will be returning these immediately. Wait for confirmation from BOSE that this issue is resolved before you buy these. Their response to this issue has bee pathetic.

I would give 0 stars if I could. I don‚Äôt know if fault of seller( product was manufactured may 2018) or its fault of Bose .... but for nearly 20000 buck I expect excellent product. But instead I get product that is showing error as soon I opened and charged it. The speaker won‚Äôt turn.... the left keeps charging even though right is fully charged and then red light starts flashing on the Bluetooth symbol of left ear. Which is error according to Bose support. It has no refund policy too. ..... very disappointed with this... that too after spending so much money.... justified my belief that shouldn‚Äôt buy expensive products from amazon.... just keep it for grocery and small items shopping.

Comprate: 11 Febbraio 2018. Pagate: 199.95‚Ç¨. Modello: Blu e Giallo. Pregi: -Qualit√† dell'audio ottima. -Compatibilit√† con qualsiasi dispositivo. -Comodit√† della cuffie. -Usate fino a 150 km/h in macchina e anche in bicicletta non si staccano MAI. -Prezzo giusto. -Durata della batteria ottima, per non contare che dopo le 3/4 ore che si sono scaricate, le lasci nel case 10 min sono gi√† al 100%. -Applicazione ottima con molte funzionalit√†, come quella dello smarrimento, le ho perse una volte e la funzionalit√† dello smarrimento ha funzionato benissimo, per non parlare del timer standby e molte altre funzioni molto comode. -Facili da pulire e modulari. -Comandi(pulsanti) di ottima fattura e intuitivi. -Molto e dico MOLTO resistenti, mi sono cadute due/tre volte da 2 metri e non si sono rotte, si sono sporcate con polvere e sabbia(al mare le ho portate ovunque), resistenti anche alla pioggia(non so se anche sott'acqua, non ho mai provato, ma non credo). -Usate molte volte anche con orecchie bagnate(dopo doccia o bagni) e non si sono rotte, al contrario di altre cuffie(ehm..Samsung) che si sono rotte subito anche se dichiarano di essere impermeabili. -Funzione pulsante del case(se tenuto premuto si apre, se si preme una volta dice la carica della batteria). -Cerniera del case e case stesso delle cuffie indistruttibili, caduto(purtroppo) da ogni posto. -Materiali del case e delle cuffie ottimi. -Ricarica molto rapida. -Aggancio nell'orecchio Difetti: -Estetica(la gente ti guarder√† davvero male, sembra di avere un apparecchio acustico) -In chiamata si sente solo dall'auricolare destro, scomodo in alcune situazioni. -Ritardo dell'audio(sistemato con un aggiornamento di marzo 2018, basta andare sul sito della Bose o con l'applicazione e seguire le istruzioni) -Microfono non perfetto ma comunque buono(quando si usa ad alte velocit√† √® difficile che l'interlocutore senta bene). Dopo quasi 7 mesi di utilizzo posso dire che sono delle cuffie ottime, usate in qualsiasi situazione, ottime per chi corre e chi va in bicicletta e vuole ascoltarsi un po' di musica, ma ottime anche per chi le vuole usare sul bus o altrove. Acquisto consigliato a chi cerca un buon paio di cuffie.

Ok the sound on these is amazing, very comfortable and i love the charging case etc. But the negatives far outweigh the positives and for ¬£169 wireless earphones they will be going straight back and here's why : I use a 3rd party bluetooth transmitter, a TT-BA01UK, which is plugged into my TV's headphone socket. This has been working flawlessly with a really old pair of Sony MW600 bluetooth wireless earphones. No latency, lag or lip sync issues whatsoever. This transmitter only cost me ¬£16.99 and its been great! I wanted an upgrade on the sound though, so thought spending this much money might be OTT but the sound is great, however, using the same setup i get terrible lag and the lip sync is completely out, almost by a second so its completely useless for watching TV and that was half the reason i got these. There is no feature on my TV to change the audio delay and if they work with my other bluetooth earphones i see no reason why i'd need to anyway? The other problem, i pair these with my laptop running Windows 10 and i only get sound out of the right ear just like if it were a phone call, my laptop thinks it a handsfree mobile headset not wireless headphones, so films etc sound terrible! Again, my trusty and very old MW600 worked correctly and had no issues, so how can a much newer and much, much more expensive product not cope with such a basic connection like his? Surely Bose didn't presume everyone would just be pairing these to a phone and nothing else??? These are bluetooth and this is supposed to be one of the benefits in that you can connect a mulitude of devices to each other isn't it????.... I'm very disappointed. I did check all the reviews relating to this and it was a mixed bag really, so i didn't know what to expect. I would recommend this is you're only going to use them for music, but for anything else like tv or video i'd avoid them completely! It's simply a case that they've released this product without testing them in all connection scenarios first and from such a big name as Bose that's pretty damn shocking!!! This isn't a software fix, they really need to get these redesigned and manufactured so that they work properly and include some low latency hardware like aptX-LL! There are a lot of posts on the Bose community forums, but there are no solutions just a lot of people complaining about the same experiences.. One last grumble and like others have said, these do protrude out of your ears quite a bit, so unless you want to look like a hipster come tattoo artist with dodgy earrings, that might bother you too.. There's no way i'm spending ¬£169 for them just to use only with my phone!

2 year update ------------------ Just as I predicted, gen 2 of this model didn't come out for 2 years and counting and the earphone is very affordable, ragning from $169-$209 for sales. Also heads up that next generation of wireless earbuds will be coming 2020, Bose Earbuds 500 and Bose Noise Cancelling Earbuds 700. They will definitely be more expensive based on historical trend of Bose with their new products the way this earbuds costed $329 on initial launch, so you have a risk free choice to make. 7month reflection (July 6-2018) ------------------------- The price is now $249 compared to $329 when I first got them, which is more affordable, so this is now where you need to use your best judgment to go with cheaper competing brands or go with this one as typical technology upgrade cycle time is about 1year~1.5 year (cellphones especially). I don't think generation 2 of this product will come out any time soon as soundsport wireless earphone (the other popular Bose product that has wires between earbuds) came out way earlier than this product but still has no generation upgrade. For $249, it is worth the price but this is something I've been thinking since the soudsport wireless (not this product but the one that shares similar Frankenstein nail on ears design as this Soundsport free earphones) and that is they can do much better with the design somehow because as a long time Bose fan it's hard to justify the design that is just not comfortable for active movement-based activities (it's irony because they advertise it as a sports accessory but when you actually wear it, the weight of the device makes it go up and down mildly while jogging or rope skipping...it doesn't come out but just having to worry about it is what annoys me) which is why I hope the 2nd gen does make it lighter and more compact design. However, I can tell you with confidence that if you're looking for something that looks cool and premium with great sound, you're looking at the right product. -------------------------------------- 1 week of use (Important: make sure you do firmware update which seems to fix most of the issues that caused low rating for early adapters) So I've been using it for a week including home + outside commute + gym and here are my updated thoughts. 1) 'truly' no wire is awesome Wired to wireless is definitely a great jump but having no wires at all is so comfortable. This truly wireless is at its 1st gen at the moment and by 2-3rd gen, price will drop and things will become more common. 2) sound is amazing but it is not noise cancelling. it performs ok on pop, ballad and great on hiphop as well as classical. Bass is top notch. You can still kind of hear what's happening outside and won't be feeling that isolation QC series does. It is not a negative point because that is not the intent of this product and price is justified from its truly wireless technology and charging capsule. 3) It stays sturdy in your ear. I am using default medium stayhear tips and it doesn't shake or dangle at all during running or other exercises. However, it does go up and down I can feel during rope skipping which made me feel a bit uncomfortable as in it does stay in your ear fine, but I feel distracted that it might come off. I hope next gen makes the earpiece thickness reduced by 30-40% at least to resolve this awkwardness. 4) Signal drop issues have been resolved based on December firmware patches and that's my belief because I never came across drops except when I was a bit far away from sourcing cellphone. The question is, is price of $329 CAD justifiable? personal thoughts. -This earphone is about $50-100 higher price than major competitors at truly wireless segment. Here's some things you pay for in exchange for competitors'. a) stayhear tips - one of the most comfortable ear tips in my audiophile life and using other brands typically require comply foam purchases that incur extra costs in the long run the way my previous earphone did. Earphone foams are important for high level audios for sound isolation and cost of buying does pile up. Bose stayhear doesn't need that. b) charging container lasts two charges with earphone having decent battery c) Bose customer service - There are retail outlets out there and they're known to solve your problem fast and reliably including easy exchange/refunds compared to bad situations I had to go through with others. ----------------------------------------------- Been a long Bose fan since QC15 days and it'd be my first truly wireless earphone. Purchased as my recent sports wireless earphone broke. Amazon.com reviews are horrible due to off-sync and call drop issues but they have been fixed mostly since December 2017 firmware update and at least so far I have not had any issues with such. Video works fine, youtube's fine, Netflix haven't tried. 1. Box Study and magnetic. Box is fairly small and includes everything in a compact manner. 2. Hardware quality Feels very premium and luxurious. Bose did come up with some weird designs occasionally and this one happens to be more on the premium look and less experimental. Further polished based on original soundsport wireless. It comes with two earpieces, charging cable and most importantly, the charging container, which makes it distinctive from soudsport wireless besides it being truly wireless. 3. Sound quality I use Westone 4R, Bose QC25 as a baseline and it's one of the best for sure at its price range as an wireless earphone. Bass is definitely one of Bose's specialties and it definitely does not fail us this time either. Treble/bass balance is decent I personally feel. Guitar riffs sound great as well while Westone sounded clearer but I am talking about quad driver wired earphones. Sound feels very safe and not very adventurous for mainstream users (while price itself is not mainstream). Isolation is decent and sound feels well separated among instruments. 4. Comfort One of my concerns were what if it's too heavy and contrary to my doubts, it doesn't feel heavy on the ears and can wear for a long time while I still advise occasional breaks. Stayhear eartips are what makes Bose earphones so special and is very comfortable on the ear. It fits in the ear very perfectly and does not come loose at all. It comes with small and large sizes as well for your convenience. I will update this product more as I use it but so far it has been amazing. The fact that there is no wire makes so much difference. Only downside of course is hefty entry price of $329 CAD but come to think of it, compared to current bluetooth earphones out there, you get to try the latest technology as of present (truly wireless) + it comes with a charging container, which justifies its price at least relative to current competing bluetooth earphones of $100-250 range out there + Bose's name and customer support which is very good compared and reliable in overall based on my personal experience being assisted with QC25.

Ho acquistato queste cuffiette per fare un regalo a mio fratello poich√© aveva bisogno delle cuffiette bluetooth per andare in palestra. prima di regalarle mi sono permesso di testarle e vedere se funzionassero: MATERIALI: I materiali che compongono il case e le cuffiette sono fatti di plastica di buona qualit√†. Al tatto risultano lisci e con delle buone rifiniture. √® la prima volta che trovo in dotazione delle cuffiette i gommini sigillati in questo modo. ci√≤ fa presagire molto bene sull'attenzione ai dettagli che questa azienda ha impiegato su queste cuffiette. BATTERIA: La durata della batteria √® ottima, sono riuscito a riprodurre ininterrottamente 6 ore di musica, ed avrebbero potuto ancora riprodurre contenuti quando le ho riposte nel case. meno immediata √® la lettura della percentuale della batteria del case, sono presenti tre pallini sulla parte frontale del case i quali indicano il livello di carica. per quanto riguarda invece lo stato della batteria delle cuffiette √® possibile visionarlo direttamente sul cellulare (almeno per quanto riguarda IOS) in alto a destra vicino il simbolo delle cuffie. AUDIO ed ERGONOMIA: Le cuffie sono delle in-ear e si presentano abbastanza ingombranti una volta indossate, ci√≤ √® dovuto dal fatto che all'interno dell'auricolare sono presenti due driver audio: uno dedicato ai suoni alti, ed un'altro per i mid-range e i bassi. per quanto riguarda invece l'audio l'ho trovato molto bilanciato, non ha bassi molto potenti (peccato, mi aspettavo un audio molto pi√π avvolgente e una grande presenza di bassi), ma ho trovato l'esperienza di ascolto molto piacevole. essendo delle cuffie IN-EAR isolano anche molto bene, permettendo una immersione uditiva molto buona. CONNESSIONE: la velocit√† di connessione con il cellulare √® ottima, ci√≤ dovuto anche dal fatto che le cuffiette integrano il chip bluetooth 5.0. appena viene aperto lo sportello del case le cuffie si connettono e tempo di indossarle sono gi√† pronte per la riproduzione. GESTURE: una chicca che ho trovato su queste cuffie sono le gesture, che vengono gestite da dei sensori di sfioramente sulle cuffiette. √® possibile alzare il volume (tocco prolungato cuffia dx) o abbassarlo (tocco prolungato cuffia sx), mettere in pausa o play (doppio tocco su dx o sx) skip in avanti della traccia (triplo tocco sulla dx) o skip indietro della traccia (triplo tocco sulla sx) in conclusione consiglio vivamente queste cuffie, l'audio √® molto bilanciato ed hanno un' ottima autonomia. SE LA RECENSIONE E LE FOTO TI SONO RISULTATE UTILI RINGRAZIAMI CLICCANDO "SI" IN BASSO!

A dire il vero, preciso di avere un paio di cuffie Bose, come cuffie principali. Tuttavia, ho constatato che in estate sono calde, fanno sudare e sono piuttosto grandi da portare con s√© durante i viaggi. Cos√¨ ho pensato di cercare delle cuffie facilmente trasportabili e meno ingombranti. Non volevo spendere circa ‚Ç¨ 150 per una coppia di auricolari AirPods della Apple, quindi ho fatto una ricerca e ho trovato questi auricolari. E, a dire il vero, li adoro! Li uso gi√† da un paio di settimane e sono ancora nella fase ‚Äúsei l‚Äôamore della mia vita‚Äù; in ogni caso, cercher√≤ di essere il pi√π obiettivo possibile. [Qualit√† del suono] Bassi potenti e acuti chiari e cristallini. Quando sono inseriti correttamente, questi auricolari stupiscono per la potenza e qualit√† dei suoni bassi. Per questo consiglio di prestare particolare attenzione nello scegliere i cuscinetti in silicone che si adattano comodamente al proprio canale uditivo, senza lasciare spazi vuoti all‚Äôinterno dell‚Äôorecchio. [Comodit√†] Nella confezione ci sono cuscinetti auricolari in silicone di 3 dimensioni, quindi sicuramente si potr√† scegliere quella che pi√π si adatta alle proprie esigenze. Come ho gi√† detto, bisogna scegliere quelli pi√π comodi e che non lasciano spazi vuoti nelle orecchie in modo da ottenere una migliore qualit√† del suono. [Isolamento acustico] Fantastico! Li ho usati anche in aereo e faticavo a rendermi conto di essere in volo. Quando li uso in ufficio, le persone spesso devono agitare le mani per attirare la mia attenzione, perch√© non sento altro se non la mia musica (con il volume al 70%). [Durata della batteria] Usandoli da 10 giorni, per un‚Äôora al giorno circa, questa √® la prima volta che devo ricaricare la base. Posso quindi dire che la durata totale della batteria, compresa la carica completa della base, √® di circa 10 ore. [Altre note] L'operazione di associazione (pairing) √® davvero semplice. Ho notato che anche se li spengo e li conservo nella custodia, dopo un po‚Äô si riconnettono al mio iPhone. Ho dovuto quindi ‚Äúdisconnettere‚Äù gli auricolari, entrando nelle impostazioni di iPhone, per spegnerli completamente. Ora devo collegarli manualmente all'iPhone ogni volta che li uso. Ma questo non √® un grosso problema. [Conclusioni] Non c‚Äô√® da pagare ‚Ç¨ 150 per gli AirPods. S√¨, certamente possono essere pi√π fantasiosi, sembrano pi√π belli e sono connessi a Siri, ma sinceramente non credo che tutto questo possa giustificare la differenza di prezzo. Sono innamorato di questi auricolari e ad oggi ne sono ancora innamorato.

Delle cuffiette leggere e compatte, non solo permettono di ascoltare bene la musica, ma anzi, durano tantissimo e restano collegate anche se il cellulare √® a qualche metro, perfette per fare pulizia di casa senza dover avere sempre al seguito lo smartphone o l'mp3, dulcis in fundo ci sono tanti gommini che permettono di adattare bene l'ascolto
